nLn-QflJkKlfyIeJ_5hh3g.text: Meh....stopped by this past Saturday for a bite as my daughter and I were walking the strip.  Service was quick and polite.  The menu and the waiter both mentioned a 45 minute wait (from ordering) for any deep dish.  We were ok with it.  Pizza came out about the 55 minute mark so no complaints there.  As far as food goes, they were out of the cheesy bread so couldn't try those, had the mozzarella sticks and calamari while we waited.  Both were fine, nothing fabulous, nothing terrible.  Kind of in the middle.   We shared a Meat meat and more meat deep dish.  It looked delicious.  The taste was good...again, kind of in the middle. Not amazing, not bad.  I can't say that I've had True (in Chicago) style deep dish, so as far as composition of the pie goes, I can only say I like crust that has some chew to it.  I prefer a good ratio of ingredients to sauce to crust.  For this pie, the meats all had good flavor, the sauce was good, the crust was a bit crunchy...but I think all in all was a bit too much for me.   This probably solidified for me that I prefer NY style to Chicago style.  I'm sure if you prefer deep dish this is great, however for me the 45 min wait isn't worth mediocrity.  Not with so many other options out there.

VokiB55zM0BoYphzk633eQ.text: My wife and I decided to eat here for her birthday , we were told the pizza would take 50-55 minutes to cook ( really) . We ordered it anyway.. we also ordered a wedge salad.. it was 6 pieces of Romain  lettuce laid flat on a plate, tomatoes,bacon, and next to no dressing. We asked our server if we could move to a booth and were told No . He informed us they were for bigger parties.. (Are you kidding me  what happened to customer service? ).. our pizza finally showed up it was warm at best. I wonder if they use a temp prob to check if the meats are cooked all the way ? The server came by to check on us and I mentioned that the pizza was warm and not hot , he took the pizza to the back and when he returned it was burnt.. but at least it was hot. .. If you're looking for great pizza I wouldn't come here, it's good at best. Customer service is not that important to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt pizza

ZWpw12ewcRdHLsNQztwVFw.text: Chicago deep dish pizza in Vegas!  Now that's a great combination.   I've had Giordanos in Chicago so had a craving for deep dish.   They don't take reservations so are a very late dinner.  Part of our party went earlier to get a table so they were also able to order the pizza since it takes about 45 minutes.   If you haven't had deep dish pizza before it's very very filling so if you normally eat 3 slices of thin crust you might just get filled up with one slice.     We parked at Paris and it's kinda a long walk from the parking garage to the restaurant which is located in the grand shoppes at Bally's.

JJkjkvbMv15_vfHbWQC5CA.text: Four stars for the food and 3.5 for the service. Out server did just enough to get by but we had to stop her and ask for water refills, a couple of Pepsi's and silverware.  About a 45 min wait for the deep dish but that's usual. We also got cheesy garlic bread and bruschetta.  Everything was very good and as usual, we couldn't finish the pizza.  Downstairs seating won't take a group over 4 unless you sit at the bar. They also have a small to go window near the escalator with 6" pizzas.

3u9GqAnQ4H6zjy0NgD1shw.text: Not sure what all the hype is about. The pizza is meh. The wings were good and the service was good so I'm giving them 4 stars based on that. The pizza would be a 2 or 3 star experience. I found the dough and the sauce to be bland and boring. I'll take east coast pizza over Chicago style any day of the week.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings with ranch - good

Aq8BeM_u73DOJMZxqArl9A.text: I finally got to check out Giordano's "Famous Stuffed Deep Dish Pizza" and yay..i'm a fan!  Here's my Giordano's journey on a Thursday..  11:30 AM - Finance Department mom orders eight 6' personal pizzas on the interwebs. Each one is unique with their toppings.. 12:20 PM - We arrive at the pick up window for our order.  The hostess informs us that it will be ready in 10 minutes. 12:30 PM - Pizzas are out, and we are heading back to the office... 1:01 PM - Pizzas are distributed and my 6' Famous Stuffed Deep Dish Pizza topped and stuffed with pepperoni, jalapenos and mushrooms is on my desk. 1:06 PM - My 6' Famous Stuffed Deep Dish Pizza topped and stuffed with pepperoni, jalapenos and mushrooms is is in my belly.  The personal sized 6' Famous Stuffed Deep Dish Pizza is very filling considering it's size and is just over 1,200 calories. (per their website)  There's only 4 thick slices, and it's very cheesey af (like me) and extremely tasty.  The ingredients are high quality and the preparation is on point.    We had a very good pick up experience. The location isn't the easiest to get to but my next visit will be a dine in option so I can tear into that pizza right out of the oven.  That's another Yelp tale, enjoy!

pFQxIEuWENAKsHXgryRkTA.text: I had a really good experience dining here. Me and a friend walked in here on a weekend afternoon and were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice and promptly took our order. The pizza was of course amazing, which I already expected having had tried it in Chicago. This is the only other location outside of chi-town where you can get Giordano's pizza (apart from ordering a frozen one online). Highly recommended!

oLm6Y0LxnQAXb1-u9Zbkfg.text: High quality ingredients, but terrible wait times.  The Chicago style pizzas I am used to eating come out piping hot.  Almost like a light lasagna on a crust!  I have been here three times, and 100% of the time the pizzas were barely warm and cooled completely by the time you reach the halfway mark.  Not sure what they're doing out there, but they need serious improvement gauging the necessary time to deliver a hot pizza.  Major let down for the 3rd, and possibly final time.

dn_y5T6v7MIqs2CUHMu2_w.text: If you're in the mood for Chicago style pizza then this place is for you. It is located in Bally's Grand Bazaar Shops. Either you can seat in the outdoor bar or indoor which is the actual restaurant (located up the elevator by the left). I've had Giordanos before in Chicago and ordered the create your own lunch with garlic parmesan fries on the side. I really loved it. Came in here last sunday noon with family. Waiting line is about 5-10mins. We we're seated by the window overlooking the city. We ordered Garlic Parmesan Fries, Lasagna with a house made marinara sauce and a small special deep dish pizza. Server told us that it will took 45minutes to 1 hour for the food to arrive due to the style of the pizza.  Food came out hot, fresh and cheesy. It was all good we finished everything except the deep dish, I can only eat 1 slice (So stuffed already). Great Service, Yummy pizza and Good location. You can also order online and pick it up on the window (not sure if they deliver). Happy hour is weekdays from 3-6pm.

ZckrzDj6RUt85amdw25FcQ.text: First time here.  We ate at the indoor portion of the restaurant.  As we were seated the waitress let us know there would be a 45 min wait for deep dish pizza.  That's what we came for so we waited.  Just about exactly 45 min our pizza came out just as expected.  The small meat and more meat was more than enough for myself and my husband, we were left with 2 slices to take.  Lots of cheese!!  We also had an order of the jalapeno lime wings and the flavor was ok(hubby's choice), would have liked to try the reg buffalo but I was there for pizza LOL.  Waiter was nice and kept my soda filled before I even finished the last one.  We arrived just before 5 and got a seat promptly.  The line was long on our way out at about 6:15 so we got there at just the right time to not have to wait.  Would go back again for sure when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starters

Q5SJ2TSGB8QU8_Fvrcbo_A.text: First time visiting and I found it crazy how the first thing the server said to me was that if we ordered a deep dish it would take at minimum 45 minutes for a deep dish. We were so hungry so we ordered their sampler and it was delicious. Their sangria was a basic tasting but helped passed time while we waited for our pizza. All I can say is the pizza was worth the wait. It was cheesy and full of flavor. Definitely a go to when visiting the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and more meat deep dish

X1kU3l-TpoWZvkDM29rJrg.text: My friends and i wanted to try deep dish since we dk when we will be in chicago ever to get the real thing and this is a huge famous chain. Got the sampler which was pretty good came with brushetta, mozarella sticks, pizza bread? And chicken which we got ranch and buffalo sauce for. Was perfect for 4 girls the brushetta tasted fresh and refreshing! Onto the pizza itself we got the chicago classic which had pepperoni, mushroom, onion and green peppers in it. It was between that and meat lovers but we chose the classic. PIZZA TAKES 45min so order that quick if you are deciding on appetizers. We were starving and it was satisfying. The toppings were inside the pizza not on top which was an interesting surprise. It was good not the best pizza i've had but i may be bias to nyc pizza thin crust. The thick crust wasn't bad but maybe the toppings itself didn't seem as hot and cooked to me idk?  Was sad they had a deal on appetizers too because of HH or something but u could only eat it if you sat at the bar. Fairly big venue we sat inside on the top floor of the restaurant they have another on the first floor of the little store strip. Huge windows we had to ask to put the shade down because the sun was blinding.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7X3e05h1ZGieuO1HHBwNFQ.text: Chicago's great stuffed pizza has come to the desert. Literally tastes as if I'm sitting downtown off Michigan Ave. eating this delicious pie full of meat, veggies & cheese.   To-go or dine-in is amazing. Currently there's no delivery. Parking is kind of a pain but the pizza makes it worth it.   If you've never had stuffed pizza, go for it. This is different than deep dish. Try the stuffed with spinach if you want one that's more "heart healthy" or go with our fave, double pepperoni and double onion.    We took ours to-go and the service was great.   Everything is fresh and tastes, well, no words to describe the taste. Have fun and come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IS9CDc39RVx7pKgjNsGdHA.text: Even though I'll forever like Gino's east the best, I had to Admit That this deep dish was great too-I had spinach and pepperoni; and the chicken parmigian was so good we went back for more the next day! Pricing is reasonable too.  Good go to place for the ultra low key dinner type.

Xl17ZTYPeC1Z5AfD-1_EvQ.text: I don't leave reviews. But Bruce deserved one. That guy will take care of you! He's SO friendly and attentive. I don't know how he can be that positive in 109 degree weather (my husband and I chose to sit outside even though they have an air-conditioned indoor dining area). Not to mention the food is AMAZING. We had the calamari and Chicago classic deep dish. Do yourself a favor and go get those. Now. Ask for Bruce.

YW1mnSuf8RrHJymnxup5IQ.text: Wow this place. Is shit.....don't waste your money. Would not let me sit because my wife had a piece of chicken from neighboring restaurant. I explain she can not eat cheese I was going to purchase a large for me and pitcher of beer if available would not let me sit inside. Had to eat outside. And bought from takeout  6 inch pizza 16 oz beer 20 bucks. Not worth 20 cents piece of shit pizza and service. Won't be back

SN_v_NkeXSlr582FkIE3xA.text: Hubby and I have been big fans of this chain ever since visiting one on our way between MI and MO. We love to share a small, meat-filled deep-dish Pizza and eat the whole thing by ourselves. I think the dough is perfect - very buttery and almost flaky, never burnt or crispy. It's absolutely FILLED with sauce, toppings and, most importantly, CHEESE.   The only downside to deep dish? A very long wait. You might wait for a table if it's busy. Then wait to order because people can't decide what to order. Then you wait about thirty minutes for your pizza to cook. So imagine my husband's happiness when I informed him that this location has person size deep-dish Pizza to-go. No waiting. They ready before you even place your order. Perfect.   Personally, I really prefer the full Size pizzas because I feel they have a better relation of dough to fillings. But it's nice that this location can get be you either depending on what you want.   I've also tried a couple thin crust pizzas. The BBQ Chicken definitely stood out and I would absolutely order it again!  This place really does have friendly and helpful service. Stop by!

XMaw3bTN_cjXMZDn6ro5WA.text: Initial waiting was given as 30 to 35 mins but we have waited for 45 minutes to get a beg thin crust pizza and pizza is not worth of the waiting time. It is just okay.

8PMbeSOcjgP3HxaI204P6g.text: I think my excitement and hunger were expecting more.  I might try it again.  But for now I'm going to say I wasn't positively impressed.

YWnXeX46CY3V9QLkep4pZQ.text: Delicious pizza! We always get a large and then end up taking it home. Not only is it delicious on the spot, but giordanos reheats like no other and on a different level.   Great location, able to get a decent view of the bellagio fountains. Does have a bit of a wait once you sit down and place your order but not too ridiculous.   Always a great place to bring friends and family when visiting.   Protip- don't order a personal - just suck it up and split a large.

JYkq9gsOYRqyf8Cq9CVedA.text: Yummy. Dined here solo and had an individual pizza with garlic and green olives. Weird combo but delicious.

2IYVLp9mtO5HWvO4aw7GPQ.text: Love this True and delicious Chicago pizza option on the Vegas strip. Get the deep dish. It's worth it.

FrfhAZk9lete9TArV_nXCw.text: This is a must stop for pizza lovers in Las Vegas, you can taste the high quality ingredients in these pies. Great Mai Thais too

wLtRomktpwljEBAk6P140A.text: This place was great.   My husband is from Chicago and always raved about the pizza.   We wanted a low key casual dinner and this was a excellent choice.   The drinks, pizza & salad were delicious.   Our waiter was super nice and the atmosphere was casual but warm. It was a good choice.  You will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VCzeP5JT-ieN0Rxur4rOHA.text: God bless America ! They put a Giordanos in Las Vegas ! Finally . No more Chicago trips. If deep dish was a Jedi , Giordanos would be Yoda. It's one bad mother fucker. Give em an hour though, deep dish takes 45 to cook and 15 to cool and let the cheese set up.  Lou Malnati's is great in Chicago but IMO it doesn't compare. Outside dining in Vegas! It's beautiful and attached to Bally's . Free WiFi with an outside sports bar. Right off the strip but hidden and not too busy.  The sampler was surprisingly high quality too. Oh, real parm cheese in their table shakers! Not that fake dried stuff . A nice touch !

soqpYwYg675Y-gvikRuemg.text: Absolutely the worst customer service I've ever received at a restaurant.   Brought several visitors from out of the country that were here for a sporting championship; as happens when organizing 10 out of towners to meet in a foreign country, we started with 5 that showed up on time.   We only took up a 5 top. We ordered pizza and several pitchers of drinks while waiting for the rest to arrive.   Once they did, we asked if we could join an adjacent empty 5 top to our table to accommodate the new guests.   We were told by the hostess that we had been there two hours already and were messing up her wait times. I didn't think that was right for her to say, so I went to the manager on duty.   He reiterated what the hostess said and told me we had been there two hours already and were messing up his quote times.   This is after the 5 of us (on a 5 top) had been ordering the whole time we were there.   I asked for the bill immediately; he said "fine". It then took 30 minutes for them to produce the bill and process 3 payments. All the while now 10 of us were standing around the table, waiting to leave. There were 9 empty tables in the restaurant by the time we left. We went downstairs to Wahlburger and spent another $500.   Absolutely appalling service displayed by Giordanos. I'm local, and in the industry.   I will be telling EVERYONE I know that they should steer clear of the place, unless they want to be put on a timer.

X4d3VV0EEuP8y6gL4y5hXA.text: My friend highly recommended this place because she had tried it in Chicago and loved it so we decided to have dinner here. The patio outside doesn't seat parties of 5 so we had to go to the indoor seating. We arrived at 7pm. The hostess quoted us for a 30 to 40 minute wait. We put a name and number down and pre ordered the pizza once we figured out what we wanted: deep dish chicken bacon bbq. While my friend was pre ordering the pizza,  I noticed a couple come up and put their name down for a party of 11 and a pre order. After 10 minutes,  we received a text at 7:20 saying our wait time was bumped up to 60 to 70 minutes. Then a minute later we got another text saying our table was ready. We were seated and told the waiter that we had a pre order already and he went to check on it.    At 8:15, the table of 11 received their 3 pizzas before us. A table of 4 that sat after us as well received their pizzas as well.  We didn't receive our pizza until 8:40. When we asked the waiter why our pizza took so much longer than normal even after we preordered and came before the other tables, he gave us a half assed  answer saying they preordered and he doesn't know how the system works up there. The waiter noticed that the party of 11 got their pizzas first and tried to assure is ours would come soon. He kept dodging our table and would go around even though we were seated next to the kitchen. After we questioned him on the pizza time,  he stopped asking us how we were doing.  If the waiter or the hostess messed up on our order it would be understandable but they didn't tell us about it and tried to half ass a response instead of fixing it. The service sucks.  The food is good. I understand it takes time to cook fresh pizza but when you have to wait over an hour for food and see tables that were seated after you and they get their pizzas first,  then the taste of the pizza isn't really that worth it. My friends enjoyed the pizza because they were so damn hungry but I couldn't stop being irritated at the lack of etiquette and respect for the consumer.   Again,  food is good. But our experience here for the first time was terrible.

MI3ZYDeSyQsI7IlOdbfHEA.text: A Chicago favorite in the middle of Las Vegas!  Located in Bally's Grand Bazaar.  They actually have 2 locations which was kind of a surprise:  one in the center of the Bazaar that is covered & have plenty of fans, but they consider it outdoor seating, & one at the top of the escalators behind the Giordano's sign, which is indoors.  The host & our server emphasized to us that a deep dish would take 30-45 minutes.  But our server, Carolina, would not give us a chance to look over the menu!  The restaurant was not busy, this was our first time dining with them, we did not know what we wanted, but I kid you not, she came by 4 times within 5 minutes asking if we were ready.  The Special (sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, onions):  A small (6 slices) were plenty for the 2 of us.  Get your fork & knife ready because it is definitely a hearty meal!  The crust was very hard.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Special

MOslKoggkC4mr_RuiqnWcg.text: Heard more than enough good things about Giordanos and was finally given the opportunity to give it a try when I came to Las Vegas. Ordered a bunch of things from the menu but had to go with the classic Chicago Styled Pizza with extra cheese! Let me tell you that it lived up to the height and will have me coming back again every time I find myself back in Vegas. Just a heads up it's located right before entering the Bally's Hotel where you get seated right across from a view of the strip. Was lucky enough to get Logan as our waiter who took care of our fat boy cravings during this dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XnxR83r4n-Ka3CDFbk7Nrw.text: This was the best part of my vacation!! My father is from Chicago, so of course I know a good deep dish. I first fell in love with Gino's East in Chicago, now Giordano's hold the number two spot in my heart!!   We arrived during lunch hour, there were six of us. Sadly the AC wasn't working, the hostess asked if we preferred to dine downstairs where it was cooler. Everyone declined due to the 30min wait time. So we stayed upstairs, My husband and I didn't mind the warmer temperature...side note! My apologies to the staff! Two of our cousins made rude comments about the AC....These southern idiots could've went downstairs, but decided to complain. Classic ignorance...  Food:  Everyone knows a Chicago deep dish takes 30-40mins to order. We selected two Large deep dish pizzas the "Meat & More Meat" and the "Classic Chicago". Talk about perfection!!! We had PLENTY of leftovers! To my surprise the Pizza was even better the second day! My favorite part was the crust! Still dreaming about it! Thank you  Giordano's!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

za3ZtAP9gkD6ILZUgmMeoA.text: Save yourself and trip and go to Maggiano's if you're craving Italian. We were all looking forward to this place because of the stellar reviews but this place is shit! The pizza was cold and tasted nothing like cheese or sauce. The lasagna.... well let's just say stouffers heated up in the microwave tastes better that whatever I was served. My friend ordered spaghetti. How does one fuck up spaghetti??? But it was done y'all. The meat sauce was dark brown and had either absolutely no flavor or someone screwed up in the kitchen. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

UYpALY1Ur9yCssXLSWOOpw.text: Walk in to this world famous place, hoping it would be just like Chicago with a Vegas flair. Our waiter has an Italian accent told us about the pizza and it would take about 45 minutes to cook. Since our time was limited we decided to just order appetizer sampler plate. Well that is it got started, he rolled his eyes like he worked getting commission on how many pizza he sold.First he brought us Diet Coke or Pepsi and was never to be seen. Finally we saw him ask for another glass of soda he said Pepsi said yes regular Pepsi again he brought another diet. After we ate our food he started to pick up the plates slamming them together and throwing the silverware on to the plates. When we ask for the check he just slammed the little machine on the table and walk away to the table next to us . I just swiped my card grabbed the receipt and walk away, then as we where leaving he turn around and pick up the machine. Wish we would of not left any tip. The one star is for the rude service he gave us not the food which was great. If you go there stay away from this server extremely rude if you don't order pizza.

z4nK1TuCUy05GqaMLtTZDQ.text: One word describes Giordanos well: Mediocre. It's not significantly expensive enough to warrant anything but the food is pretty mediocre and bland. Setting-wise it's fairly scenic. It's placed in the middle of a complex of small variety shops. What doesn't work, however, is the greenhouse area. It gets intensely warm in the greenhouse so I would highly suggest eating inside. Apparently Giordanos is known for their deep dish pizza but if you plan on buying it prepare yourself for a 45 minute to an hour wait. It wasn't even worth the wait. All I received was a bland mash. The salad was pretty good but everything else like the meatballs and the thin crust pizza are just okay; not anything exciting or good enough.   I would not recommend this to friends or family but if you have many enemies then this is your place.

pO9t8Mt_8kqPhqnJHL8Veg.text: I've loved this place since first visiting in Chicago 20 years ago. Nice to see one in Vegas. Had the chicken parm and it was great. Not terribly expensive (for Vegas) and very filling. They have a few craft beers on tap too which is nice. Service was also excellent.

s6nV_9Bdm2AQn7uyLc3tkA.text: I was floored by the quality of the pizza here. Deep Dish perfection and I do mean DEEP! It does take about 45 minutes all in to get your pie, but it was so worth the wait! Made on demand, fresh from scratch, yummm! Drinks are reasonably priced (for Vegas anyways) and the staff was incredibly friendly. My wife and I were celebrating our marriage and birthdays that weekend and this was a fit last meal on the strip. We will definitely return!

RUPrPFuAGcJNtC7uAK0LoA.text: Amazing , we've been to the Chicago location and this is just as yummy! Can't wait to come back!

ZgdtEYLjLOLsWAe2jgG5sw.text: They pizza was delicious!!! Fresh and hot!!! Yummy  Our server Dominick was awesome!!

2TWypqpNJx1gn7qaoABSoQ.text: Great atmosphere. Good Pizza. Good Calamari. Best of all you can have your own drink there...Yayyyyyyy  Overall great experience Pizza was huge.. A small pizza was enough for 4 adults. Small adults let me put that into perspective. We also had an order of fried calamari as appetizer and we each had our own drinks that we had previously bought elsewhere.  ON a sunday night we only waited to be seated about 15 minutes. The pizza itself did take about 40 minutes to cook but this is because it's a deep dish.

xK0LJp-bVN55pWTeuB0F7g.text: Here's a tip for you... If you are ever in Vegas and want a good pizza go to Giordano's, I promise you won't be disappointed! It's the best pizza we have ever had!

_VA8WXB5gpL0DlI2cTAZRQ.text: Thank you to the Director Of Operations Micheal for going above and beyond my expectations in fixing my experience from the previous visit . The food was excellent, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was Great! I will definitely be back and tell my friends and co workers about my experience  Thank you Giordano"s

gcC9cgkQAkH1QLWwueH9Cg.text: This was amazing wish I had a place like this I. Cali. Best service, best pizza and the whole experience was amazing.

bQyOWy9J56-5bZm3V-8EQQ.text: Finally got to try Chicago pizza without going all the way to Chicago! If you LOVE cheesy oooey gooey pizza this is your place. Just keep in mind it's very filling, a small pan can feed 3 people! I can usually have 3 slices of pizza but here I could only handle 1 slice. Pizza takes about 45 min to bake so order a salad while you wait. Still dreaming about this delicious pizza....

lqTPxDzen6a_rVmproECrg.text: Stopped by on a Friday night and was surprised by how fast we got seated, even for a group of 5. We started off with Giordano's Sampler which comes with wings, cheesy garlic bread, mozzarella triangles and loaded potato fritters. The cheesy garlic bread was to die for, in my opinion, and my favorite thing I had during our whole meal!   We ordered 2 deep dish pizzas, the Chicago Classic and Meat and More Meat. Personally, I love veggies so I preferred the Chicago Classic. If you love cheese, these pizzas are definitely for you! You won't be disappointed with the TV-like stringy cheese action when you pull the slices apart. Only downside is how long these babies take to cook. Our waitress did let us know it would take about 45 minutes for them to bake. So I definitely suggest ordering an appetizer to hold you over while you wait.   I am not the biggest fan of deep dish pizzas in the first place, but if heaps of sauce, cheese and toppings are your thing, I'm sure you'll enjoy this place.

1aF5D-BRMAmfpbMTAa0v8A.text: I have been to several Giordano's in Chicago and Orlando many times, the visit to Las Vegas was the worst experience.  We called to ask how long the wait was, we were told there was not a wait.    We arrived and were told there was a 30 minute wait and the air conditioned was out.  Once we were seated (out side in 100 degree weather) the food was very slow and the waitress only stopped at our table a couple times.    The one good thing was the pizza was good.    In town with a group of guys, would love to retry the restaurant, can you help.

8YFmwEazHRsewuPOD7xBkA.text: The food was really good, but they got my order wrong so they brought it out late and I couldn't eat with my friends. Then they calculated the bill wrong but the manager didn't fix it and I was pretty annoyed at that point so I just said whatever and paid the extra money. Overall, if they don't mess up your order and learn how to calculate a bill correctly, I'd recommend this place.  UPDATE: The owner of the restaurant contacted me and actually apologized that there was the slip in service. I was very surprised by the integrity and attitude of the owner of the restaurant! Because of this I will go back and try it again. There is something to be said for people who run their businesses like that and who are willing to make things right for the customer. Just based on that alone I recommend going here.

olQGtjBeTbhHTTcKdK8QoQ.text: I came across this place on Instagram after Zagat refrenced this spot. I then found one of their locations in las vegas which was coincidentally where I was located for the Christmas holiday. It is located outside of Bally's off the las vegas strip. Our server was Sarah, she was conciderate, attentive, and charismatic which made the atmosphere that much more positive.  The Chicago style deep dish pizza I ordered was the "meat and more meat." It was unlike any pizza I have had before, and that is the primary reason why I gave this place a chance on Christmas day. The bruschetta was recommended by Sarah as an appetizer and was delicious way to start. IF YOU SIGN UP FOR THE ENEWS through yelp, you get you choice of garlic cheese bread or bruschetta for FREE, which I did!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They ship ANYWHERE
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Leftover pizza and bruschetta
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_X1mUQuOCFobiTmK56WCXQ.text: One of the first places my mom and I stopped at for food, and it was worth every second! Even though they're very well know for their deep-dish pizza, it takes about 45 minutes to make and the server tells you this right away. That's just nice that they do that and not letting you find out how long it would take to get their signature dish. But everything else we got on the menu was DELICIOUS!  I got the meatball sub the first night, and the starter platter (which had a great variety of choice to eat from). And my mom got the salads both times and loved the presentation and flavor of the two different kinds of greens. The service was so friendly and courteous, and I wish there was Giordanos in Cleveland because sauce in my meals was amazing and unforgettable. Also, just ignore of the other customers that come there and aren't as grateful for their yummy meals. I'd recommend the outdoor bar to hang out with your friends and enjoy Giordanos brilliant starters & entrees!

Pm0ZuD-Cne7TiegueK_RUA.text: A friend recommended this place to us and even met us down here for dinner. We started with salads and shared a deep dish pizza. It was delicious!

AjdvJaRPNBeqk_Vqx43p1g.text: Excellent pizza!!!  You should expect to wait 45mins to an hour for a deep dish pizza.  It's totally worth the wait.  The place is very busy so service is not the quickest.  The manager apologized and offer us a dessert since we waited so long but didn't have any room after we ate.   Great place to bring the family!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 of us ate half a pizza.

p7UsFrloK7UyQha6B-VktA.text: It was a year ago that I was stranded in Chicago and ran into this amazing place. Living in Vegas now after leaving the Forum Shops one night, I got a glimpse of a sign that read "Giordanos". I couldn't believe my eyes as soon as I got home I yelped and noticed it had recently open so the next day I had to go have it.  Best pizza ever! Excellent service all the way from host, server, and bussers.   I'll be returning here at least once a month!!

u3MaoJTw5oVY6ItDjB8HDA.text: Stop the car, run to this place! By far the best Chicago deep dish pizza I have ever had! The deep dish is made like it is in Chicago! They matched the water conditions as how they are in Chicago! The opening team is from Chicago and wants this place to be like it is in Chicago! Highly impressed with the service and quality of food! Pizza is flavorful, quality ingredients, crust is light and flaky which is not something you taste with a deep dish! The restaurant is clean, bright and open. Staff is alert and friendly! I had the garlic cheese bread and it was awesome! A small deep dish is more than enough for 2 people! I was stuffed at the end of the meal! You will not leave here starving! I will make this a regular hang out!! Very happy we have deep dish Chicago pizza that is really from Chicago!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H8cxTHL5rcPque2B4UY3Qg.text: Came in to eat a dip dish pizza with my family got here at 10:40PM by the time they took our order it was 11PM and they said they aren't serving full size PIZZA deep dish ! Only individuals 6 inch or flat pizza..... how is that your known seat ppl with out letting them know they can't get what they came for ended up getting a thin pizza that was garbage...

5Tw4a2UP4OThBJjJfUxoAQ.text: It was a great first experience, we ordered the cheesy garlic bread and Buffalo wings for starters and had no regrets because we LOVED IT! As for our pizza I recommend their famous deep dish pizza "Meat and more Meat" which was balanced with flavor and I usually don't eat my crust but it was really crispy and I couldn't resist. This place is pizza heaven!!!

ztanB8pD-Qo-YrwHwUKt4g.text: We got a small, cheese pizza...$20. A bit pricey for a simple cheese pizza. Server warns you that your food will be a 45-60 min wait. Yikes. The food was so darn good though that it made up for the steep price and wait.

etyvrFpMfDtIPgQunkiZRA.text: We had lunch here today. We were seated for about 8 minutes or so before our server arrived to take our drink order. He was extremely busy and was moving as fast as he could so I don't fault him . I felt the drinks took a significant amount of time to arrive as well, but perhaps this is simply due to the initial wait. Our pizza was served and when we grabbed the stack of plates that was on the table, 3 out of four were noticeably dirty. There was actually like a blob of marinara stuck to one of them. Our server was very apologetic and replaced them immediately. The meal itself was delicious. We had pizza and a chicken Parmesan sandwich. I would return to give it another shot because the food was good and the server (Jesus I believe) was very friendly. If I had the same experience with the wait or dirty utensils, I would understand that this is the way they staff their restaurant and would choose not to return. All in all, it was an ok experience.

gA8BhdWLpjkQ7K8x49nEsA.text: I was in Vegas for business and in the mood for Chicago Pizza, but did not see any good options on Yelp.  While driving back to my hotel, I saw out of the corner of my eye a Giordano's sign in front of Bally's.  I was ecstatic and did a quick u-turn and parked at Bally's.  When I arrived at Giordanos, the hostess informed me they had opened just the day before.  Because of this I expected poor service.  I was pleasantly surprised by the service and the pizza was what I expected - AMAZING!!!!!   I got the garlic cheese bread to help get me through the 45 min wait for my pizza.  I fully expected the pizza to take this long and was actually happy to hear about the wait.  As a transplanted Chicagoian who travels a fair amount for business, I am always on the lookout for REAL Chicago pizza.  I make a habit of calling ahead and ask how long it takes to cook the pizza.  If they tell me anything less than 45 min, I hang up and look for other dinner options.  When the pizza arrived, it was well worth the wait!!!!!!  While there I learned they have a pickup window at street level.  Good  to know that is an option.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SrrczJ2Z7cJkS0mULYuFZw.text: Spaghetti, hot wings and Pizza that's all I have too say. This place is great, I ate at the one in Chicago and in Las Vegas both excellent

kQYkllgxVbh8ZYpKy6jBQg.text: The chicken Parmesan was so delicious. It came with spaghetti, it tastes so good. I highly recommend this place for people who seek authentic Italian food. Definitely 5 stars. And a great view.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VHC0NXPlz3YyE7-0FUJuCw.text: Great Chicago style pizza for being outside of Chicago. They screwed up my online order but fixed it and the manager comped  the whole meal. Will definitely come here again.

An2CX8hDLNuR31CvFAlmpQ.text: Amazing experience overlooking the bellajio fountains and awesome atmosphere with friendly staff all while enjoying a very tasty pizza!

Y6pT-L74dMiC1g0g1wZXIw.text: I've had the original Giordanos many times before... and I've definitely considered flying to Chicago a few times for the sole purpose of pizza.  I was a bit nervous to try this location figuring it wouldn't live up to its flagship, but it did a pretty good job.  Prices were fair and the atmosphere was great.  From the bar and some tables, you have a view of Bellagio's fountains.  I sat at the bar and the bartender was very friendly.  Consistently re-filled my drink, don't think it ever fell below half empty.  They do tell you upfront that the pizzas typically take 35-45 minutes.  Around the 30 minute mark, the bartender was apologetic and assured me it would be out soon.  As we approached 45, he once again apologized and said his manager could offer an appetizer while I waited.  Though I declined, I really appreciated the gesture.  Knowing how long the pizzas take from previous experiences, I wasn't aggravated by the wait time.  Around 50 minutes, my pizza came out, and yes it was worth the wait.  Would definitely visit again.

J6hm5GyT1hGgwhzB_4HM2Q.text: Being from Chicago I was very skeptical. However, I was pleasantly surprised upon entering that their atmosphere,  quality of food and service was amazing. I even learned that the owner put in a special water system to replicate the water from Chicago and taking out chemicals Vegas. Bartender Josh does a superb job at making sure all clients have individual quality attention and that no glass ever reaches half way before another drink is ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H_trMbpYSm9z-NlzTvKYIw.text: Now this is a real Chicago Pizza. If you're in Las Vegas and want a real Chicago Pizza this is the only place to go I have tried the rest Nothing Compares. I got the large cheese pizza deep dish after two slices i was so full. I will be back soon for my birthday in June. Thanks for the best pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large deep dish cheese pizza.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pizza place in Las Vegas now.

ea4uw-4Ib4l-OBzoC78TUA.text: If you are looking for a really great deep dish pizza then you have found the right place. They have very good pepperoni and sausage pizza.  With that said, please remember that it takes about 45 minutes or more to cook the pizza because it is made right after you order to get the freshest pizza possible. This is a great place to go if you have the patience to wait for the pizza.  I don't recommend this to anyone that is starving and would like the food now. If you get cranky waiting for food to be cooked then this isn't the place for you. You literally have to wait a while for the pizza to come out. It's worth it if you have the patience to wait. If not... go somewhere else!

t641OA655fLdqnxBjOuqAg.text: Excellent food and service. Our server, Ashley, made sure we knew time frame of when to expect our food but really it felt like no wait at all. Atmosphere was boisterous and fun. Deep pizza, chicken alfredo, and house salad were yummy!

xMF07SsJcBQEoP_I358q9Q.text: Some friends and I dropped by during their Training Weekend and had a great experience.  Our server was super attentive, friendly and easy to talk to without being too chatty. The management was around making sure everything was up to par - and it was!  The pizza was delicious and my friends said their sandwiches (Meatball and Italian Beef) were great, too.  Everyone was served their chocolate cake for dessert. I'm not normally a chocolate fan, but it was definitely something I would order again!  All in all, it was a great experience. Can't wait to bring more friends in!

VpxSS-NgT_StgxP88xepQg.text: As locals born and raised in Chicago we loved having pizza at Giordano's. The sauce was good, lots of cheese and the vegetables were crispy and very tasty. Everyone working there that came by was so friendly. Our waiter Mark was the best. All in all we loved it and just hope they will have some restaurants off the strip for us locals. We also took home 3 frozen pizzas which they sell also.

rz0_wBveAEmDxJrsCApOtA.text: I grew up in Chicago and this location in Vegas is SPOT ON!  They even filter their water to mimic Lake Michigan so their dough tastes the same.  Highly recommend you check this place out!

et_IAINLEhSn-SH6BASaAw.text: This place is amazing!!! Great salads, pasta and especially the deep dish pizza!!!!! Very clean and great service!!! I just wish it was in a local area but it's worth the trip to the strip!!!

lv4i3NCZUX8R4ZBEjageOg.text: We came here after seeing a late show in Vegas and the food was great. We did not try their famous deep dish pizza because we looking for a lighter late night dinner but the pizza looked great.  The service was very friendly, and I felt like a valued customer. I will definitely go back with the  kids just to try the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasto Salad
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bruschetta....excellent
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tpjjI_gIT9FA6F39yO0qbA.text: Fabulous Pizza!! I'm a midwest girl at heart and love going down to the Strip to visit Giordano's! Great services and great food!! We will definitely be back soon!!

0hkzMkwbKs37kg0eMe2wmA.text: We've been there twice!  The 2nd was for their famous pizza, defiantly worth the 45 min waiting!

acqYGsqzally_Jt2QZQHtA.text: Service was excellent they really made sure that we were well taken care of. Would come here again.

svc8vBtf4VX-1m2b5afzkQ.text: Delicious! The cheese garlic bread is a must. Really good house salad. We also had spaghetti with meat sauce and a pizza with chicken. Everything was great, but it will take time for the pizza to come out...about 40 minutes

4Znoo3V7l42TPwkrTU66ew.text: By far my favorite pizza place ever! The deep dish is amazing! Ordered the Chicago classic and it was absolutely delicious. Takes a while to cook, but the wait is definitely worth it. Also a big fan of the cheesy bread! Must go!

vEi5JRdOxFoPL3TN2Yt_VA.text: Pretty good Chicago Style pizza, but it is not even on the same level as Gino's East in Chicago. But, for it being in Las Vegas, it was pretty good!

TkWOtRGQf749J7vn_OJMYw.text: I don't normally write yelp reviews, but this had me and my party of 8 upset and unsatisfied. Waitress told us that the deep dish pizza would take 45 mins and we said okay we will wait. Appetizer came out first at adequate time. Got calamari and was good! The complaint lies in the timing of dishes served and quality of the entrees. The refill people were really attentive and came by multiple times. The deep dish pizza came out FIRST (when it's the thing that is supposed to take the longest) around the 45 min mark. The timing was expected, but to have the dish we got warned about the timing to come out FIRST? That's odd....the rest of us ordered sandwiches, pasta, and the pot pie thing and waited a good 5-10 mins after the pizza came. The pasta was UNDERCOOKED, cold, and some were really hard. We ate it anyways because we were starving from waiting so long and we had already waited a long time for our food and didn't want to wait for a replacement if that was an option. We complained and the waitress and she spoke to her manager. When we got the check we got a 10% discount on all the pasta dishes!  Better than nothing I guess, but what a joke to wait so long for pasta and sandwiches only to have it cold and hard and receive a measly 10% discount. I can't say anything about the quality of the sandwiches bc I did not try it, but it definitely shouldn't be one of the last things out esp. when we were warned about another dish. The pot pie was dry, but the parmesan fries were good . If you come here expect long waits and definitely just order pizza. The deep dish was alright; I'd rate it a 3/5....i've had better

_aBgHx56mAD5abn56dYgFQ.text: Ordered one small salad, Giordano's Sampler, and one Chicago Stuffed Pizza. Salad was good, Sampler was a killer. Cheese Bread was the killer, and blue cheese really made this Cheese Bread stand up from the rest. Server let us know that pizza would take 45mins, so we were been waiting for that. Pizza came after that time period, and man, I could have guaranteed that they make the best pizza in town. Now here is the place that I would always come to whenever I want pizza. Crust was crispy outside with butter flavor and it was just good. Worth trying for sure.

ge3MbDnWIYiXagOeMnuHzg.text: I'll start with a compliment before working on the criticism.  Our server was amazing... especially since this was his first day here.  Unfortunately, since he was working at least 12 tables, we only saw him once or twice at our table.  The pizza was ok, huge pies, but nothing to write home about.  My main concern is the management and kitchen staff.  We ordered the pizza when we went onto the table waiting list.  We were seated 15 minutes later, and didn't see the pizza for at least 35 more minutes... then it took at least 25 more minutes before my wife's bowl of pasta showed up.  Manager finally offered to pick up the tab after being called out on the issues in front of all of the other tables that were complaining about the same issues.

yr-CaMISQTm-nG8JAqbtfw.text: Thought I had to wait until my next trip to Chicago to get this pizza and was so excited when I saw this one in Vegas! Best deep dish! Also is great they let you know how long the pizza will take from the start (about 45-1 hour) so you're not sitting there waiting forever not knowing

cCS4WvBVrciNb2YvNiyhLQ.text: I have tried 3 different Chicago deep dish places while visiting relatives in Chicago. Giordano's had the best sausage and crust. Still True at their Vegas location! The wait for deep dish is long so do yourself or party a favor and order some appetizers and/or salad. I finished three beers before our pizza came out. It was worth the wait, 1 slice of a large and that was filling enough for me! We had six in our group and we took 2.5 slices home.  Definitely legit and although expensive and a long wait, totally worth it!

jil3NzHx_uTw2ojVJZBfMA.text: I am shocked this place has four stars! We came ready to eat! We even asked the waiter how long, on average, it would take for the pizzas and sandwiches. He assured it wouldn't take long. Fast forward 25 minutes. The waiter comes back and apologizes for the wait, but assures us food is on the way and we would receive compensation on the bill. Great! We waited some more and our waiter is no where to be seen. I flag down a host and she radios the waiter who assures her that food is on the way. I was really hoping the next time I saw the waiter he would be bringing food- nope- he brought the manager to apologize and gift cards. Seriously? You think I want to be back??? If he had walked up with food, the it would have been annoying but I would have been ok.  What is so difficult about a salad, cheese bread,and a sandwich that would take over 40 minutes?  No thank you.

ZIuIF2ppVaQFvMOMloUUgg.text: The deep dish pizza was off the hook delicious!   We also ordered a Margherita thin crust that was good but definitely see how they're known for their deep dish pizzas!

hOmJHSUFvequVVhUBpko6Q.text: is there a lower rating than 1?!  When we asked our server the recommendation. He insisted that we get the thin crust pizza. He claimed that even though their specialty is the deep dish, it will take as long as an hour and half.  We then order an entree of Fetucini pasta and a small home style hand stretched  Chicken and sausage pizza. 30 minutes had passed and we asked the same waiter if they forgot our pizza - he replied with it is coming bc deep dish takes that long.. I then said we didnt order deep dish, and his next response is "oh yes.. of course, let me double check".  which sounded and felt sarcastic. Another 15mins had passed so we decided to ask another waiter, and he came back with stating there were no order placed... he called out the 6 feet tall mohawk dbag of a waiter to come to our table to confirm and  he responded with "I'm not the one who's serving them." My friend and I and the other waiter had this blank stare looking at each other bc clearly this dbag is handling our section. Even the couple next to us commented and started chuckling. Another 10 minutes had passed... and there comes the pizza!! A THIN CRUST pepperoni pizza!  I was fed up so I asked for the check. The charge was the hand stretched pizza we had order. When I asked the waiter to give us the menus so I could compare the price, the manager came over and apologize for her staff's behavior.  I told her what had happened and she decided to waive the pizza cost. After I signed the check. Our dbag of a server came and try to "apologize" stating that (get this): He did made the order but the kitchen burned the pizza, and never made a second one. It's the kitcken fault not his.  He then again insisted that we should try the thin crust and boxed our pizza to go. Fearing to whether he may or may not spit on it.. We placed on top of the garbage bin outside - in case there are any homeless looking for food. To think of it: we stormed out of the place pissed.. But I should had reconfirm with the kitchen staff.. about our waiter's innocense. I do wonder how would they feel when they find out that this waiter is blaming them for something they have never done. Maybe the restaurant is decent? and We only had a bad experience bc of this individual. So if you really have to go here. I recommend if he became your server, just request for another one, and if you don't which one is him. Just show this comment to the manager, she will know. When she was apologizing to us last night. she had this look: rolling eyes and a long sigh.. of a disappointment.. clearly this is not the first or will be the last from him. Happy eating

HGjHGh5U8nT9R6yu5QEDZw.text: Amazing service, the manager Zack came out and made sure everything was excellent which it was! Delicious food and excellent staff. Would definitely come back.

vO4fPBJKpQB6Dpt0x17HqQ.text: This is long overdue. I came in a about a month or so ago during a lunch out with some out of town friends. Our server was Patrick Y and he was amazing.. He recommended perfect beer and appetizer pairings. We got a salad and bruschetta with a pitcher of a light ale. We got a large deep dish pizza the Chicago style and it took a very long time.. A little over an hour to get to our table whereas we were told 45mins. But Patrick kept us updated and entertained the whole time.. They were very busy so it's understandable. I would definitely go back!!

RsHuuDkAqcSHzuLAyLgR5w.text: Bomb Za, get the deep dish it has all the cheese you could ask for and taste delicious. Cook time can be awhile and wait time to get a table even longer but you won't be disappointed.

NhRqJ9JrUpmfrGNUhbiTlg.text: Its good for people who don't have the option to go to other deep dish serving joints in Chicago.

uyrfdq_Ulsbiran5IAAeig.text: Had their regular pizza and beer - enjoyed it so much we went back a 2nd night and had the deep-dish - very impressed!  Cool atmosphere in the Las Vegas heat, good service, good beer and good food.

kcZ8ERjJF87Q8jatkDZbag.text: This is some absolutely incredible pizza. It does take awhile to cook the deep dish pizzas so def order an appetizer while you wait. But the wait is more than worth it! Yum!!

vVeeClPORDjdDcVYAN6hzA.text: If you love Chicago deep dish like I do then you will love this place. This is my new pizza place when I visit Vegas. I got the deep dish pizza. The sauce is sweet with a buttery crust, the cheese is gooey and delicious. I ordered the individual pizza and that's more than enough for 1 person.

2QPdgUlaiBz_g8k0_p0ATw.text: Great Bar Staff.  I was greeted by a super friendly person named Claire.  She Rocks.  Sat at the bar and enjoyed a brews or two and the hand tossed thin crust.  Yum!

ltnLcFzvmHLnG2oj2Az4NA.text: Love the Chicago style deep dish pizza. More of a pie than pizza, but excellent. The regular pizza is also good.

OsFKbyHUAxtWFGHm37h9bA.text: I've had their pizza before when I used to live in Chicago. I liked it before & I still like it. I'm glad they opened a branch in Las Vegas. Next time I'll try their Italian Beef Sandwich.

Wd5Jyz6FyUR1zWJ6Msz2SQ.text: I have to give it 4 stars. Service was attentive and the overall appearance is nice. There was a wait for the Pie to be baked, but once it arrived it was EXCELLENT. I ordered an individual artichoke, black olive, and mushroom pizza.

W30YWYaHOzIgroSVzb9eFg.text: Giordano's in Vegas?!?!?! We happened to walk by yesterday when they were having their soft opening, and decided to return today to eat at the grand opening. I cannot eat nightshades (read: tomatoes). They still managed to make me an awesome Italian beef pie with a few substitutions, which I dipped in a pesto! Hector was exceptional, going out of his way to make sure everything was safe for me to eat. Great service! I would definitely recommend to any liver of deep dish pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Italian beef pie and salad, modified to be nightshade free. I was full after eating the salad and half of the pie!
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My guy topped an individual pizza with all of the meat lover toppings!

Z7h4EeP8bnBMEBF89ri0uQ.text: This location is a sad excuse for a Giordano's.  The service was slow and forgetful. The food was bland and overcooked. We ordered the grilled itailian meat in a pizza and the meat had no real flavor. The crust was overdone and dry. The only good on the plate was the french frys with garlic and herbs. We also ordered a deep dish with pepperoni and green bell pepper and that too was mediocre. Honestly I have had better pizza from Pizza hut. Now don't get me wrong I loved when I was in Chicago and ate at the original but this one was a sad attempt. On a good note the potato bites were tasty.

Tis_HRdmzeolhokEko3Wtw.text: Service was terrible... waiter took the order and never showed up till the check. Missing silverware and place settings... waited over 50 mins for food. Their only saving grace was the calamari which was a hit. Pizza had barely any meats on it... just go to Chicago for an authentic experience

Mo6PoctbIL0H-_gsdipUlw.text: The "cheese" CHICAGO DEEP DISH  was amazing & the classic wasn't too bad either! I had 2 pieces from a medium pie & was so stuffed! I can't wait to get back to LV to enjoy it again! Service was great too! Yay!

4xwc4ycsA4BQVQrMZwYLGQ.text: Chicago native here. Grew up going to birthdays and other special occasions at Giordanos and was THRILLED to see one in Vegas. Not as good as in Chicago, that's to be expected, but definitely a passable replacement. The server Calvin was very nice, and the place all new and clean. All in all, go check it out, and for the love of crumbcake get the deep dish. Who gets flat crust at Giordanos?? It's worth the 45 minute wait, trust.

ZrINyyCUnavKdiPkb4qAZA.text: Went on a cold night in Vegas but still enjoyed it. I really liked the Veggie Chicago Deep Dish Pan Pizza, my wife not so much. Because of the wait (35-45 minutes for a deep dish) we ordered the calamari as an app. It was delicious. I loved the fried lemon slices, green beans, and banana peppers that went with the calamari.  The server was nice and funny.  The pizza in my opinion is worth the wait. I loved the deep dish.

GpDsCuSlNH3vG4tNx-neKA.text: When you crave for Chicago stuffed pizza then this is the place to go.  The stuffed pizza takes at least 45 mins to make so it's best to keep that in mind.  They serve the goose island green line beer which is brewed in Chicago and normally not available anywhere else so that's a bonus.

2PtUDWVU-p3C1GJwfkgpWQ.text: We decided to try Giordano's Chicago pizza again. Same group essentially the same dishes with a complete different result. What a difference a month to make. While the service is always excellent thank you Patrick, everything else was delicious. If you're going to get this pizza the meat one is what you have to do case closed. We also had the opportunity to try The thin crust artichoke pizza. Homerun! I had the same flavors as their salad and was a nice refreshing starter before the meat pizza came Chicago style.  Miranda the manager was so nice and even took us into the kitchen for a tour. It was busy and we got to see their systems and how they organize and by the way their ovens are amazing. I can say that if you're coming to Vegas there's a lot to eat a lot of great pizza and Giordano's is definitely one to try. They care about their customers and the customer experience. Thank you so much to Miranda Patrick and Michael.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IEAPJWDZ42Ohff8mlinjRg.text: I love the Pizza in Chicago,  but waited 50 min for the darn pizza.  That's too bad.  If you can wait is not worth the wait. WARNING DON'T COME HERE

Rc-MVlmw_dt0lyyp1lKWyg.text: Pizza was delicious we ordered a small four four people and the six slices filled us up.  The atmosphere is amazing and the bathrooms were extremely nice.  The deep dish pizza takes 45 minutes to cook, so our waitress advised us to order salads.  I ordered a Greek salad and added ranch dressing it was great.  Will visit again.

kpqmE6f8DcrqNa0fLlyofg.text: Love the Chicago style pizza!!! And the service it's great! I believe we ordered the Chicago deep dish pepperoni pizza which had pepperoni and lots and lots of yummy cheese.

BagsHCZUu0H3WzuiUKx7FQ.text: Best pizza in vegas! Our waiter was very kind, fast and kept my coffee full! Nice place to come chill and get stuffed

eZQ1TRSIT-bgZZKvj8d49g.text: My husband and I stopped in here last weekend 8/20/18 before seeing a show at the Mirage. The service staff was friendly enough even though it was 107 degrees. We ordered the Meat and more meat pizza and our pizza came out faster than we expected and there was a good reason for that. The crust was undercooked, soggy and almost impossible to eat. When we complained about the quality of our pizza our server said it would take an hour to make a new one and then offered to box our pizza up so we could take it home. We left more than half of it sitting on the table, paid our bill and even left a 20% tip but we wont be back even tho we heard good things about the pizza we are from Seattle and that would just not fly up here. We love Las Vegas and will be back but not to eat at Giordanos that's for sure.

UjMqrwuNF5t773OhfxEf2A.text: I have to say...Michael and company absolutely outdid themselves this time around. I was very lucky to have a quick tour of the kitchen and witnessed my pizza created first hand. The food came out amazing and surpassed my expectations. The pizza's crust and filling were delicious and because my date and I treated ourselves to the calamari and the potato fritters, we couldn't finish the pizza. No worries at all since we now have some awesome leftovers for later! We also had some amazing salad and topped it off with an equally amazing Tiramisu!! Giordano's is definitely my choice for Chicago style pizza here in Vegas!!! Don't pass it up!!

FUzYATfjUd_0EaNsddnjSA.text: The food was so mouth drooling that we had a pleasant dinner for once in Vegas. I highly suggest this place

L64rlHIZwZzwrXhiW5nfzg.text: We came here for Sunday dinner. Wait was about 25 minutes. They encourage customers to pre order deep dish pizza as youbare waiting for the table to save some time which is a good idea. Portions are huge and pizza very tasty. Very reasonable prices for what you get and service is good as well.

A-ptGa4rja-KRjY9qF1GYg.text: Giordano's is my favorite Chicago pizzeria and it's taken me far too long to visit the Vegas location.  It's hard to explain what makes this pizza so damn delicious - it's very different from "normal" pizza. It's got super thick, buttery crust and tons of cheese. It's basically stuffed pizza, because only the tomato sauce is on top. My absolute favorite is the spinach pie, which I originally tried in Chicago. We recently met my hubby's Aunt for dinner while she was in town for a conference and we decided to share a salad and a custom pizza. We basically wanted all meat and veggies and we got what we asked for.  This is a busy place and the pizza takes time to cook, so be ready! They have a decent beer selection, with even a couple of local taps. The service was friendly and it was semi-baby friendly. I say semi because we were seated upstairs and the baby blocked an aisle because the tables were close together. It's also pretty loud, so if you have a child and they are sensitive to noise, I might say to avoid this place. Luckily, our kid sleeps better the louder it is, so we didn't have any problems.  I wish that Giordano's built locally, rather than on the Strip. But I get it - unfortunately, it just means we won't visit often. It's such a hassle to deal with parking at Bally's, especially now that they are charging (although it's currently still free for locals). We had to walk quite a distance to get to the Bazaar Shops and this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kUIKbpBzdLnEioW1jwe0Fw.text: Food was good but didn't make up for the lack of customer service.    I ordered a personal deep dish pizza after about a 40 min wait, the server brought a small pizza to our table. I told him that I had ordered a personal size, he quickly took away the pizza and told me that there was no such thing as a personal deep dish pizza (although the menu only offers personal pizzas that are deep dish).    My friend offered to share her pizza with me.  The manager came to our table and told us we didn't have to worry about paying for the pizza I didn't receive she had taken it off the check.  The manager and servers clearly need to receive customer service training.

F9ETzjmR2lnX-GjxiTuNmA.text: LOVE this place! This has become a family dinner night favorite! Quiten was the best! Super friendly and attentive. Everyone was great, but Q is our family's favorite man at this place! When you go in, be sure to ask for this guy! The pizza is all they say it is!! BEST DEEP DISH you'll ever have! it's a lot of food though! great for sharing with large groups!

mDeCR-rSCYAfNOOVKeJtag.text: I went to Giordano's in Chicago and the Giordano's in Las Vegas it taste the the same I love it the best pizza I ever had

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dhEOQDMoi8fuQ5bMHaCmTg.text: I told my coworkers that I've never had deep dish pizza before. After their jaws dropped, they said that tomorrow's lunch will be from Giordanos. So I yelped them (of course). I saw they offered 10% off any online orders. PERFECT! So as the assistant in my office I proceeded to take the individual orders from 8 different people. All 8 of us ordered 6 inch individual deep dish pizzas with all different toppings.   Placing the order online not only was easy but it gave me the total price of each person. So placed my order at 11:30 and asked for a 12:20 pick up.  The pick up: 3/5 If your doing a pick up, parking is easy but not convenient AT ALL. I parked in the Paris's parking garage. First 30 minutes was free! We walked through half of Paris to get outside to the promenade. Please note there is a pick up window next to starbucks so don't waste your time going to the main restaurant.  Once I finally arrived at the pick up window I paid and the were finishing up the pizzas. By 12:35 I had all 8 pizzas in hand and walking back to my car.  Taste: 5/5 By the time we got back to our office the pizzas were slightly cooled and ready to eat! Once I bit into my pizza, I could taste all the fresh and quality toppings. I wish it had a bit more sauce on it but another than that it was quite perfect.   Would I go back? Yes, but I would dine in. I want to see a whole pie and try other items on the menu. To improve my rating, I suggest offering delivery. I know this is a hard location to be doing deliveries and I get it but maybe do postmates or grubhub at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the joy on my face! #firstbite
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Isn&#39;t it beautiful?
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back in the office and ready to devour!

a8e3ArqtjKOqBkfNQ0kS_Q.text: Man! I've been waiting to eat here for a long time and damn, I was disappointed big time. Felt like I just ate a hot pocket. Such a bummer coming from Southern California.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZMYzfHUZ8nurMY94qkMuIA.text: Wow this pizza is good. I've always wanted to try deep dish and I'm glad it was with Giordano's.   Almost ordered the thin pizza but glad we switched last minute to the deep dish! I got the small and the lasagna to share for 2 people and had some for the next day. It is super filling and good reheated too yay. (need to find affordable eats especially on the strip or else you're going to be broke by the end of your trip).   Service sucked at the bar with Paolo.. but the food was so good still got 4/5 stars.   Almost wanted to get the frozen pizzas togo to bring back to my fam. Must go when visiting Vegas! In front of Bally's Hotel! There is an inside area upstairs as well as an open area downstairs (with additional window for togo orders).  If you are debating if you want deep dish or thin because you had a not so positive experience with deep dish before, definitely go with the deep. Giordano's is soo good and will convert you

mKRbbm-CmK4zFkcnKxiaxA.text: Over 45 minutes to get a thin crust pizza?!?! You've got to be kidding me. No I don't want any more drinks, no I don't want water, I want the damn pizza I ordered fucking 45+ minutes ago... $29.50 to sit and wait for almost a damn hour and whole I know it's not the servers fault... QyHuDHhouJ9XzCmG5-M4Tw.text: Overpriced for pizza, but the food was good. I had a salami, pepperoni and ham sandwich on ciabatta. It was great! The fries were good too. Perfectly seasoned. Great atmosphere and good staff.

tvWdGFPj1qyegTcghtXdrA.text: We had 2 personal 6" pizzas. They both tasted great and had a good amount of toppings. I had never had this type of chicago deep dish pizza and I really enjoyed it. My friend said she really enjoyed the flavor of the sauce and that it compared to authentic Chicago style pizzas in Chicago. It is fairly pricey and takes about 45 min to make, but worth the wait especially if you are like me and had never had this style pizza before.

s0aAqo8htH5c3l_n0cZYQw.text: Really great tasting Chicago style pizza, Q was a good server, very friendly and prompt service, Pizza looked just like its shown in the ad, good crust, and the marinera and cheese were the best part! Would definitely return

w2cOza2dNb0MMkJFSPy1aQ.text: We were so excited to find that our favorite Chicago style pizza has a location in Vegas. It's a great, laid back, casual ambience considering it's on the strip. It's across the street from the Bellagio and we were able to see the fountain show from our table. If you want deep dish pizza keep in mind it takes roughly 40 minutes so you may not want to come here unless you're ok with relaxing and chatting with whoever you come with. The wait is worth it for sure. With so many dining options in Vegas we try not to eat at any place twice, but this will always be one of my meals whenever I'm visiting.

FQ58JLcEjR8doE9cGYyzlQ.text: Tucked in a mini strip mall, there's a lovely outdoor spot. Didn't check out the actual restaurant. Service was awesome and fast. We went during happy hour and they had half off beer and house wine. We shared a dip dish pizza. It was good but not what I would consider pizza. More of a pie. It had a flaky crust, and reminded me more of a lasagna. I would recommend sharing a small between four people as it's VERY filling.

I brought my best friend from high school and her husband. We ordered a personal deep dish pizza for myself and my friends ordered a thin crust cheese pizza and a sandwich. The food was great and service was awesome. I went in full Drag and didn't have any pushback. Will definitely be recommending to friends in the future!

q3XbxN-iN4W57q4tI1IFkg.text: Lovely and trendy looking restaurant and bar ... they are known for deep dish Chicago style pizza. It was super cheesy and filling. I enjoyed it very much along with their garlic fries and sampler! The service was great and all employees were very friendly. If you're like pizza this place is a must for sure!!

JAAWZXhbvUhICbB95UlMUw.text: Extra thin and crispy ? It's like the exact same dough from pieology.   The deep dish is not that great. The crust isn't tasty everything is flat.    I ordered this harvest salad. Now a days I expect my dressing To be served separate or asked if id like it tossed however salads were tossed. The dressing was horrendous I couldn't even decipher what it was. The dried apricots were cut into huge chunks. I told my freaking waiter twice I did not Iike my salad and HE NEVER ACKNOWLEDGED IT. You get busy but do your freakin job.   Listen and stop over talking.  Not once did any "manager" or overly dressed food runner ever come to our table to see how things were  There is nothing special about the sauce. They served our extra crispy pizza cold.  They forgot to add the jalapenos on the other pizza yet didn't forget to charge.   And the deep dish well our friend wanted green olives yet when his wife bit into her pizza she got a big jalapeno bite. Mind you the deep dish had Zero jalapenos.   Glasses were refilled plenty , the food is Mediocre and overpriced for the muck, the servers and managers are INATTENTIVE! They rarely make eye contact with you to avoid doing work or having accountability.  Unacceptable

IKmNzzbjQZo4-iN6gqcjbw.text: So first and foremost if you're going to eat pizza you should have at least 2 hrs cleared from your schedule.  Since we didn't have that time we opted for spaghetti and a sandwich. The spaghetti was good, the sandwich on the other hand made my boyfriend sick. He ate about half and couldn't stomach the rest.  Decent service though.

9VdGfl7jQNlNfty9VCBnHQ.text: Incredible pizza! We had a large party and had to wait about 30 minutes to be seated, but the hostess let us know that the deep dish pizzas take a while to bake. She let us place an order before we were seated, so the pizza was ready shortly after we sat down, which was appreciated.  We got a couple of appetizers, which were delicious. I don't typically like Chicago deep dish, but the pizzas were outstanding. I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas!

8Q6l5jxY5HV9KeS2NDgT3w.text: Be prepared for a long wait. They do inform you it will be 45 minutes, but it was much longer for us. We also ordered an appetizer of wings, and it came out in 45 minutes, but they brought cold barbecue ones instead of buffalo. They did fix this, but it came out just before the pizza. I had ordered the Chicago deep dish and it was disappointing in taste. Save yourself time disappointment by going to another pizza joint.

x3SOhmRIjHQN0yN8CHqWDQ.text: Pizza is awesome here, the same as Chicago. Keep in mind a deep dish takes 45 minutes to cook, the thin crust takes 35 minutes so I hope you aren't trying to get a quick meal.  I sat at the outside bar on the ground level where you can get the full menu and drinks. I watched some soccer games that they had on several of the 8 TV's. I did not sit in the permanent restaurant, this is just the eating area in the Grand Bazaar Shops. The food is prepped a short distance away in the permanent restaurant and I think they take their private elevator that goes directly to their kitchen.  I had a basic Caesar salad and an individual deep dish pizza. The pizza is awesome and fine by me that it took 45 minutes. The staff was attentive and friendly. I'm pretty sure it helped that it was a Thursday afternoon and I did get here just at the end of what I would consider the lunch rush, but it was pretty dead even considering that.   They have water misters running in the summer and it was comfortable for me.  Happy hour is weekdays from 3-6pm at the bar only. Check it out!

3yyJWWqFJvrtx7Urv2MQ1A.text: I was torn about writing this review only because the restaurant and staff were great. The food is delicious and so were the drinks. However, my husband, young son and I went out for a late dinner after a relaxing day in our hotel. We decided to go to Giordanos because we've been to the one in Chicago and loved it. While there we were seated at the last table by the entrance, the closest occupied table to us was about 4 empty tables away. Our server was attentive and helpful, our food was great but our experience was ruined by another guest. Towards the end of our dinner my son started to get fussy, my husband went to the restroom and we requested the check. All of a sudden a guest sitting several tables away shouted and asked us to "leave or go outside" I was gathering all my belongings, getting ready to pay and waiting on my husband. The guest continued to insult me and shame me for having my son "out past his bed time". This person stared me down and continued to shout from her table. I was mortified. My husband couldn't come quick enough. As soon as we got our check we paid and left. I was so humiliated I know this isn't the restaurants fault. I just don't see myself coming back because of this incident. I am a new mom and I'm still learning how to handle different situations but I never have and never will under any circumstance, assume that it is my place to ask another person to leave an establishment because of me. I don't understand what made this individual think she could intervene in a case of a fussy baby. I believe it is above my authority (and audacity) to ask another paying customer with a fussy baby to remove themselves or their baby from the restaurant for something that is completely out of anyones control. This person was harsh and disrespectful. And unfortunately, ruined our experience here.

dn4YO2xM1ohEVjpAJZSFEQ.text: This is the real deal right here in Vegas. I love deep dish when I visit Chicago - and outside of the Windy City, I've attempted to find it but it's never the same.  I have been to Giordanos in chi town. This is just as good. Pequod's is still my fave out there, but outside of the city, this is the best option.

A9DVtrH71SEr4xFCsyrpBQ.text: The absolute best dry wings in Vegas. And the deep dish (pepperoni sausage and cheese) was to die for honestly. I wanted to keep eating but I got so  full from one slice. My boyfriend and I shared a small which is really enough for 2-3 ppl.

9CSW6erYo75R9B7TQ_Pk_w.text: The best pizza ever! So good! I've been to Italy and let me tell you this pizza is way better! I can't believe how perfectly baked the crust is, and perfectly paired with the cheese and sauce. I will eat here everyday while I'm in town!

8IHH-vJWfGpab2Dz-r3dSA.text: Really good deep dish pizza! Discovered this place the last time we were in Vegas in 2017. Went back September of 2019 and it was just as good as the first time we ate here. Definitely recommend the sampler platter as an appetizer. The mozzarella triangles are amazing! Also had the deep dish cheese pizza and it was very good! Will try and visit every trip to Vegas!

8N8L2S6am8AcLqOVQ9Z1wg.text: Been to Chicago several times and always wanted to find a deep dish pizza place. Well I finally found one here in Las Vegas. The old bay wings were off the charts and the pepperoni and sausage was really good and cheesy.
