Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep Dish pepperoni and Sausage pizza

fno3mL3S7qNDbRwZG51DQw.text: I haven't been to Las Vegas in quite a long while. To put into perspective, the Cromwell was still fresh and a club by the name of Omnia just opened. So if you regularly visit or are a native you'd understand the vast differences there are in the area that hosts this Chicago style eatery.   My last trip to Chicago I got to try my first deep dish pie from Lou Malnati's. I was aware of Giordano's, but time was not in my favor (my appetite wasn't either, deep dish is filling).   We walked through Bally's a little tipsy and hungry to discover this restaurant had opened up shop in Sin City. Thank goodness I don't have to fly Frontier to compare (don't judge it was a cheap flight).   My significant other got the pasta and I pre-ordered a small deep dish because I like to eat, but don't want to hate myself. The hosts were kind and our waiter was enthusiastic. The restaurant has a nice modern vibe with the kitchen visible from the entrance. The food came promptly (remember pre-order your pie as soon as you know) and we dug in.   Pasta was tasty, rustic, and hot. The pizza looked good, but didn't leave a large impression on me unfortunately. I'm a New York slice kind of guy, but unless it's the water, Lou's in Chicago beat this pie out without hesitation. I have to leave three stars for this joint because the food didn't hit the mark for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago Deep Dish, Had to substitute for pineapples, my significant other is allergic to mushrooms and doesn&#39;t like veggies on pizza.

XbusZOaFjSVlftFWseCB4w.text: Hands down some of the best deep dish pizza I've tasted. The layers in the pizza can I just say woah! It's like a lasagna but in pizza form. Our server was Itzlaly(not sure the spelling). But she was busy, and she didn't fold under pressure. She was prompt and gave great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Personal deep dish with jalapeños, fresh spinach, pepperoni, and sausage.

J4zbxP1J2zlKeOvpxvc_MA.text: I'm from New York and this was the best pizza I've ever had. Excellent. The manager and our waiter Shyiane was extremely nice. A roach flew on myself and another customer, she was nice enough to discount our pizza a little haha. We appreciated the service! Opt in for the deep dish!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7w-Ooam6hgC7d56emKVVMw.text: Nom nom nom.   I tried Giordanos a couple years ago when I went to Chicago and have been dreaming about it. I was so glad to find one in Vegas! The pizza breading and crusts were as good as I remember and the pizzas were even good eating cold lol.   I must add that the wait was ridiculous long though and when our food finally came, they messed up our orders. We didn't realize it until we took the first bite (sorry too hungry). Brought it up to their attention and without us asking for anything, they immediately offered us discount- overall I'd say their service was great and responsive, but maybe next time I'll try to order take out and make sure my order was right lol.   Still drooling thinking about those pizzas..

igBnK6ctfi6HctaGfYbC-w.text: This is one of my go to stops every time I come to Vegas. Yes, I realize I'm in Vegas and not Chicago, but who doesn't love DEEP dish pizza?!?? On my most recent visit I happened to arrive right at the end of happy hour (3p-6p M-F) and had a half off draft beer and appetizer (I chose the bbq wings). This was perfect to help kill time for the 45min wait to cook the Meat & more Meat DEEP dish pizza. 45 MINUTES is a long time, but if you think about it, you'll probably spend the same amount of time just waiting for a table elsewhere.   The pizza is always fresh, hot, and very filling!!! I love to eat but can usually only make it through 1.5-2 pieces!  Also, if there is a wait for a table here, I'd recommend grabbing a seat at the bar if your party is not too large. It is first come first serve with full service!

b5Niq1mkXyIZqIzyG5zKYA.text: Delicious Chicago deep dish Pizza. Amazing taste I almost went for most of the pie. This is front of Paris ( Vegas) between Bally's ( not the shoe). The service was great and the boneless chicken wings are on yum.

-JatqmY0RPMzs4eQKaJqaQ.text: My boyfriend had eaten at Giordanos when he used to live in Chicago, so we decided to try this place while we were in Vegas. I liked that it was not indoors but not really outdoors. They had shades to cover the sun. We got there and the lady seating people wasn't attentive. We had to say excuse me a few times to get her attention because she seemed to be looking at something on her podium. After we were seated, our waiter didn't come for at least 15-20 minutes. When she finally came, we ordered two personal deep dish pizzas, which took about 45 minutes to come out. Deep dish typically takes a while, so don't go when you're too hungry! I got pepperoni and mushroom, which was delicious and flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aug2dSkMLUfPzZf3oDwWzQ.text: Deep dish isn't my favorite type of pizza, but I've had the original Giordanos in Chicago, and even there only gave them 4 stars. For some reason the location in LV just doesn't size up to my expectations. Maybe the LV water just isn't as great for pizza? Not really sure what it is but it didn't taste exactly like the original.  Service here is fine as we didn't have any issues. Of course due it's location (right outside bally's hotel and casino) on the strip, it is very centrally located. I would visit again if friends asked for deep dish pizza in LV.

rrcLdP9m_Xsi-VQqJWLPzg.text: We recommend the deep dish pizza. We got the Chicago classic pizza and trust me its worth the 45min wait. Definitely going to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OK6NkjVV3fOQWBBDZj4IGQ.text: Before visiting LV I did my research and wanted to eat deep dish pizza! My boyfriend and I got the special deep dish pizza. Be prepared to wait at least 45 minutes for the pizza but your server will let you know that. We got a pitcher of blue moon and an appetizer of cheesy bread while we were waiting. We probably could've done without the cheesy bread since the deep dish pizza was so filling. Our bill came out to about $60. After eating there of course I found a coupon that says our cheesy bread would've been free! Unfortunately it was too late and we paid $8.95 for the cheesy bread. I wish our waiter would've told us the deal but it's ok. When you come to Vegas, be prepared to spend money! I liked the restaurant and food. It's not something we eat everyday. The restaurant also has big windows so you can see the strip. I'd recommend it and I'd go back.

Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy bread

6tkRTCtWD0unqtAW5o5g8g.text: The food is good, but the service was a bit lousy. I get it is Las Vegas and restaurants are generally packed. We showed up and happily waited for 20 minutes to be seated thinking our host would put in our pizza order and we would get a head start. Instead we waited over 1.5 hours for our pizza. The manager came and apologized and discounted 10% on the pizza $2 off.

yWkuMc_dwIEtDYeKZVjR4g.text: Only get the deep dish pizza it was the best I have had outside Chicago. I did try the wings and chicken fettuccine not worth buying. The chicken fettucine tasted like packet fettuccine i had when i was really poor which is why i am giving 4 stars.  I will go back for that pizza it was everything.

kaRB0hNVuvu6j5d2UM9BQg.text: If you're looking for great Chicago Style Pizza on The Strip, then look no further!  First off, the staff is great and makes you feel so welcome! From the moment we walked in and were greeted by the host, to our entire time there, everyone was great! They also have a good view of the Bellagio!  Our server was amazing! Had a great sense of humor and suggested some great food for us to try!  Their food is delicious! They have pizza, salads, sandwiches, and a variety of appetizers. Reasonably priced too!  Will be coming back here every time I come to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That cheese pull!!!!
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popular chopped salad &amp; parm fries!

RG-IsCMSY-SnC6FeLDQiSw.text: Favorite pizza!!! Yummy dough, fresh sauce and perfect amount of ingredients! Must try!

ntWodEsVVMVOhaDejJcagA.text: I love Chicago style deep dish pies!  I've seen many Instagram foodie blogs post about this place and all of the photos of the stringy cheese pulls made my mouth water. I knew if I ever was in Vegas, this place was definitely on my to-do list.  The pizza was amazing! We ordered the small pepperoni pie which was enough for the 2 of us, even though I could've eaten another slice or 2 because it was that good, you know how when the food is so good you eat even though you are full? Yeah, that's this place.  Our server was great and took good care of us. Another staff member even served our first 2 slices which made for a great Instagram story.  I can't recommend this place enough.   If you love thick cheesy pizza, come eat here.

pJRgBkMjh--e0hnHfgIRRQ.text: If ZERO STARS was an option, that would be my choice!  We were there over an hour and ended up walking out without eating anything! Appetizer was given to table next to us and we were told by waitress 3 TIMES that she would check on our order.  Never happened.  Then we talked to a manager and she said that she was going to check on order and let us know right away.  Almost 10 minutes later, she still hadn't come back so we just left.  Service was horrible.  Will not EVER recommend or give it another shot.  Don't waste time or money.  Go to Sbarro's instead!

nKRS6W1K68gNvIgvHsdIdA.text: Happen to be in the area and in the mood for pizza . Ordered a wedge salad and was told there was no blue Cheese dressing. Changed to ranch.  Asked for no tomatoes. Salad came. Not even close to a wedge.  Romain leafs. Yes,  with tomatoes. Took forever to get our pizza, but not  As long as it took to get a child's pepperoni pizza. Continued to wait for that then finally came out with no pepperoni. Came back with some slightly warm pepperoni on top of same pizza.We could tell because the pizza underneath was cut while the pepperoni on top were not. They offered to redo, we told them we didn't have time to wait for it again. Were told it would be about 8 to 10 minutes. 25 minutes later pizza came out and we took it to go.  2 stars  Because grown up pizza had good flavor even though we had to wait. Manager and server didn't seem that intrested in getting our order correct. I think they know you're just passing through and probably won't be back so no big loss.

B9bH0I3Qck18MkjCJ-F-HA.text: The wait time is understandable - people need to grasp that this particular pizza takes a while to make which the host explains prior to being seated.  Other news:  Kyle E is a cutie. Pizza was okay but he is just gorgeous! Holla

i4ke-AKG4v4qWZfeQTw0dQ.text: Have you seen the cheese pull!!?? Please get here now...today...asap Deep dish can take up to 45 min to cook so come hungry and start out with some appetizers. We Started with the family Cesar and meatballs (get the 5) oh yeah and wine!! Wine prices are very reasonable!!  Then the pizza came we ordered 3 smalls ( 3 adults and 4 kids) and still took some home!! Our server Bryan was awesome (I've had home twice now) and he has the best hair to go along with his personality! It was also good to see managers like Evan help out and run food and not just stand around "managing". Staff is great and food is great what are you waiting for!!

DXziVIxaZHC-AuIYv7hrOA.text: To have transparency here.........this was emailed to Michael this Monday morning 01/30/17: Good morning Michael,  I have to apologize for replying back to you this late. I appreciate your message and I am humble to have received it. I'm going to take your offer and please refund us our meal (I have attached the receipt).  I cannot take your second offer in bringing my family back for a second chance.  In Las Vegas, theirs too many restaurants to give one a second chance.  For us, once we love the the food, we write about it and continue to come back to it.  I just believe that there were too many eyes from your staff that saw our pie and didn't take it back or say something.  From the guy that served us (and us pointing it out there, he just turned towards the back like he was looking for someone), to the waiter that saw three half eaten slices on our plates, saw the rest of the pizza untouched and said that our cannoli's we're on our way out.  Instead of asking us if their was a problem or how was our pizza,  would of at least open the door.   Don't let me get started on those poor cannoli's too, they were soft, they came frozen to your kitchen then microwaved (very sad) to our plate.  We're not one to make a scene or to get mad and storm off.  This is why we love Yelp! You even made a comment that "the execution of my pizza wasn't right".  I totally agree, and I agree that there are different types of thickness to deep dishes in Chicago but the one that's pictured on each of your tables (for marketing, to take a deep dish home) isn't what we got. Even pictures that I screen shot and attached here have that second layers you guys promote (and you mentioned) and ours had a cheese thick bottom, with a barely rationed sauce and some pepperonis.  I just believe that customers should have that one time experience to continue to come back.  Unfortunately, ours was just overlooked, ignored and we are here.   But I wish you and your restaurant the best.   Let me know if you need anything else for my refund.   Regards, Luis F.  image1.JPG  image2.PNG  Look at the sauce here, along with the two layers as you mentioned.  image4.PNG  Then our sad pizza.  image5.JPG

3eXRTdxj8N-SwxuusjEpQw.text: I'm dreaming about coming back to Giordano's. As a Vegas native, I hate spending time on the Strip outside of work. In fact, I had only set foot in Bally's ONCE, and I was a child. It was not remarkable, and continues to be that way. With that said, hearing about Giordano's definitely piqued my interest, so I went as soon as I could.  Service: EVERYONE was authentically friendly and proactive with information. Yes, it will take 45 min. for your deep dish to be finished, but it's worth it. They didn't hide this at all from us, ensured we were okay with this, and we were not disappointed.  Food: I get why people are so crazy about Giordano's. Pizza was fresh, beautiful, and SO DECADENT. Come here hungry. You still won't finish it. Take it home. It's great as a leftover too. We got the appetizer sampler as well, and liked everything. It's your standard stuff, like mozzarella sticks, calamari, etc.  In short- they don't try to reinvent the wheel. Why do it?! They take classics, and make them the best they can be. That's my favorite thing, and if you're a fan too, you'll probably like this place too.

YH2BL5hb9uKy0u50W0JDbw.text: Ah-maz-ZA-zing! Best pizza I ever had. Does take a little while to cook but they warn you of that upfront!

oCrGRhdRAR_JRuP5fVw0Ng.text: Excellent value in on The Strip in Las Vegas, NV. Friendly & efficient serve from the two bartenders. We had two drinks & two salads (1-med, 1-sm). Nice shady spot cool off and have a very good lunch. Note: signature dish is Chicago style deep dish pizza and 9 0f 10 diners here were enjoying it.

QoWnxra2M4jSqpl8yOrL6g.text: They warned us that deep dish would be like an hour wait.  Interesting when you think that these places run on throughput on tables to up their revenue. They said he pie just takes hat long however other Giordanos I have been at simply understand how many of the deep dishes they sell and possibly have them already in the over by default...  Anyways we decided to go with faster food like pasta and chicken sandwich and so on.  It took and hour to get it to the table. And when we finally had it they tried to get us to leave by cleaning items we went done with. So annoying.   Food was mediocre. The waitress was nice but tied to bad management and restaurant policies.  We gave her a good tip and decided at least moan on Yelp.

IT_k5rVcR68B-cDqjtyysA.text: Tried this place afyer passing by it many times on my way home! If u love super cheesy n filling pizza like I do then this is the best place! I loved it! Will be returning over and over again. The kiddos loved it and the husbter did too!

4lY5gDgTtEtMkIBD6ePYpA.text: On our last trip to Vegas we decided to give this place a go.  We decided to sit out in the newly constructed section going down the main strip of the Bazaar.  I cold imagine that sitting out there in the summer could become kind of hot but it looks like they have a mist system installed.....still prob going to be hot though.    Knowing that our pizza would take 45 minutes we were unsure of what appetizer to order, luckily they have a sampler plate so it made it easy.  The sampler plate came out and it soon become apparent that we should have just ordered the mozzarella trianges....they were by far the all star out of the bunch, followed up by the wings.  So the pizza came out and the waiter did the long string cheese move.  Pizza was pretty good but my only gripe is that they don't have honey to eat the crust with.  The honey would have pushed this review up to a 5 star and the end crust really needs it if you're going to eat the whole thing.    The service is what you'd expect and our waiter kept coming back to make sure we were doing ok while waiting for the pizza.  Overall a good place to eat...when we come back I might have to smuggle in some honey for the crust.

b7Adq5Mp_dNjyj8za6OYIw.text: I had read good reviews about this restaurant so I thought it would be a great place to go for lunch. I regret spending my time and money at this restaurant. We got HORRIBLE service. Our waitress Kelly NEVER offered to refill our drinks, or check up on us to see how we liked the food. She NEVER picked up our appetizer dishes. We patiently waited over an hour for our small deep dish pizza . The pizza was okay, I've had better Chicago Deep dish pizza back home, not impressed. We had to flag down our waitress to get our check, because she totally ignored or forgot we were in the restaurant. I recommend not to go here and go somewhere else.

vtlWIDCDA3EamfqiobKiJg.text: It is the best pizza ive ever had! They accidentally gave us medium size when we ordered small so free upgrade lol drinks are really strong and it's not worth it...

Z9B_ZjNyBtveDkznZCujEQ.text: Haven't been to Chicago in a year so was really excited for this place.  The crust was hard on the bottom (like a cookie) and the top was doughy.  The ingredients reminded me of the taste of frozen pizza.  It was warm/hot but did not meet my expectations.   Service (waitress was Nicole) was friendly and inviting.

RR01QY9kuiCkeyMfHNSRNQ.text: Great deep dish pizza, Chicago style. Also has a great selection of beers on tap. I highly recommend this place if you are hungry and looking for authentic, outstanding deep dish pizza.

u6r7i7vRPPmCsc0OOlvkJw.text: So check it out: you're on the strip right across from Bellagio, with a view might I add - and out comes lemonade with vodka. Ok I'm won over. Check it out it's called strip lemonade. You're welcome in advance.   The meatballs though... ok so even if you don't like meatballs do yourself a favor and get them. They. Are. Delicious.   The big show is the pizza - which is amazing. Tried Chicago style and deep dish both good but I definitely preferred the deep dish. We got spinach, jalapeno and chicken sausage and seriously it was one of the best pizzas I've had in a long time. The chicken sausage was flavorful and jalapenos added a good amount of kick.   So you can get good food and drinks a lot of places, yes. What makes this place better? The service. They were so on top of what we needed even when we didn't realize we needed it. I mean I was never thirsty what so ever.   Give this place a go. Then go again. And again. And again. Thanks for the great service and food. We'll see you soon!

wB_XTfAHcQsrBug5YCAOGw.text: I've had Giordano's once in Chicago and I was unsure if this would taste exactly the same..... WELL IT DOES! Our server, Ken, was so helpful and knowledgeable, he made it an even better experience! We got the stuff crust, medium for $25 (more than enough for 2 people) we ended up taking most of it home. Of course, the cheese pull pictures are my MOST favorite, I also loved the pastry crust. It's flaky and soft and crunchy- all at the same time. The patio makes it extra nice to sit outside.

The waitress only offered to take it off the bill. There was no apology and no offering something else. I would not eat here again.

7aVmd3KiyrKoKRHtna6whg.text: Eric the tender of the bar is the reason i would come back here besides the deep dish pizza which lived to the reputation

6Z-C4h1JFrnFTT-s9Ed4ug.text: Nothing special here. Digiorno at best. Didn't have the deep dish which looked a little tastier. Don't even bother with the bruschetta.

la9iQVELG1m59jnyyk90Ww.text: Our waitress was Carolina!!! And she was so great! The food was amazing and Carolina made sure that we had everything that we needed. Great customer service! We will be coming back with more friends next time! Honestly the customer service was excellent and that made the experience even more enjoyable.

vXuiDzxhGavkGu_M2jyB2Q.text: Horrible customer service! The server got my order wrong and simply shrugged his shoulders and said, "I guess I misunderstood".  After spending over  $54 for 2 personal sized pizzas, one would expect a little more. The pizza itself was just okay too. No need for this local to go back...and would not recommend this place to anyone.

8MN_AWAka9INj58EZq8Kyg.text: Love it! Amazing pizza! Nailed it! This pizza place serves Chicago style deep dish pizza, located in Bally's hotels outdoor plaza shops (Grand Bazaar Shops). Also, there's a very convenient carry out window if you want to just take a pizza to go! The restaurant part takes a long time, 40 minutes or so, to make your pizza fresh, so if you're short on time (like we always are!) we always do the carry out window instead! Must do while in Vegas - tasty!

5UUvLkAmQ4e7u8D-1NUPaQ.text: Not good.  Waited 30+ minutes for thin crust which came out burnt and extremely dry.  Not even close to what I expected being a regular Giordanos customer in Chicago.

2UtIaWCG_qcs-n8k7tt4zg.text: Went for a quick bite before work. They have a small takeout window on the first floor where you can sit and eat outside the main restaurant. I got an Individual Pepperoni. Twelve bucks. 4 small slices. Crust was very dry, almost like a cracker. Unacceptable for Vegas. My fault, I guess, for being a local and eating on the strip like a tourist!

ksssoe2WfxNoheQesBX2Fg.text: The food was delicious, we had the sampler appetizer and deep dish triple meat pizza. A special thanks to our waitress Carolina who made this such a memorable experience!! I'll definitely be back!

S2Hsn0ZANhFNiskIFrlB3g.text: Very disappointed with this place. Was recommended by a few others and so we went and ordered a small salad and deep dish pizza. Salad came out within 5 minutes and was told the pizza would be 45 or so minutes. After almost an hour and not being updated or checked on, I had to ask. Was told 10 more minutes and was patient and waited. Another 15 minutes passed and asked again and at that point the hostess chimed in. She blamed us for getting a pizza and said we should have known it would take an hour. Our pizza was ready finally and we asked for it to go because we were done sitting there. The bartender seemed mad and wasn't polite once we asked for it to go. We paid and he didn't apologize or say a thing. On our way out the hostess snickered and walked to the bartender to clearly say something. It's awful that we were recommended here and spent our Monday night waiting on food that no one seemed to care about in the restaurant. We will not be back nor recommended this places. We did not expect anything but for the bartender to at least check in and keep us updated - that should be expected at any restaurant. Awful hostess - very rude and VERY disappointed with this place.

qaYz6-qQkn2extjOmz3saQ.text: I loved everything about it! Pizza was sooo delicious! Customer service was amazing. Very very nice people! Especially Carolina, she was a very sweet lady. She was super nice and super friendly! I really enjoyed her being my server. She was always checking on us and had a very positive attitude! I definitely recommend this place its so nice the way its setup. Great food no problems at all!

8r5ALPagb6iHgus_T1A8zg.text: Absolutely the worst experience i have ever had living out here in vegas. Went to go grab a bite to eat and waited 10 mins to be seats which was perfect because they said it would take 30 mins to be seats we were able to pre order our pizza before being seats let's say our waiter didn't even know we pre ordered. once we were seated got our drinks got an appetizer waited a hold damn hour still no pizza while we had friends waiting to hang out. we watched people who came in after us get their food and everything yet i felt like i was being watched because of my skin color. let alone after we said we didn't want our pizza any more and would find food somewhere else it finally shows up but the hostess didn't tell anyone we didn't want our food. Never ever ever going back to this place!!!!!! i'll be telling everyone what kind of shitty service you guys are running. if i can give you no stars then i so would

YvTPpYPoaCcYptAPGC9dEw.text: Thought I had deep dish pizza until I had it at Giordanos! OMG the deep dish and beef sands are AMAZING. A must place to take friends and family who visit.

QGukJH5xAHRLGPP2KhctHg.text: Great service and great food. Pizza takes a little longer to cook but it's worth the wait. Liked it so much we ordered pies online to ship to us in California.

GnJCfY3_qotKskGHZ7AXUg.text: Pizza was everything I expected. Having enjoyed Giordanos  in Florida I was totally excited that there was a new location in Vegas. Service was awesome and our waiter Will ( Big Juicy) made dinner even more of a joy.  I will certainly eat here when I am in Vegas and recommend this pizza for anyone who loves a great deep dish pizza.

UEJxMlGTR46nYur2cxI6ZQ.text: told us kitchen will close in 1hour,pizza takes 40 minutes -1 hour.Why don't u just simply tell us sorry,pizza was sold out?That sounds better and more polite!The worst waitress I've ever seen!

The deep dish takes 45 minutes to prepare but it's amazing!  So delicious and cheesy and sinfully fattening. Best cheat meal ever!  Have a cold pitcher of beer as well!

uEvQiQhrXzn20T-ZhSKnIQ.text: I have to say this is the best Italian food I've had to date. I'm usually underwhelmed by Italian food in general but the garlic bread was absolutely delicious, the spaghetti and meat balls were very good as well. For me there was something stellar about the way the food was prepared and seasoned. I have no problem giving 5 stars for the food and the service. I will be back if and when I come into town.

z3qRn24ZI2yAFftoVtWNYQ.text: It's amazing!!!! I highly recommend. Super friendly staff. They couldn't accommodate a pitcher of mojito but i totally understand. #ranchallover

uUSUQpmOf9QyZUYPpicnqw.text: Good Pizza would probably get 4 stars if I had not been to the locations in Chicago. The service was ok but needed some help. The Pizza was good but Not like Chicago. It was much less of everything, not as stuffed and deep, and not enough sauce. The Pizza at their Chicago locations has had me spoiled sorry to say. The Chicago locations pizza are huge. I could only maybe eat 1 to 2 slices at the Most in Chicago. But here in Las Vegas the pizza I ate tonight was not the same. I was able to eat 3 almost 4 slices. Plus at $33 for a medium pizza that me and my boyfriend shared? That is a lot of money for what we got. Maybe with a little more work, they could catch up to their Chicago locations quality.

_mNTAssJeFxKCsAZwru-aQ.text: Delicious pizza , when we got here we didn't wait to sit down on a busy Sunday . Had the meat lovers pizza deep dish with appetizers of cheese bread . If your in Vegas and are in the mood for really good deep dish pizza , this is the spot

HmgOtTSVidYekSMUE893Xg.text: Be prepared to wait a very long time for their deep dish pizza ! They let you pre-order any of the pizzas while you wait to be seated. The pizza took a good 45 minutes to almost an hour. I've seen some couples having blank stares at the wall while waiting for their food lol. So it's good to come here with good company.  We ordered appetizers and drinks while we waited for our pizza. Their house salad and buffalo wings took a while to come out too but it was well worth the wait along with the pizza. We had the small Chicago classic deep dish pizza (23.75$) which was the perfect serving for three people. It came with pepperoni , mushrooms , green peppers and onions. We ordered ours without onions but it came out with no green peppers instead. We didn't really mind eating the onions or not having the green peppers (it would only be a problem for us if one of us were allergic to onions) plus it would be a hassle to take back the order and wait another 45 minutes for our new pizza to come out. The deep dish pizza still tasted pretty amazing though even with the onions.  Service was top notch and I love the ambiance they have. They have both an upstairs & downstairs along with a take-out booth. It's easy to find at the Grand Bazaar Shops @ Bally's hotel. I had no problem with parking although I can see it being hectic on the weekends & holidays. Overall , I say this place to worth going out to on the strip as a local (and non-locals) ! Prices aren't that bad either being on the strip and the quality of the food.

QAVpeHmFcoLQppOSaHTcOA.text: I don't understand what all the hype about this place is. I came in for lunch during the week and it didn't seem too busy, we sat outside on the patio. It was a nice day out.  That's about all that was good for this visit. We ordered beers and appetizers knowing that our deep dish pizza would take 45-50 minutes to be ready.  Our beer took 20 mins to arrive and the appetizer never came out. It took 90 mins to receive our pizza  and it wasn't bubbling hot. It was like it had been sitting out for a while. Warm but not hot enough to make that cheese pull.  Yes, we spoke with a Manager. No, it didn't fix anything.  Seriously, why would anyone eat here? Service sucks, food wasn't great. Not worth it. Skip it.

EmQZBGlKuT28xRIX-dgJng.text: Did not have good experience as expected based on the reviews. The waitress was hurring to get the order placed. Also mislead on the portion size when asked about. The worst deepdish pizza! There is just too much cheese few toppings. Marinara sauce was also the worst I ever had. The place is just over hipped because of location.

mxToElzbyUNqWRLk-NKMuQ.text: Spectacular customer service! GM really cares about the brand image and it shows. Second time here was much better. Pizza came out perfect!

KhhZ5V0YK2GxwvWHM-Z4ug.text: The deep dish comes with a fair warning from the waiter-that it takes about 45min, so we passed since we were on a limited lunch break. GREAT NEWS! Because, we ordered the Italian Beef sandwich and it was DANG GOOD-with a capital D.  Lots of tender beef, nice toppings traditional to a Chicago sandwich, served with flavorful au jus.  Service was fast, friendly, efficient. Water stayed full, sofa stayed full. Bill arrived without delay and we thoroughly appreciated the value of the meal!

DOCj9Ur2KCmzrCEQdSt1Cg.text: The pizza was great, y'all can't expect it to be amazing like the New York Style. But it's close to perfection. No tea no shade but the pizzas are probably frozen, hey that doesn't mean they aren't good. I enjoyed the customer service along with the food.

_Wa6aE1VIH4Jfvs8-UHh5g.text: Would you like a pizza with your cheese? That's pretty much what a chicago deep dish pizza is all about. If you don't like cheese, I do suggest you turn your little tush around and walk out before you do something you'll end up regretting.   Came here to have an early dinner with my boyfriend, his cousin, and my brother. We've been hearing and seeing so much about Giordano's and it was a perfect opportunity to go. The cousin was visiting from overseas and he loves burgers and pizzas so what's better than showing him something he can't find outside of America?   We were seated rather quickly after we got to the establishment. They actually have two locations -- sort of. One outdoor area and one that's indoors but on the upper floor.   Beware, if you're ordering a pizza, be sure you know which one you want asap and order that first because their pizzas take a good amount of time to be cooked.   We ended up ordering a house salad, cheesy garlic bread, and their small classic chicago deep dish pizza. The salad was a salad. Th cheesy garlic bread was pretty good -- although, I may prefer regular garlic bread. It had good flavor but I think the cheese interrupts a lot of the buttery garlic goodness. To me, anyways.   The pizza, oh man, the pizza. Cheesy, gooey, warm, hearty, fulfilling goodness. There was pepperoni, bell peppers, mushrooms, and onions. But who cares what's in it! It's the CHEESE that matters! It was DELICIOUS GOODNESS. If you get a large size of their stuffed deep dish pizza, they put 1 kilo of cheese in it, which is roughly 2.2lbs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is very filling though so be sure you come hungry, otherwise, you won't be eating much and you'll be facing a lot of left overs. I only managed to eat one slice of the pizza cause it was just too much for me! Regardless though, it was very delicious.   The prices of everything were also very reasonable for the strip. We got a pitcher of blue moon and it only cost about $17. That was 4 glasses of beer .. which would've cost us close to $28 total if we were to drink elsewhere.  I would definitely recommend Giordano's if you're in the area and if you love cheese :)

Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeeeese! Chicago classic

5QQw13be3XAF9J5eymXdnQ.text: After a bad experience I was contacted with intentions of " making everything better" I was emailed once and then ignored ... it seems the efforts fall short after an initial reaching out! I seriously hope between the service in Vegas and whichever branch of management is over social media reviews... the ownership or board considers a TOTAL revamp of the company.  Tres sad!!!

Kez4diqQ-qh7Yr3EWw_qMw.text: I placed an order for take out, they gave me a 45-50 minute estimate to pick up. It's now been over an hour and a half and the order is still not ready. I understand the pizza taking a while because it's deep dish but please provide an accurate order time. I would have maybe chose something else to order.

CSDkzoDpZna6bXsf6Fwwzw.text: The upstairs restaurant was full when we arrived, as was the bar, so the hostess sent us to the downstairs bar. It is enclosed, but in the middle of the concourse at Bally's Grand Bazaar Shops. How fun! It was a chilly night, but the overhead heaters kept us warm. The TV's and the crowd passing by kept us entertained. The service kept us happy. The Stuffed Chicago Classic kept us wishing we lived closer to a Giordanos. Keep in mind that this is deep dish pizza, and the wait staff will tell you that it takes 45 minutes to prepare (it's worth the wait!). I'll suggest the Calamari as an appetizer---some of the best we have had!

8k_z9jUqddLMCmr4RVZx3Q.text: I was in Las Vegas by myself attending a convention.   I was looking for a place to grab dinner and was excited to see the familiar pizza chain l'd stumbled into years earlier on a business trip to Chicago.  While I was seated quickly, I felt ignored as a single individual.   I ordered a deep dish individual pizza and a beer to enjoy while I waited for my pizza.  I was aware their deep dish pizza take an hour to bake but was okay with that knowing how great my last experience was.  When the pizza arrived and I dug in I became disappointed quickly.  Where was the pepperoni?  How can you have a pepperoni pizza without pepperoni?  While I understand I ordered a individual deep dish, I expected it to be a mini version of a full pizza.    It was not.  I attend a conversation every year in Las Vegas and the disappointing experience won't get me rushing back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bun6CLPJAY9jyGJgnp7glg.text: Move over Gina's West, Gina's East and UNO's. This is my favorite Chicago style pizza. I was so excited to find they opened a location in Las Vegas. The method of making this thick crust pizza truly delivers on flavor.

S8wy93MJnEMtp_glvUlpvQ.text: The SECOND best Chi Town deep dish makes it to Vegas!  I don't care if I cause a fight.  I'm a Malnati's fan but that said, there is no better example of the deep dish in Vegas at the moment.  If you never had a deep dish in Chicago, you don't know what you're missing.  Beautiful golden brown, buttery crust adds incredible richness to what must be a 2" deep,  5lb, loaded pie full of sweet Italian sausage, spicy pepperoni, salami, and bacon all sitting atop a molten lake of melted mozzarella topped by a chunky crushed tomato sauce ("meat & more meat").  Need a little veg to feel healthy?  The "Special" replaces the pure carnivore stuffing with sausage, mushrooms, green peppers and onions and IMHO is better than the "Chicago Classic" that subs pepperoni for the incredible Italian sausage.  Best part of the veg, despite the long cooking time, all add flavor while still maintaining some integrity and none, including the mushrooms leave residual water in the pie.  There are more creative pies for the non traditionalist including a vegetarian option.  Additional non traditional fillings (olives, broccoli, jalepenos, meatballs, anchovies, bbq chicken, chicken breast, pesto chicken, and heaven forbid pineapple are all available if you just gotta go all West Coast and ruin the classic.  Note:  Deep dish pies take 45 minutes to cook.  Follow the recommended serving suggestions, they are large.  Think in pounds not ounces.   Tip:  skip the starters, pastas, sandwiches, and ridiculous thin crust.  Keep your eye on the prize.  Efficient, Strip friendly service.    While not as good as the same pies in Chicago; could be the water, the air, maybe the sweat from the Midwest pizza maker, perhaps the angst of Chicago itself, it's still plenty authentic and just plain good.

PXIAiCmPhQjoq4fNpVvuKA.text: When I found out Vegas was opening a Giordano's, I could not rush there more quickly. I fell in love with the pizza in its hometown, Chicago, and it did not disappoint in Vegas as the taste I remembered was the same. You need to get the deep dish. It takes 45 minutes to make the pizza, so be prepared to wait awhile and enjoy yourself, or order ahead of time so it will be ready when you get there.  The ambience is clean, and there are floor-to-ceiling windows all around the restaurants with views on the strip. The inside is clean, and the service is spot on. It is kind of a pain to get to, but worth the paying for parking, and walking 10-20 minutes. I like to park at the Bellagio, check out the gardens and walk by the fountain on my way to the restaurant as it is at the front entrance of Bally's.   The prices are reasonable, and this restaurant would be a good option to celebrate a special event. It is spacious enough to accommodate bigger groups.   If you can't get to Chicago, go here. Worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

e8HEM-dOSZaYV-XASbuO0A.text: Famous deep dish pizzas, but they have thin crust too. Build your own or try one of their iconic creations! We had the meat, meat, and more...yum! Not a place for a quick lunch as the average pizza takes 30 minutes to cook. Worth the wait

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G73eqBQN-THgPIrCzz1Y6w.text: People should be glad Gio's finally made its way down to Las Vegas.  Located at Ballys new promenade, it's on the 2nd floor in a decent sized area.  Full bar w/TV's playing sports and a pretty slick view of the strip.  Tried the sample platter and caesar salad which were both solid before we had the main course: Deep Dish.  The 2 deep dishes that we ordered (Chicago, pepperoni), were delicious.  All fresh ingredients were you can truly taste the food. Great flaky crust but that's pretty much all the bread you get as it's loaded with cheese, sauce and toppings which is not a bad thing at all especially if you love cheese. One slice was pretty filling; wanna say it tasted like the Gio's back in Chicago but it's not quite there.. Maybe it's the water, ha!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pic don&#39;t do these pies justice.

3oIHtvV8rU02oZA8CfmaGw.text: We went to Giordano's to go ahead and try to Chicago Pizza, but we still did have some miscommunication in regards to the order, but everything was settled.  This place is located in the shopping mall right in front of bally's, which was not a far walk since we were staying at the Paris hotel.  We decided to sit at the table in which we asked for a chicago pizza and also requested to have happy hour as well. The server told us that we would need to sit at the bar in order to get the happy hour deals (50% off on draft pints, which is around 2.50 depending on the beer.  We decided to change seats and understood that we had to wait for the pizza (about 45 mins). I decided to ask the server again if they had placed the order in after 30 just because I felt something off. The server said he did not because we changes from a table seating to the bar, but after a bit, the server let the bartender know that to put in or order and speed up it because the order wasn't placed in. Since we didn't have any time constraints, my friend and I were cool with waiting (since we did not have any time constraints for that day) and just ordered more beer due to the happy hour prices. The bartender came by after a bit and said that due to the mixup, they offered to waive our whole pizza as long as we paid for the beer. We still offered to pay for the pizza and beer since this was a communication mixup on both parties.  We were able to get our Pizza, which was a small chicago style - meat and more meat pizza. The crust was really nice and flaky, almost like a pastry crust and the amount of cheese and toppings in each slice lets you know that this pizza will fill you up. The amount of cheese and toppings makes it feel like a different experience than your normal pizza. The ingredients themselves were tasty and were nicely cooked. My friend and I were able to finish the whole pizza and were stuffed by the end.   Even though they waived the pizza, we still left a tip just because they were willing to fix something that wasn't exactly their fault. We did have to stay for more than two hours, but nevertheless the beer was good.  All in all I would come back to this place for the happy hour deals and just to share a slice or two of Chicago style pizza with some friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and More Meat Chicago Style Pizza w/ alot of Stella Artois

OkcCI9xruiHKy0wMCWMjXw.text: Had this the first time in Chicago. Now that it is here I am in heaven. Great food. Great service.

wuZfJ0M7AtOIOSJHYtw9Vw.text: This is the BEST pizza! You cannot miss it when you visit Las Vegas. They have deep dish, but it isn't just crust. It is more like thin pieces of crust layered with cheese and sauce. Like a delicious pizza lasanga. :-) The service is also wonderful. Carolina is the best (hopefully I'm spelling her name correctly)! She was our server the other night and we couldn't have asked for any better service. Great pizza, great service. Do it!

41Bixom9i8Gig2OBCn58IQ.text: I've been to the one in Chicago and now in Vegas. The pizza is amazing!!! The service was was superb. Everyone was helpful and polite.

7MheEd0HdknVAo52YfU4-w.text: This pizza is as good as it looks. The wait time can be around 45 minutes, but it's absolutely worth it. The bartender or manager was very attentive as well. The area it's located in keeps you occupied while you wait, great for people watching!

jMF-F6wc33S_rCNjHP99zA.text: Worst service I've ever gotten............. the server ignored us. As well as other people with different severs got their food before us even though we had ordered before them about 30 min before them........ we ordered the same from what it seemed the regular cheese and pepperoni pizza. If I could give them no star I would.

E5bwPkLyI0H__iJ_2Xj75Q.text: Not sure what happened to Giordanos.I have fond memories of the pizza as a teenager in Chicago so I was very excited to hear they opened one in Vegas. The wait was about 40mins for a deep dish pizza but I didnt mind. They also have a to-go window with pizzas already made and hot waiting but I wanted the real deal fresh off the oven version so I waited.The service was great and employees very nice. The upstairs restaurant was cool too with nice decor.The missing star of the show was the pizza. The ingridients did not taste fresh. The sauce was just "ok" but I remembered it being so much better than it was. The itakian sausage was actually not very tasty or good. The sausage just didnt taste that great and I was surprised. The pepperoni tasted like hornel brand and not very good quality. I dont know. Maybe my tastebuds overhyped the pizza as a kid but its just not that great anymore. Its good pizza but not great and I actually will likely throw away the leftovers. Maybe it taste better a day later. The cheese did taste good and fresh. Given all the calories and the wait, I would not come back for "ok" pizza. They do have regular crust pizza which takes less time and looked great. The presentation of the deep dish pizza was great just the taste was mediocre. I tried it a few years back again in Chicago and alao felt the exact same way. Something is off with the taste and I cant put my finger on it. Sadly I would not go back to any of the restaurants anymore. I guess you can never go home again :(  I also found the pizza to be salty (likely due to the pepperoni and sausage). but I also feel they skimped on the sauce. you had all this cheese and meat and barely a covering of sauce. I dont know I really was a bit disappointed and it totally turned me off to the whole brand. The pizzas used to be so good at Giordanos. Just not sure what happened.

qsITbeUeIJFpN1CoqkNV8g.text: After we ate here we had diarrhea and severe stomach ache the last few days. I am sorry but we will never return to this location, besides the Chicago locations are way better than Las Vegas. Very disappointed.

ET3N79Uf5IkWKAm5by0FKA.text: I am from Chicago and this Giordano's is actually better than the Chicago locations. Our waitress was Carolina and she has so helpful and made it I have a great experience. We will definitely be back!

ZQL10eNomwn6Jie6XgjedQ.text: I signed up for Yelp, just to spread the word that this place is just as great as the flagship Rush Street Location in Chicago. The Pizzas were terrific and staff are great. Three slices and you are full, not just of pizza but delight. I actually flew in from Los Angeles, for the sole purpose of tasting hot fresh Giordano's pizza  and it matched the quality typical of any Illinois location.

N2hVIt14MJ4RIbnAUcgctw.text: Enjoyed a delicious meal of appetizers salads and deep dish pizza ending with desserts .. great service by server Dominic and Michael the director of operations ... very attentive to our table needs and always had fresh plates for each course .. they both gave us warm welcoming and treated us with their upmost care.. I highly recommend this place if ur wanting real quality pizza .. well worth the drive and time to dine here !! We will be coming back as regulars ..

OzsicIqdmOzG9N-AypdVIQ.text: Was in Vegas and decided to eat at Giordano's. We had a great experience mostly because of Will " Big Juicy".  Thanks for the great service!

uFYkXUOY8HUv7GKArcEUZw.text: Finally, perfect Chicago deep-dish pizza has come to Las Vegas.  Everything here is great, from the salads to the garlic bread to the pizza to the cannolis.  It's not cheap, but it's fantastic.

TzMrmZ0AdyKuxOirTGOjzA.text: Absolutely amazing!!!! When we got there the wait time was 30 to 45 minutes unless we wanted to sit at the bar. Knowing that it takes 45 minutes for the best pizza ever we chose to sit at the bar, which was the best decision. Jackie was our server and she was phenomenal. I have never had service anywhere before the way she was. The place was packed and she kept her cool and between her and katilyn(?) they kept the bar running smoothly even with the getting everyone at the bar their food asap. Even if the food sucked which it didn't i would come back just to sit at the bar and eat with them there. Looking for food suggestions the deep dish is amazing just remember perfection takes 45 minutes to cook and if you are looking for an appetizer and love garlic the cheesy garlic bread is to die for. Jackie and Kaitlyn were the absolute best just cannot get over how good the service was for such a busy night.

AgftltuozSuooozMi_6RoA.text: This place is seriously legit, just like the one in Chicago. Great service, our server Carolina was so wonderful. Incredible location and view . You've got to go here when you are Vegas.

U1WFrm5aE3UXlHwkvbD6Yw.text: Great view of Las Vegas strip.  Enjoyed our Chicago Deep dish pizza and pastas.  Reminded us of Midwest days!  Server was attentive and offered great recommendations.  First try by our 10 yr old daughter who was impressed by the cheesy goodness.  Will come again with out -of-town guests.  Note it takes approx. 45 mins for deep dish so plan accordingly.

ZVloz3vxmNh2ELAe3JatXw.text: Great service and food options! Would definitely come again next time I'm in Vegas. I loved the chicken.pesto pizza

5C5Ylvru65_sgdhUpVgl7w.text: We went to Giordano's today for my husbands birthday. We got there right at 11 when they opened and were the seated first. Our waiter Markus informed us right when we sat down that it would be 45 minutes for a deep dish pizza, so we ordered it right away when he took our drink order. We told him to get the drinks and we would order the appetizers/salads. Well we got our drinks from a runner and didnt see our server until we got our check. I had to order a salad 45 minutes after getting our drinks from a runner. You'd think that if it was a 45 minute wait for pizza they would see if we wanted any appetizers or at least keep our drinks full the whole time, which wasn't the case. We got our kids food 15 minutes after ordering then waited an hour and 5 minutes for our pizza!!! We were the very first order of the day. By the time we got the pizza our kids were done eating and ready to go. So my husband and i ate a slice or two and got a box for the rest. We went to pay the check and left the box on the table weny back to get it and they threw our pizza away!!! The pizza we waited an hour and 5 minutes for and paid for. Service was absolutely horrible and the manager didn't do a dang thing, didn't even help his staff. It looked like only two servers were in the floor while we were there. The runners did more work than the wait staff and manager. Thanks for a great birthday lunch that my whole family was truly looking forward to....we will definitely NOT BE BACK!!

GC9qbghJh2CHJm0LM5Cv9Q.text: We had been anxiously awaiting our visit to Giordano's ever since we first heard they were coming to Las Vegas. We got there about 4pm on a Monday night and the restaurant was not crowded. They only have a few booths for large parties, so we sat by the windows overlooking the shops at Bally's. We both had eaten at Giordano's in Chicago before so we knew exactly what we wanted and order our  Medium Sausage/Mushroom Deep dish pizza right away. The pizza took 1 hour to make it to our table, so plan accordingly if you are in a hurry. The pizza was good but had hardly any sausage or mushrooms. For $27.00 you would expect this pizza to have more meat on it. The crust was as good as we remember. But I must also comment on the cheese, which oozes all over the place once the pizza is cut (not crazy about that). Giordano's is not the best pizza place in Chicago, but it is the best Chicago deep dish pizza in Las Vegas. We will definitely be back to try the extra thin pizza, and hope if will be our new thin crust pizzeria in Las Vegas.

m_fgVsZT-luNv9DB7Xyuug.text: I give this review a 2 star only because the pizza was amazing and if it weren't for the pizza I would give absolutely no stars to one of the most awkward and uncomfortable dining in experiences I have ever had. Let's start with the moment I walked in. At approximately 3:35p on Jan 20 we walked in and were never greeted so then I brought it to the hostess attention that I had called in an order and was told that the pizza would be ready. prior to this day we came in a week ago to enjoy a giordanos pizza only to find out that the wait time unfortunately was not a fit for my wrk schedule that night so the guys told us we can call in next time so that our pizza would be ready for dine-in. Back to the hostess today, she asked if we ordered it to go, I told her no one asked me if it was to go or for dine in so we would like to dine in. By the look in her face she looked annoyed to have to seat us and told us "I have to ask a manager if it was possible for them to seat us" as I look around the empty room with absolutely NO line and about 20 open tables. I felt like the decision was pretty obvious. As she comes back she said "they will try to figure it out". The manager then comes to our table and asked if we were dining in as if the first time I told them wasn't enough. She then seats us and asked if we wanted to keep our pizza in the to-go box or place it on a tray the way any other dine-in customer has it. We then said "it doesn't matter, thank you" so then one of the girls brought it out to our table in the to go box. We then stared blankly at each other wondering why an establishment this big had a problem with setting up our dish on a tray for paying customers as if it were out of their way to serve us. It's a PIZZA!! not that hard to put on a tray. Not only did they make us feel uncomfortable we were also ready to enjoy a few drinks from the bar and as I was trying to pull the pizza out of the box another server comes to help us and puts the pizza back in the box, accidentally, cause the manager/staff didn't inform him we were in fact going to dine in. Not only was he not informed but neither were the two serves after him. Don't get me wrong, they (men) did their job accordingly. But at this point we didn't know who our server even was. We didn't have a set server. As we're sitting there still thirsty, we never properly got served because we never had a set waiter to ask what exactly we wanted to drink. The manager instead brings us just waters but never once asked if we wanted anything else to drink. At this point we can see the girls (manager and hostess) discussing how annoying we were to them as if they couldn't have that conversation in the back without making it obvious. Already one slice in, one of the girls says we cannot pay in there, we need to go down stairs to pay for our meal. After everything we went through we just ok, that's fine thank you. Then we get ANOTHER server come tell us he would switch our ticket so we can pay up in the dining area instead of having to go down stairs but one of the girls proceeded to tell him we had to go down stairs. Our second slice in, one of the male servers was nice enough to refill our water and got us our bill for us instead of having us go down stairs. In my head I'm thinking 'how was this so hard for them to seat us, serve us, and bring our ticket'?! There must not be a hiring process to work here. We then have another server bring us our check in which this point we have no idea who we were to tip. We were honestly just ready to get out of that restaurant and as we walk toward the doors on our way out, both the female manager with the glasses and hostess give us an ugly look and continue their conversation as if we were a burden to that place. The male servers, however were great and tried to keep us happy. Pizza was delicious but dining here again isn't something that sounds too convincing. Now, not ONCE did we have an attitude or be rude with them what so ever and still kept a smile on our faces but if this was my establishment, I'd definitely look into the staff represents giordanos

_R5g2ocX49lemXWEIRvSjw.text: My first and last visit here was very unpleasant. I was baffled at the type of service my family and I received during our dine here.  It was our first time trying deep dish pizza and we were really excited. Although we were really hungry, we didn't mind the 45 minute wait. After the 1 hour mark hit, we started getting a little antsy. The table behind us who arrived after us received their food first. PLUS, they ordered the same dish as us! Our server asked if we wanted the Fettuccine Alfredo first or altogether. We were starving so we asked for the pasta to come out whenever it's ready. I'm taking a huge guess by saying that they gave our order to the table behind us by mistake. More than an hour passed by and we were ready to leave. My parents were so upset and that made me even more angry. It's their first trip back to Vegas in years and the service from this restaurant was a huge disappointment. Please be honest with your customers and tell us that you made a mistake by sending the same order to the wrong table. Do not give us False hope by telling us it'll be ready in five mins when you've said that already the last 5 times. As we were about to get up to leave, our food finally arrived.   The taste was mediocre. Definitely not worth the service or the wait. The table behind us who received the same order first, took two bites, and asked for the check. What a waste! Guess they weren't satisfied with the taste as well.   Please note that only service dogs are allowed. Even if you bring your service dog, it is frowned upon and the servers will give you shit for having one.  Not the most friendly place in Vegas. You could do better. Take your family elsewhere and stay away from this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is it so hard to get a refill?
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo Large Portion
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super Veggie Deep Dish

8tqtzERbIRkEG3COMM1J3A.text: Our son has EOE and it's tough finding places that have any menu items that meet his restrictive diet due to his allergies. It's even tougher finding a place with menu items he'll actually like, and even tougher when it's Italian food. For those not in the EOE world, our son is on a "Top 8" elimination diet, so no soy, eggs, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, shellfish, dairy, or wheat/gluten. After a discussion with our server, who took our laminated wallet card with our son's restrictions back to the chef, we ordered him the vegetarian/vegan spaghetti with the gluten-free pasta. He loved it!   Living in Vegas, all our relatives come to visit; and we usually end up doing a day down on the strip. A reasonably-priced Italian restaurant with something our son likes in a centrally-located casino is a needle-in-a-haystack kind of place. And on top of all that the service and food were both above average for places at this price point located on the strip.  This is now our go-to option!

Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu photos
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu photos

GbrxXw3c5NIAFg6mLc6-kA.text: For my first time ever having deep dish pizza it was fantastic! I would definitely recommend loving cheese if you go here.  Round 1: The BBQ chicken bites were dipped generously and the ranch was fantastic. They also brought them out very quickly. I would say they are great to feed 2-3 people for an appetizer.  Round 2: Pepperoni and cheese deep dish. I was blown away with the amount of cheese and the quality of the sauce they used. The fact the server asked if we wanted her to serve the first slice was a nice touch. The small will feed 2-3 people.   Service was fantastic and the speed overall was great!   10/10 recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nDKXNJqALj4XWbg89mmRzw.text: I had had Giordanos bookmarked for awhile and finally got to try it recently.  We were promptly seated at lunchtime by the window with a view of the Grand Bazaar Shops and the Strip, but while the view was nice, spacing was quite tight in that area and I had a wobbly chair.  Also, when we asked our server a question, rather than ask if we needed more time to decide (we didn't), she just walked off.  Service was fine after that, and I don't know if it was because I was starving but I thought the food was good.  If getting deep dish pizza, they recommend ordering an appetizer as it takes 45 minutes for the pizza to cook.  We did just that and ordered a Caesar salad, along with our half Special and half Chicago Classic pizza for 2.  I liked the salad, but my dining companion thought it was too saucy and didn't have enough pepper.  As for the pizza, talk about filling!  A small was more than enough for two people to share.  Come with an appetite, or be ready to take home leftovers.  It was a good lunch spot for us two hungry people to satisfy our appetites.

qDQSTekERhkQ-ZH0qzUuuQ.text: Best pizza and Cesar salad ever   I highly recommend!  Good price point and good for the whole family  Extensive beer & cocktail list as well. We didn't even make reservation

ZA_guTPcCUU52GvM4dR6lg.text: This place gets pretty packed so expect to wait awhile to be seated. They have one location on the bottom terrace right outside of Bally's and one on the second to the right as you walk out from the bridge that takes you from Bally's and to the Strip.   We first ordered the fried calamari, mozzarella triangles, and the garlic cheese bread. My favorite was the mozzarella triangles. They give a pretty good serving of each appetizer which is great. You will want more once you are done with it.   The pizza is Chicago styled and tastes great. The dough is not too greasy and is cooked to perfection. We ordered the meat lovers version that they have here and loved it. The sausage was a little on the spicy side but very tasty.   I would have given a higher rating but our waiter (Garvey-think that's what his name was) didn't really attend to us as much as we wanted him to. It seemed that he forgot about us because we never got refills on our drinks, took awhile to get a box for our leftovers, and to get our check. We ended up asking another waiter for everything and that's when Garvey came back but it already had ruined the experience.   For all the money we paid, attentiveness and ensuring your customers needs is a must.

VIE5hjyva7n_jiA6MVwO7w.text: Good pizza but way overpriced. They wanted to charge us 12 dollars to add green olives to one of their signature pizzas. Better less expensive pizza on the strip.

f-1ZFnNzR7y6S4EWUjojPA.text: We had the Chicago style pizza. Order early because it takes awhile to cook. It was delicious! It was busy but service was good. Definitely give it a try.

E-XfqX9ohnKxHY4Zi2XJIw.text: Ambiance Giordanos - Las Vegas is a gorgeous place that is right in the area of where Bally's is located.  The interior is very modern and inviting.    Food This is a great way to taste True Chicago style pizza in Las Vegas.  These pizzas are very filling.  One only needs one or two slices to be filled up.  Do not order a gigantic pizza unless with a group of people.  Be prepared to wait around 45 minutes for the pizza to be made.  Go and order ahead if one does not want to wait.  Service The customer service was ok.  A little bit slow at times but overall it was satisfactory.

PF_5oROXQzzKLVvFX81c8g.text: Yummy to my tummy...this was hands down the best pizza I have ever tasted in my life. The wait is well worth it. I can't wait to go back to Vegas just to experience this amazing pizza again. If your in town, this is the place to go. I can't wait for more.....

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MdIPD0vd5iHkBR5PZMPpQw.text: After a concert on the Strip, we we're feeling a little hungry. Stopped upon this gem that had a smaller location on the ground, and then upstairs was the full restaurant. We went up to the restaurant and had some pretty amazing deep dish. I myself, am never a huge thick crust fan, but this was buttery and delicious. The pizza was great, the side salad was super simple yet oh so good! It was a great way to end our night!

QXlZAELvjurGPWkw1eLX6w.text: Great place to hit while in Vegas! I had never really tried Chicago Deep Dish pizza, so I planned to visit Giordano's during our trip.  Wait time was about 20-25 mins, not too bad. Our server was scatterbrained, but thank god for the bussers who kept my water filled anyway.  Prices were really not too bad in my opinion. Husband and I got out of there with a $35 check. We started with fried mozzarella, which were a nice portion (I want to say it was 8 triangles). They came out piping hot and just delicious. Word of advice, deep dish pizza takes time, so do yourself a favor and order an appetizer.  We both ordered the personal 6" size deep dish, build your own with our desired toppings. Those came out piping hot, in fact so hot that we decided to take them to go. Nothing against the restaurant, we were just tired and wanted to return to our hotel quickly. Once we got back, the pizzas were still hot and absolutely delicious. They do not skimp on cheese or toppings. Their gardineira is very nice, and spicy! Definitely recommend Giordano's! If we ever come back to Vegas, I know I'll be back here again.

v1ZCedSlbyPlI6orRteHmA.text: Best pizza I have tasted in my life! I've had many types of pizzas from so many places but this one is hands down the best I have ever had! Their deep dish is to die for! Just make sure you come in with some time for your pizza to get done, about 50 min. It's a little bit pricey but well worth it. I had some left over and had it for breakfast, warmed it up in the microwave and it was still bomb! I'm literally planning a trip to Vegas just to go back to this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish, pepperoni and sausage

bejVrUFQIFopJW_5lGnrsg.text: So, this was my first time ever eating authentic, Chicago style pizza.  We ordered the one that comes with pepperoni, sausage, salami, and ham.  It was absolutely delicious and definitely filling.  We ordered garlic bread as well but to be honest, it was mediocre.  Worst part about the whole experience is that you have to wait 45 minutes for your pizza.  It's so worth it though.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat &amp; More Meat

jV7fcU3XEb52RqWJDN6FxA.text: When have been here plenty of times. DELICIOUS!!! Just had this for lunch, party of 6 our eyes where bigger than out stomachs. Have plenty of pizza for late night munchies. Always recommend this to our friends and family. Have to try........

iCBdx6DOIvn4ZiiMZ042jw.text: You can never go wrong with Giordanos, whether in NYC or here I Vegas.." Always a crowd pleaser, especially when they serve your slice and pullllll the cheese.. Definitely one of our to-go -to " Pizza  Joints !!!!" #stuffeddeepdish when in L V.."

kXL2JEmKHw1-zPhdNL9ukQ.text: Restaurant was clean but staff was rude & not friendly at all. Specifically the manager ERICA greeted me aggressively instead of with a smile & welcoming attitude.  She didn't even offer me a menu & started barking I needed to order food or remove myself from the section.  Regardless of me being a veteran she has no compassion so I decided to not patronize the establishment.  I will mention by name the greeter Xavier was pleasant regardless of the amount of makeup he had on he was nice.  My point is choose wisely where u decide to spend your hard earned money I do not recommend this establishment

-zNUPjNYj-D-LtyIY7jX5g.text: Nothing like the Chicago pizza. Have had it in Chicago, but it was cold, tasteless here. Seems like they deliberately waited until 45 minutes.  Only for me to receive a cold pizza.  Never come here!!!!

qBIj8fiju0kJPY8-e7nYaQ.text: My best friend really wanted to try the Famous Giordano's Pizza and since we weren't going to go to Chicago anytime soon, we thought to try it here around Saturday at 1 am. When we got seated, it took a good 15 minutes for our server to come take our order. We asked if substitutions could be made on one of the speciality pizza's and he said no but we could do the make our own. So we tell him what we want on the make your own pizza but he then specifies it is a thin crust pizza. At that point, we decide we're just go with a small cheese pizza double dish with the toppings of our choice.   He ask us if we want anything to drink and we tell him water. The restaurant is not that busy but our server forgets our drink order and after 10 minutes we chase him down and he promptly brings it to us. The pizza itself took more than 45 minutes to come out and even the table next to us was complaining.  Now when the pizza does arrive, I take a bite into it and the toppings (mushrooms, onions) that I ordered on the pizza are cold and even the dough is not cooked well. The sauce on the pizza lacked any sort of taste. My best friend's pizza also felt cold in the center. We both felt the pizza wasn't freshly made but instead pre-made and warmed up in the microwave. We were disappointed that we just took one bite and asked for the check.  I never met a pizza I didn't like but the lack of good service and the fact the pizza was not fresh makes me feel this particular establishment needs improvement. I will not be back..

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raw pizza dough not cooked well :/

2WrweJedNtcDObF5WWJHRA.text: First time here and man it blew away my expectations! Not a huge pizza person but this place made me fall in love! Definitely what you would consider original Chicago deep dish. Tons of flavor and sauce. The bread was cooked perfectly and it was just enough to sop up the tons of sauce.   One of the must visit places in Vegas whether you're a pizza lover or an occasional eater like myself you will live it!

g8jcGeyOjseRhZoTeaoixQ.text: Fantastic!! Really great stuffed pizza. Of course it takes FOREVER to cook but if you have the time it's worth it. Fabulous

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Jfth-zRZJ834pzFGLqovw.text: I heard a bunch of hype about this place and was not impressed with the quality of the food. I ordered a small pizza with pepperoni and artichokes, chicken alfredo with extra broccoli and a side salad with extra dressing. Got it delivered and it took almost 2 hours to get it. When i asked if they were busy they said "kind of but not really". I live 2 miles away...anyways, the pizza was luke warm, the pasta lacked sauce and didnt have the extra broccoli we ordered and the side salad didnt have extra dressing that we ordered. But they upgraded the side salad to an entree for the wait lol Well After i heated the pizza back up in the oven it did not meet my expectations of a $20 small pizza. For $50+ the food should be better, if not maybe lower the price and people wont expect anything special. Very disapointed.

vM9rcdFf9ekGfZMm0mLv1g.text: We always have a good meal here.  Stuff pizza is the bomb. Order ahead It takes an hour to make but worth it.  pastas are good too.  I wish they open one up in my neighborhood

foCfO4_mkeszjOLsdQ-fiA.text: Super impressed with our server. Deep dish is awesome. Love that they're in Vegas now!

AHvG55t3SSwNgP1k1vC8eg.text: Great experience.. very friendly staff from beginning to end. Hot food and cold drinks. Clean and attentive. Thank you!

jNDsht5jcZVhGjb8fnkYNQ.text: Tried to sit us outside with a broken heater... wait inside was crazy long but grabbed a seat at the bar... always good pizza!

sEB_NQQ1vAFnL7lqgCqKfA.text: Three things  1) Overpriced 2) Overrated 3) Terrible service   We waited for over an hour to be seated. The pizza was good, but we could have gone somewhere else for deep dish. We didn't have a waiter the entire time we were there until it was time to collect the check. Then our check was wrong and it took them 30 minutes to take one item off our bill. The only reason I'm not giving this place one star is because the pizza is at least decent. I hope you have a better experience than we did.

Is8QY_hH5GOa9M5zGlFDnw.text: The wait time was a little too long tonight although we didn't see the restaurant as too busy. My suggestion?  Don't eat outside. It seems Ike there's a delay when one eats at the outdoor tables. The wine took almost 15 minutes to get to us. The pizza itself, over an hour. The 2nd bottle of wine was simply just "dropped off."  The main meal was tepid at best. The appetizer took forever and was actually the last thing we received.   Service left much to be desired.

i2v-T0DRrguMrVjiAxyNfA.text: Waiting for the Pittsburgh Location to open up!! (Hint hint) Giordano's is one of my favorite pizza places from home. You have not have "Chicago" Style pizza until you have the stuffed pizza from them. Be prepared to wait 45min for the perfect pie.....promise you won't be disappointed.
