ZMBidWxhg1NjV_qGnxGPYw.text: Awesome place it was our first time trying deep dish pizza !! We got a small for two people which has 6 slices and after the first two you are stuffed. We customized our own so it came out a little more pricy at about 40$.. but it's Vegas, everything is expensive. Our waiter was so nice!! Definitely recommend this place :)

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Customized small pizza 6 slices. More Than enough for 2 people

loSUrGIyEUjgwmTaBlIdtw.text: Was searching for a last minute dinner for a group of 10-11, when I spotted this Chicago pizza joint. Called ahead and they said they could accommodate our large group.  This is located a bit hidden. You have to walk past all the Grand Bazaar shops from Las Vegas Blvd. When we arrived, they took another 10 minutes to finish readying our tables.  Our group ordered quite a bit (a few members had never tried deep dish. What?!! We remedied that.)  Cheesy Garlic Bread Chopped Salad Italian Beefs (they cut this up for us for sharing) Special & Chicago Classic Deep Dish  Yes, our group stuffed themselves and enjoyed the some of the best of Chicago comfort food.  Staff did a good job keeping up with the drink orders.   We all left satiated and more reasonable  prices for a group our size.

xckyQIgAtSISNY6cMPiKCQ.text: We've been to the Giordano's in Chicago and thought the deep dish pizza was amazing, so on our recent trip to Vegas we brought our kids to their Vegas location on the strip.  Here, Giordano's is split up into two buildings.  On the ground, there's a covered "outdoor" section.  It's encased in glass with large openings so you can enjoy the fresh air.  There are plenty of tables and a long bar area, which is great if you just want a slice and a beer or cocktail.  Behind this are is a large building where Giordano's is on the top, second floor.  There is an escalator (and elevator) to get up there.  Inside, it's another bar and lots of seating along the windows and booths in the back.  We opted for a booth.  It was happy hour time, but our server informed us happy hour was "only at the bar".  Visibly bummed, he said he would talk to his manager, who agreed to allow us to enjoy the happy hour specials even in our booth.  We got a couple of beers  ($8-9 each) and the chicken bites appetizer ($12.95), all half-off normal price.  We also ordered a medium Chicago Classic deep dish pizza (pepperoni, onions & green peppers).  Even with a medium, this is a BIG pizza.  This is truly DEEP dish pizza.  It took roughly 45 min (which our server mentioned it would).  This is a long time so be prepared to drink a couple of brews, or have something to do while you wait.  I wonder if they have "call ahead" service?   Might be worth asking if you're planning on eating here.  Overall the pizza was great.  A little pricey for everything but we saved $18 coming during happy hour time.  There's a million pizza places in Vegas, but this is probably the only place to offer an authentic DEEP DISH pizza, just like the real deal back in Chicago ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now THAT is DEEP DISH!
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The WALL of crust.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cheese here is no joke.

t1UBwRRzZUdVjfA5axxOyQ.text: Dropped in for a late Sunday dinner.  It was pretty slow and we put in our order right away.  My husband wanted the Meat & More Meat deep dish...laden with cheese, sausage, sauce, pepperoni, bacon, and salami. It arrived at our table 45 minutes later.  Piping hot and fresh.  I was still stuffed from our earlier dinner, but I have to say...the pizza was spectacular.  Super crispy, crunchy crust...lots of cheese and great sauce.  The toppings were great.  It was also super filling.  It was hard to finish the one slice I had. My husband loved it.  We took the rest to go. The staff here is great.  Super nice and helpful.  They checked on us often and made sure our drinks were refilled.  They boxed our leftovers up and provided us with utensils and plates so e could snack in our hotel room later. We would totally come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat &amp; more meat in a Small.  Pretty tasty!

ERZ90yBmKcjUcIpwLzY6KA.text: So I was having a pool day a wanted to try out a good pizza place in Vegas. So I decided on Giordanos based on the reviews and I can just tell you I wasn't disappointed, it was phenomenal. So I placed a carry out order because they don't have delivery and that's ok because it was worth the walk. 5min walk! So after picking the pizza up and heading back to the pool, this pizza was filled with cheese!! A cheese lovers dream. The taste was out of this world amazing. It's pretty big so you would only need one slice. I got a large and it came to about $30 or so but it's well worth it. Can't wait to get another so time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni with lots of cheese
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large pepperoni

qjtnhFBsqwLr_yp1n-uFdQ.text: First time trying a deep dish and glad to say it was at Giordanos!  Found this place on yelp, of course, while wandering around the strip. Perfect place to eat for people watching and it's right in the middle of everything.  I ordered the deep dish individual with beef and green peppers. The crust is phenomenal, the beef is flavorful, and the sauce is everything. Overall some of the best pizza I've had. Wish I would've gotten a larger size. The cheese was amazing as well. Loved everything about this pizza! Takes a lot to fill me up but this personal deep dish was enough for me.   My gf got the lasagna with beef and it was pretty disappointing. No flavor. At all. Did not expect this from Giordanos. The cheese was good and the noodles were cooked well but it's really lacking in flavor. Never again.  I definitely recommend coming here though for the pizza! The service was good as well.

9t_1BlffdFd5pSfNzycClQ.text: OMG best deep dish ever! Where have you been all my life? Ordered online through Yelp; as a carry out and picked it up to enjoy back at the resort. The thick cheesy layers of goodness combined with pepperoni, meatballs, and Giardiniera Peppers goes so well with the marinara sauce. The crust was crispy and buttery even after reheating. Like eating a True pizza pie! Ordered the chicken chopped salad. It was tasty as well. They were thoughtful enough to even include a pizza server, plates,forks,napkins,ect. Please bring a new location to So. Cal.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xPPb_947yWeRhvgtzXeSIQ.text: This restaurant is located right next to Bally's & has two sections to it - an outdoor lower area in the shopping area, & an indoor upper level area, both with plenty of seating.  We came with a large party of 12 around 11am on a Saturday. It was almost 100 degrees so like rational people we elected to sit in the indoor air conditioned section upstairs. There wasn't much people but it still took about 10 minutes to get seated.  Once we got seated however, the place started to fill up pretty & got pretty bustling quickly. Our service was good & the waiters were easy to catch the attention of whenever we had any questions. We ordered 2 medium sized deep dishes as well as 2 large pitchers of margaritas.  Honestly, the pizza was just OK. The deep dish slices were good, but not good enough for the hour-long wait it took for it to come out. For our party of 12, 2 medium pizzas are enough to give each person 2 slices, which was enough in my opinion (especially if you're planning on drinking throughout during the day like your typical Vegas partygoer). The margaritas however, were top notch. The flavors we got - strawberry & mango - were both pretty sweet, refreshing, & strong enough to keep us busy for almost an hour until our food came out.  Personally, I'm not a fan of deep dish, but this restaurant is in a pretty convenient location on the strip. So if deep dish is your jam & you can stomach the wait time, this place would probably be worth checking out.

BTy3T7veUqYnvXuR59G1cg.text: I love Chicago deep dish pizza and I've been dying to try this place! People have been raving about how good it is and I only have 2 places to compare it to: Tony's Little Italy and Rance's. They are both delicious in their own ways. That cheese pull though... mmmmm  I ordered online and got a 10% off code! They quoted 45 minutes so I got there in an hour... I had to wait another 20 mins... in the cold... they didn't have a reason for the delay. The cashier was more concerned with small talk with her coworker than service. Oh well.  The pizza itself was delicious! Came out crispy and piping hot! I got the valentine special pizza... which came heart-shaped...!!! So adorable!   I got half jalapeno and meatball and half garlic broccoli and pepperoni. The toppings were in the bottom layer (except for the jalapenos) then the cheese and marinara sauce was on the top. The cheese pull was soooo satisfying. The crust was crispy and not soggy at all. It had a perfect balance between toppings, breading and cheese.  -1 Star for the service and the excessive wait but the pizza was too-notch!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valentine special: heart-shaped pizza

JYuR1T6bTg6Nh8hvVXluwQ.text: Giordanos is definitely a familiar name when you hear about Chicago deep dish pizza, so I had to try it when I saw a location on the Vegas strip. We showed up around lunch time, but it wasn't that crowded. Nonetheless, our pizza took forever to come out. Several tables around us were eagerly waiting for their food also. Service here could use some work.   We opted for the Chicago Classic Deep Dish Pizza. After waiting awhile for our pizza to come out, we were disappointed since the pizza was a little cold and wasn't as good as I had hoped it would be. Perhaps if it were actually hot, it would've tasted better.  I was a little underwhelmed by the overall quality of the food. Judging from other reviews, it sounds like the taste here is different than the original location in Chicago. I can't wait to try that location.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago Classic Deep Dish Pizza

9TE56VZil_QSrJbV5RKaPA.text: Great location, atmosphere and food.  Eat upstairs in AC or eat downstairs outside in the crowd.  45mins for the Chicago style and well worth the price and wait.  Drinks were a little high but a great dinner with friends.

P-nKH6cqRHCszfcx0tgUuw.text: Pizza here is served both deep dish and thin crust. I'm kind of torn about my review. I did not really love the tase or the food which is why I'm only giving 4 stars.  I really liked the vibe, it's super cute inside and the staff was extremely friendly. It does take almost an hour for the pizza to be made but they warned us of that ahead of time and I actually think it wasn't too long of a wait.  The restaurant is on the strip so of course parking is tricky. It's located in a super good spot though so you can walk around before and after dinner easily!!!  Vegetarian friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thin crust and deep dish

pjZ1Oq_SOfxv3u9KMtVWoQ.text: Such great service and wonderful pizza!!!!!   We got the personal pizza and a small Chicago Special and let me tell you it's so great!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicago special!

Lt-zsExl6ttYrRQkrcYEqw.text: This restaurant has poor customer service policies.  Restaurant was pretty empty. We asked to be seated in a booth , knowing it would take 55 minutes for the deep dish. We were told they save the booths for bigger parties and there was just two of us! Pizza came out barely warm. We notified our waiter Jhon ..and he was very accommodating and took it back to the kitchen to reheat it.. results were charred crust when it was returned!!! Keep in mind it was a small deep dish for $25.00 dollars. Also irritating was that all of the booths remained open and they never sat anyone there the entire time we were in there. You can see there were not many customers.  The Wedge Salad was not a wedge but flat leaf lettuce with a drizzle of dressing.   So the good with the bad...the salad was tasty..and the pizza was yummy. However, when reasonable service accommodations are refused we don't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fd2N13opT4naIfiPUSDtJg.text: My first visit to Giordanos, I had never tried deep dish pizza earlier. My spouse and I visited at 1am so getting a seat wasn't an issue.  We ordered a choose your own topping pizza adding onion, jalapenos, bell pepper and olives. We were told there would be a 45 min wait, which was absolutely fine by us. We ordered cheese garlic breads to make sure we aren't hungry and a glass of coke for my spouse. The cheese pizza was out in 15 mins, the cheese was yummy - garlic bread was fresh.  The disappointment started with the pizza which was the highlight of the meal. Soggy base, I could feel the softness, and this was after waiting for 45 mins. Our pizza was switched and we were served veggie pizza with broccoli and mushroom which my spouse and I absolutely dislike. They got the right order after 15 mins by then we were halfway through the food and hungry - it was already 1 hr, 15 mins since we waited.  Bill, of course we were charged for the veggie pizza which we didn't order and also charged $4.95 for the coke container! I don't mind paying, but let me know!!! Not happy- not worth my money and time.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie deep dish pizza
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy garlic bread

4MHDjKYVzOO_MIrLg1UtrA.text: I've meant to eat at a Giordanos location many times during my visits to Chicago and somehow it just never happened. I did however manage to eat at one accidentally while walking through Las Vegas though! My girlfriend and I were roaming around the Paris/Bally's area on Thursday and got pretty hungry. This location was located outside in the middle of everything and offered a bunch of cool seating. The menu here is famous for Chicago deep dish pizza, but also features thin crust pizza, pasta, sandwiches, and what I ordered,  a piadini! What is a piadini you ask?  It's basically a wrap that uses pizza dough instead of an actual wrap. I ordered a chicken caprese piadini and it was absolutely delicious! The dough was fantastic and made the wrap so much better to eat, along with the chicken inside being tasty as well. On the side I got a small cup of minestrone soup that also gets a big thumbs up for me, it was very tasty and very hot as well.   Giordanos gave me great food, had excellent service, and was outside which made it even cooler. This is definitely a fantastic place to stop and eat on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at that dough!

hEOoohSHclnq7HoVjqVl2Q.text: I was born and raised in Chicago, so I'm very picky on any review I make on any pizza shop. There are pizzas and there are pizza pies, mama Mia! This is a True pizza-lover's heaven. Don't come with your thin, greasy pan loving pizza attitudes here, your kind isn't wanted. The only reason to come here is for the deep-dish Chicago style pizza.   45 mins to bake (you can call in to order to go for a shorter wait time), the pizza is loaded with cheese and a high thick crust. Where are the ingredients, you may ask? Baked right into the pizza, so that every bite ensures you get the flavor profile you are expecting.   There is a reason why we go here every time we are in Las Vegas, and I hope this is one of those things that doesn't just stay in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d_xeJK02FmcdpPXGhLfT5A.text: Let's be clear, there is absolutely no shortage of good pizza in Las Vegas, let alone the strip, though there really isn't much by way of deep dish. With that being said, I love deep dish pizza! From the crispy edged and soft interior of there crust, to the "I won't be able to sh*t for a week" amount of cheese, there's nothing quite like it. Giordano's delivers on all fronts.   Located in the new-ish Grand Bazaar Shops across from Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken, the upstairs, much like the downstairs, is a cavernous window filled space. This means that there's lots of seating and not tom long of a wait. When there is a wait, rest assured there's a full bar to belly-up and order a cocktail or 2. On our recent visit we waiting about 10 minutes, certainly enough time to enjoy a drink and a view off the energy outside.   Service is friendly, though our server was a little out of it forgetting to bring us plates, utensils etc. At one point I had to order a bottle of wine from the bar when our server disappeared without a trace, mind you it wasn't that busy. Anyhoo, the food made up for the lack of service, which was brought out hot and fresh by another staff member.  Below is what we ended up sharing between the 4 of us. I will say that 2 large pizzas was even too much for these big bears, we had plenty of pizza leftovers for breakfast the next day (all by my plan).   Round 1: Fried Mozzarella Triangles - Yes, fried cheese triangles, so light ands crisp, I wish they put these on a pizza.  Italian Wedge Salad - Calling this a wedge is a stretch. It's more like several leaves of romaine, stack on top of themselves with all of the toppings (cheese, tomato, etc) all on one leaf. Impossible to share without making a mess. Next time we'll stick to chopped salads as those are easier to share.  Round 2: The Special Deep Dish Pizza - The sauce was well balanced with a nice sweetness, underneath laid the glorious cheese layer. So much stringy delightful cheese, veggies and delicious sausage. A pan full of love I'll tell ya!  Sausage Thin Crust - I love eating pizza that has been cut into squares. The cheese was nicely baked and cartelized while the pepperoni was just right. The majority of the table preferred this one over the deep dish, weird.   As we waddled to the cab stand over at Bally's, we all agreed, what a deliciously, satisfying gut bomb. Now where are the laxatives?

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Cf4N5nObkx0UoQCy3IGFJw.text: If you want pizza and are in Vegas, you have to check this restaurant out! I believe there are a few locations in Vegas, but we went to the one in front of Bally's casino. There is also a smaller outdoor restaurant in the Pavilion area. It is almost set like an outdoor bar, but they actually serve the same food there that they do inside the restaurant. If you go a couple feet behind this patio area, the actual restaurant is up the stairs to your left.  We did call to see if there was a wait around dinner time, but there was not. We requested a table of four by the window, as we wanted to overlook the city. It took a few minutes to get the table ready, but it was not long at all.  Know that it is deep dish pizza, so it does take a long time to cook. Took about 45 minutes for our food to arrive, and the server warned us that that would happen due to the style of the pizza. We ended up getting a small deep dish, as we were not that hungry. It did feed the four of us with 1 to 2 slices each, but if we had to do it over, we would have just gotten the larger size of a medium as we were still a bit hungry after.  So good! They are known for their pizza--so if you are craving pizza, check them out! It's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish meat lovers

J5vm-S1N1XeZfAFBifsNqQ.text: First time in vegas and trying  the pizza totally worth  the time.  1 hour wait  but great taste.

9L699E6cG8fkQKmUhzMBMw.text: Giordanos's truly a Chicago favorite loved by pizza lovers nation wide. Chicago is known for its great pizza especially deep dish and Giordano's is a hallmark of that greatness. Giordano's is a special kind of pizza you can only find in the chi town right? I mean come on the last time I went there it was a gorgeous day on the strip with ma.......Wait a second......The Strip????? This cant be possible!!!! NO NO this place is not real OMG when I go back home to Illinois I am going to get beat up is the streets!!! Please if your reading this it is my final review!!!!!!  Though its not located in my favorite city in America Chicago this Giordano's is pretty amazing. The setting maybe different but it still had that bold and delicious Chicago flavor. The two apetizers I started off with were great and very satisfying. The first appetizer I had was the calamari and more $10.95 this dish had fried pieces of calamari such as the tentacles as well as fried green beans,lemon rings, shaved fennel, with a very fresh and tomatoy marinara sauce. Then I moved onto the most amazing tomato Bruscheta $9.25 This plate had fresh tomatos mozzarela ccheese basil,olive oil, balsamic glaze, all served on a crispy garlic toast. The tomatos were so fresh I almost asked if they were freshly picked.   Then after a 45 minute wait(WHY YOU TORTURE ME WITH WAIT GIORDANOS!?!?!?!?!!?!?) a gift from god himself was delivered to my table. The deep dish chicken sasuage deluxe $28.25 for a medium which was tottaly worth the price. This pizza came packing with nicley portioned chicken sausage,spinach, and mushrooms all packed together for an amazing bite. The crust was cracker thin just like it should....AAAAAH it felt like I was on top of the Willis Tower at night with a cool breeze blowing.  Though the food was great the outlet itself could have been a bit better. The atmosphere was great with the whole restaurant being open and it had water spritzer just in case it got hot. The table were nice and the plates could have been a bit cleaner my had tons of battle scars it had seen a few forks in its time. The location was ok(not known for the most sober patrons) but I think Giordanos could thrive in someplace more upbeat and lively such as Dowtown Summerlin. Truly it could have had more of a Chicago deel with decorations and could have even played blues brothers music instead of 107.9. The service was great the waitress I had and the other staff had excellent customer service skills.   Chicago it is truly a wonderful city and the home of the original Giordano's. Who would ever guess that I would find a nice tastey slice of home right here in Vegas.  This is your favorite Yelper! Rodney...Where shall my taste buds take me next.

NVExkQIoR1eDqQbz0HCCKg.text: OGM! This pizza was off the chain, the crust was perfectly fluffed and the meat was fresh! We had the Perfectly seasoned french fries while we waited for our pizza & they were amazing!  The atmosphere was fun, the staff were attentive and informed us that the pizza would take a minute  because the pizza is cooked  fresh. The pizza was way well worth the wait.  We will definitely visit this place again. Also, we plan to ship this pizza to our house in Tennessee & to our daughter in Brooklyn, NYC.

Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BYLydh9kqO0YOA_RLka9iQ.text: Never had Chicago style pizza and it was amazingly awesome! I will definitely go back to Giordanos

YrcHc4Q5d-M38VdHel40tw.text: I'd rate this place 6 stars! The deep dish pizza I ordered was SOOOO good! I ordered a small all meat deep dish pizza. We had to wait for 45 minutes, but it was worth the wait. My bf, friend, and I went to the Bodies Exhibit while we waited for the pizza. I can still remember the cheesiness of the pizza...how fluffy the pizza dough was....how meaty the pizza was....how saucy the pizza was... So good! I got full with 1 slice. Lol. I ended up taking the pizza with me on the plane back home and I practically guarded the pizza with my life. I wish there was a Giordano's here in Washington! Can't wait to go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C3jucZLCjyKlUEUX8kye1w.text: First of all, the pizza. For a place that is supposedly well known for their pizza, let me tell you, it is quite sub par. My mother and I got thin crust pepperoni and cheese pizza, and while the cheese, sauce, and pepperoni were very scrumptious, the crust closely resembled cardboard. So much so that it's cardboard taste overwhelmed the outstanding flavors of the toppings. We give the pizza a 6/10. I would also like to add that the deep dish pizza looks absolutely disgusting and we were not quite sure how so many people around us were consuming it. To finish it off, the service was just okay. For an example, they brought us our main dish before our appetizer.

CAKxYfqbhK3XGv3P9XJJUg.text: My first time trying a deep dish pizza (NY pizza lover). We had it stuffed with Italian beef and cheese! Pizza was super good (but pricey) but taste was in point and service was excellent.

wZdev1FOjbZDn0OntgknZg.text: Staying at the nearby Bally's, we walked by this place about 6 times. My wive checked it out on yelp and we thought we would give it a try. Paying in Canadian $, Las Vegas is expensive but we found this place reasonable (for Las Vegas) and the food tasty. We had the thin crust pizza with a bottle of red wine and a Caesar salad. We had briefly thought about the deep dish but the previous reviews said it takes an hour and that would have meant another bottle of wine. Also, it looked good but would probably feed 4. Anyway, it was our best meal of the trip and we would try it again.

vRl5pjYdk1IlahQ75AzL2A.text: Been here 3 times now and it never disappoints. It takes about 45 minutes to cook so make sure you allow yourself enough time if you go. Definitely worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno and pineapple - individual size

idYemI4Abgal9G975JfUYg.text: We love Chicago style pizza, and Giordano's probably is the best we've had. We ordered online and went to pick it up, only to find that they had lost our order. It took them nearly 10 minutes to find it.  The pizza was awesome; 5 star worthy. Service was only worth 2 stars.

l6aoy1iW4zGYilJZQTgrnQ.text: Flavors and configuration are, for the most part, legit Chicago pie.  HOWEVER... be judicious about toppings; more is not better.  AVOID the "Chicago Special" pre-configured selection, as the ratio of vegetables to sausage is serious overkill; we could barely notice the sausage 'wads' amongst the sea of bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms.  Plus, those vegetables have a lot of inherent water content, which releases when cooked.  This ended up sogging out our crust, which meant scooping up pieces of wet cardboard with our slices (see pic).  Lastly, this location should purchase enough pie pans to keep them on the table while serving. That is what they do in Chi-town, and it helps keep the pie warmer, longer.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too many &#39;wet&#39; veggies in the &#39;Chicago Special&#39; configuration, and barely any sausage.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy pie means wet cardboard on your plate.

Ks6Tb4xV-lPQ2wqIz5uhbQ.text: As always awesome. They only have 4 of the deep dish options. But the service and food was awesome. The place is super casual with a full bar and a bigger pizza menu.

pDjlKPycMAQ_Evz3H0w40g.text: So delicious!!!! I am from Chicago and have always loved Giordanos ... I was hoping it would have the same quality and I was not disappointed! Exceptional service! We ordered the the deep dish pizza with pepperoni and mushroom... gooey cheese ! We started off with the sampler which came with boneless wings, loaded potato bites, mozzarella triangles, and garlic bread sticks. It was served with 4 sauces: BBQ, ranch, buffalo, and marinara. The Greek salad was also delicious.  The environment was dim, nice wood tables, and Chicago swag everywhere! Very attentive staff! Will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot, cheesy pepperoni and mushroom deep dish Chicago pizza

w2C4J_99m-fC7J9PNZbLug.text: I have been waiting to eat True Chicago Deep dish pizza for about 5 years now... the time has finally come. Best part is, I didn't have to book a flight to Chi-town.  Now the wait for the pizza is normally 30-40 min, it even says it on the menu and the waiters reiterate that... now we didn't get our pizza for a little over a hour, but I will give them the benefit of the doubt since it is New Years Day.  The pizza itself was amazing!! Deep dish is my personal fav in comparison to thin crust NY style. We ordered the chicken sausage with mushroom and spinach stuffed crust deep dish. Wow. Soooo fulfilling, satisfying and visually appealing. Definitely on my top 3 pizzas I have EVER eaten.  Good job Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Sausage, mushroom and spinach deep dish

eNZ1v9rMODGxLue8jnWcDA.text: The pizza was good but it took too long to get the food and the cheese wasn't as melted as it should've been. The waiter was great and the Merlot was great! The price was decent for the size of the pizza that we received. Overall I have had much better pizza places but I would return to eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato Bruschetta
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepperoni and pineapple deep dish pizza

P9c7iQuDeRsgUCxui5ZqoA.text: Worth the wait ! So cheesy and delicious. The appetizers are great too. Plus there's a nice view of the strip from this location !

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YES!!!!! Try it all.

GWvzVv3SFVcNeA2PXNMmCA.text: A waste of a night. Ordered a cesar salad and a deep dish pizza. Waitress told us that it would take an hour for the pizza to cook so we were prepared to wait a while. After waiting the hour, our pizza arrived- doughy, falling apart and cold! I was really looking forward to trying the chicago deep dish pizza for the first time but was so dissapointed.  All the tables around us were also waiting an hour+ for their pizzas and looked tired and impatient- understandable. This place needs to find out a way to be more efficient because an hour for a doughy, cold pizza is not acceptable.

BisSYZS3j_u4FEkOORPjxg.text: The young lady working the take-out window was very helpful.  She did a great job explaining their different pizzas.

3ga5yvZU-f1RiejBUmJubw.text: This is the best place to find deep dish pizza for a good price while on the strip. Our waiter was very friendly and tentative. Food and service was great and we will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s1zvvFOi6EFomhsxQpDmOw.text: Love it! I had the 'Chicago Classic' deep dish. We got the small size and it was the perfect amount for two people! I would recommend getting a light appetizer if you're hungry too because the wait for a deep dish will take about 45 minutes. Oh, and the Moscow Mule was also pretty good.

BcAdRvM6-_iWTmaOfkIAZQ.text: My boyfriend and I came to Vegas for our summer vacay.. I had mapped all the food places I wanted to try and Giordanos was at be top of my list. It was a great night and we both were excited to try Giordanos pizza pie. We had a small basic order -- wings for appetizer and a small deep dish pizza. Our server brought our food out and NEVER, not one time, did he come back and check on us to see if we needed anything .. (you know like napkins, water refills, the  basic dine in items). The restaurant was busy but not too crowded where the food server couldn't check on us .. last thing, the pizza could have been a little hotter.  I'm sorry, but I won't be revisiting or recommending this location to others.

LhHdzwa_ah6Faw1dw4FD9A.text: This was probably the worst service ever had.  It took 45 minutes to get a salad and a sampler plate. While waiting for our check we found out that six other parties have the same problem. Food was good, BUT THE SERVICE SUCKED!!!!

d6aBbjtZXYnbQN7dDUx2JQ.text: If you're thinking about coming here for a meal... think again. I have never ever walked out of a restaurant but I did this time. We got to Giordano's around 9pm and thought we were in luck and avoided the dinner crowd. We were seated right away and it took a few minutes to get a waiter but my wife and I were patient as we always are. Finally, Robert comes by to help us out. He takes our orders and he was nice enough to inform us that the deep dish pizzas were going to take about 1 hour to make so we opted for a meatball sandwich which he said would be speedy, a side salad and some garlic bread. Easy right? Well fast forward 40 minutes later, we were still waiting on our food. Robert came by a few time, he told us our food was on the way, the next time he came by he said that we would be getting a discount on our bill because of the wait. We sat patiently, we didn't complain. But by 45 minutes we had not received anything, not even a side salad which doesn't take any time at all to cook, grill or boil. I was completely done by then. We couldn't find Robert any longer so we quietly got up, went to the hostess and let her know that we will be leaving.  It's kind of ridiculous if you think about it. We wasted 45 minutes of our time sipping on tap waters expecting a full meal. I'm very disappointed in this experience and I will not be coming back here.

YJEgqW33vARDKKUTkLcFiQ.text: Delicious deep dish pizza. When I heard that there was a Giordanos opening in Las Vegas, I got really excited. Great food, just like the one in Chicago. However, it is about a 45 minute wait to get your pizza.

HUGb-_R6ZyzKqcHXcxkWLg.text: Who could go wrong with Giordano's? If you have not visited then it's a must when you're in Vegas or Chicago. I was very excited when I learned that the new Vegas location was opened right by Ballys. They have non-pizza options such as spaghetti, your traditional pizzas, calamari, cheesy bread, and their famous deep dish pizza. They have a carry out window at this location which I find super convenient for Vegas. You can call from your hotel room and go down and get your order. The deep dish pizzas are amazing, so filling. I'm a big eater and a small pizza will feed 2 with left overs. This time I ordered the pepperoni deep dish and it was great. It's made to order so it does take a long time, don't expect to be in and out because it's a while. However, well worth the wait. Service was excellent. We were seated right away and the servers were very attentive. Wish I had a Giordano's closer.

7Y-RsHcDatBQU4A9Q08EwQ.text: Not only is the food great but the service was amazing as well. This is why I don't mind leaving a generous tip. Our server was amazing (and of course, I forgot his name - he has a Latin accent, if that helps). He was very attentive, gave us glasses of water the moment we sat down. He made sure we were ok as deep dish pizzas take longer to make. Highly recommend this place!!

ZZr6n1eCSnjl9-BX88EqTg.text: We were looking for a good place in Vegas to eat that wasn't too expensive. We decide to eat here and what a great find. The pizza is made to order so it was hot, fresh, and delicious!!

urilixbIOyRpSiiVv4GzkQ.text: They sat us right away, which for a Saturday night, we thought there would be a long wait. So that was great. The waitress kinda explained to us about how the pizza cook time works (45 minutes to an hour) which we understood. So we put our order in for a medium stuffed deep dish and waited. She was very nice in keeping us updated on how far along our pizza was coming, and refilled our water regularly. When it finally came to our table, it wasn't hot. At all. It wasn't even warm. The onions were raw and cut into huge pieces (is that the Chicago way?). We ate it anyway because we had waited for so long. I would probably recommend to just get the grab and go downstairs or get the frozen pizza you can just cook at your home. At least then you know you will be getting a hot pizza.

2BZPg77fqsnUz9N9mwquxA.text: Pizza is very good and consistent. Takes some time but worth the wait. I eat it every time I'm in Vegas.

AQwI9L2ur7qK11o5eceRig.text: Great deep dish pizza. Also enjoyed the house salad. A large pizza was plenty for 6 girls, but 1 large bowl of salad was not. We ordered a second bowl after seeing the size of the first. It is a 45 min wait for a pizza once you order, so be prepared to wait. Staff was not overly friendly and moved slowly. However, it's worth it for this Chicago style pizza!!

MQQzn3yKU7FWYJXN3V0maA.text: Listen, Giordanos is amazing and it's amazing that we even have one in vegas so thank heavens for that. But the service here is horrendous. The two hostesses were so rude. They seemed absolutely put out that we wanted to put our names down. And then when we wanted to pre-order our pizza because we know that's a possibility and will save a ton of time (hint: order your pizza while you are waiting because it takes 45 min to cook) the hoestess taking our order acted like we were dumb for wanting to order ahead. I wanted to complain to the manager but our server was never around long enough for us to ask him for anything. He never even refilled our drinks. Food is decent, it's no Chicago Giordanos, but I'll take it. They just need to work on their service.

wITaT0FJ_sUSPVSGECu6_Q.text: Overall it wasn't bad. We were in a rush to get to the airport so we got "to go" deep dish pizza. Our server was excellent, he was friendly and seemed to care.

t-zfDCviZ5xabKO7Q1OopA.text: This is pretty much my favorite pizza place, but I don't have it often based on the price. I have both dined and gone for takeout a handful of times. Also sometimes the wait can be a bit long. This would be 5 stars if it was cheaper and quicker. I usually get plain cheese or pepperoni. I have not tried much else there, but can't imagine being disappointed.

AYYsCQoR0utdWPIKi3Lrog.text: The food was absolutely delicious! From the Parmesan fries to the classic Chicago deep dish. Good prices for good beer, especially being on the strip.   The deep dish pizza takes 30-45 minutes to come out (this is also listed on the menu and the server will let you know, just be prepared! It's worth the time.)  Fast friendly service for sure, I highly suggest requesting Marco if he's available, super friendly and attentive to the table despite it being just the start of the dinner rush.   We will definitely be returning and bringing friends.

og_Rv-nK6AcpEf4H6BDAAg.text: Best pizza in the world, hands down! Melissa the manager and her staff are awesome and you get a view of the Bellagio fountains to boot!! #giordanos

okVDY1sewjWT6YO5xn5GNQ.text: You want to know why I am at a 2 star right now. We walked up to get seated and  at the front was completely talking smack about the servers like we just walked up I am literally sitting here and yeah your in Vegas you are going to wait my problem is how  the staff is not cohesive I mean smack talking at the door. SANDRA has been standing at the front I asked her for napkins and two drink over 30 mins ago and my server is slammed I mean he is doing his thing I asked her while he was taking in another order and she told him did you hear her get her table drinks.....  He was holding plates and drinks and taking an orders like I am not bothering him I asked you she make us wait 30mins because she didn't want to do it. IT'S NOT THE WAITERS, THE FOOD AMAZING, THE STAFF TOTALLY NOT COHESIVE AT ALL. Where does that all come down to... Figure it out please.

My boyfriend got his dish after mine. I am actually surprised this restaurant doesn't have worst reviews. The manager had to come out and talk to us, also the couple behind us requested to talk to manager. We wanted to get out of here ASAP yet even getting the bill took a long time.

auKGyQwNjByY63i5tSVcHw.text: The best Chicago style pizza I've tasted in the west. Our server was really attentive with re-fillings our drinks.

OeJSXpYTln00Ak0uTEYN1g.text: Awesome deep dish Chicago style pizza. Our original waiter never got to us but Marcus saved the day! Prompt and courteous so that makes up for original waiter's inattentiveness.

b0fg9YQ_UBFXY_4Kl0DY3w.text: Our group ordered a variety menu items from appetizers to lasagna. The pizza was only adequate. Overall, the food was as bad as the service. We actually had to send back a dish. We won't be returning.

avRQYe-nzezVkcEg38X9-Q.text: Best pizza ever!  That is if you are into the Chicago style. Expect to wait about 45 - 50 min after you place the order, but well worth the wait. Cheese was high quality and super stringy, loved it!  We did do the dine in. Noticed there is a takeout window too.

vjDhbpFXb7hA5Y0I2x1DKQ.text: Pizza sucked! Reminded me of a Red Baron frozen pizza.we ordered a thin crust margarita pizza. We wanted a deep dish but they said it takes 45 minutes so we decided not to because of the time. Well the thin crust took just as long.

tCJR48KSeL6SqnFqBHaPZw.text: This is an amazing and awesome restaurant!!! Melissa is so outgoing & Professional!!!! If you want to have a GREAT time....come HERE!!!

cTRj_5WNyT1EJyDM4An7bw.text: Went to the soft opening today with my family of 6. They made sure we had a table big enough for all of us plus my baby and his stroller! The pizza was delicious and so was their house salad. Staff was very friendly! Will def be back here.

HsKUYd1xmS-uuWdHJHsyUA.text: I had a religious experience eating at Giordano's on Sunday night.  Chicago style is my favorite and in NYC I get very very little of it,  so I jumped at the chance to try these guys out while in Vegas for a trade show.  I thought I was hungry enough to finish a small by myself,  but my server accurately predicted that I'd need a box in the end.   Sure enough, after 3 of the 6 slices of my deep dish classic Chicago pie I was done.  It was,  I believe, the best pizza I've ever had, and that's saying a lot.  I took the rest in a box to my hotel room with fantasies about my next days lunch.  But the next day,  I realized I had no way to heat it up!  I just couldn't stomach having the best pizza I'd ever had cold, so I called the restaurant and asked if they wouldn't mind heating it up for me.  Well,  Erica told me that it would be a health code violation for them to serve me something that had been left out all night and day, but she related my tale to her manager and they offered to bake me a new pie for lunch if I brought in my receipt from the night before. What??  I got a little teary eyed as I blubbered and thanked her - I was totally overwhelmed!  They made me feel at home as I had my lunch at the bar (with another glass of that amazing Goose Island Greenline!) this time I could only put down 2 slices,  but I left with a heart a full as my stomach, more leftovers, and for the first time a desire to live in Chicago.  I can't say enough about the food and people at Giordano's!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best food ever eaten at a bar.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza perfection.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slice #1 of my small Stuffed Crust Classic Chicago.

CwG1ArqA69mD2tak4TFomQ.text: Came here for NYE Late Breakfast/Late Lunch/Early Dinner ~ newly opened here in Las Vegas @ The Grand Bazaar Shops in Bally's (head towards the escalators near Starbucks, go upstairs and turn left to their entrance - they may need better signage), Giordano's was an old favorite from Chicago so we had their Special Deep Dish Pizza (sausage, onions & green pepper) & famous Steak Sandwich with Garlic Parmesean Fries, Au Jus sauce & Hot Italian Giardiniera! Got seated along the windows facing the Strip and it was great. One has a good view when the Bellagio Fountains are going on. They also have a small carry-out shop downstairs as well as a bar with table eat outside. Our server was Hector and he was great during our service so we made sure to mention it to the manager on duty, Nicolas.  Only comment is that they may want to up the amount of sausage in their pizzas as ours wasn't as loaded as it had been in Chicago but everything was delicious nonetheless! We will definitely be back.

kZS9T3wyWhzGfNf7ys5fwA.text: Visited 1-6-18. We really liked it and would recommend. I think we got a medium which was perfect (we were hungry). The wait is something to take into consideration as it is about 30-40 minutes but we had no place to be.

-zLBMYYOeVqB4902Fd-bbg.text: We got a thin crust, small pizza!  It was plenty for 2 people. Very, very good!  The crust was delicious!

EQhQ9oKIZMERveCiTAUuAA.text: I lived in Chicago for several years and the thing I miss most is the incredible food. So thrilled that they opened my favorite deep dish pizza place here in vegas.   Cesar was our waiter and he was amazing. He was great about putting in our orders letting us know about the yelp discount, and making sure our glasses were never empty.   We got a small and medium deep dish (wanted plenty of leftovers) and it was just as good as I remembered! Definitely coming back here again!   Note: it's located in the Ballys bazaar, and though they have a food window downstairs the restaurant is located upstairs.

YGZghVX3hNTY0pExQ9Yogg.text: The food and staff were perfect. Our Server, Patrick Y, made the whole experience amazing. From start to finish he was attentive, quick, and even provided advice for other spots to visit. I could not have asked for a better experience.  The food was fresh and delicious. I ordered the bruschetta to start and a personal size stuffed pizza to share. The bruschetta had more diced tomato then I even knew what to do with (this was a good thing). The personal sized pizza came out quick and was exactly what I was looking for.

lwC7zCk0C7mtfHi0k7q4EA.text: Nothing was resolved! I've sent a nice and simple email to get back in touch with Anna so we can connect like she asked regarding my experience. I've seen her comment back and apologizing to multiple negative yelp reviewers after I've sent my email. My email was ignored, so don't believe her when she says "our intention is always to exceed the guests' expectation on all levels...", because it's clearly not.

MNGgwjYiOoccNd_k3Fr9OQ.text: Absolutely loved the deep dish original Chicago pizza! The staff was friendly and helpful with great smiles on a Wednesday night:) The food was absolutely fresh, and delicious!!! We had great wine with our food, and the Greek salad was very good too!!!

WktS-5tfcx2FQJDfOECxRg.text: The deep dish pizza here is great.  The Chicago beef sandwich is okay, but I prefer Petrillo's.  Now, if you want to save yourself some time and aggravation, order ahead and pick it up at the pick-up window downstairs.  There is a covered dining area near the window.  We ate on the second floor and it took over an hour to get the pizza.  Service was slooooooow.

7L-RZnuGhRtwD8eW0ds4uw.text: Hands down the best Chicago deep dish pizza I've had. Crust is flaky, buttery and thick enough to handle all that cheese, sauce and toppings. Be warned that it does take a while to make (about 40 minutes) but it's we'll worth the wait. Being your appetite.

dCXPAPNAgTKnj-ISd0X1Mg.text: If you want a Pizza experience order the all meat stuffed pizza. This is the only place I would order a Chicago style pizza. I am usually a thin crust crispy kind of gal, but this pizza is not about the crust. It's all about the stuff. You won't be disappointed.

GIUCSCPQDlEWapCA7Ro9-g.text: Whenever I go to Chicago I make it a point to grab a pizza at Gino's East, but I've never had Giordano's which seems to be the preference of the natives I've spoken to.  Happened to be in Vegas and thought I'd give it a try.  Service was good, the deep dish does take 45 mins to cook but here there are some shops to look at if you get bored waiting.  It's outside and a nice spot to people watch.  As far as the deep dish pizza, it was really good but I prefer Gino's.  Love the cornmeal crust there and the tangy/acidic sauce.  Giordano's is a more plain crust and milder sauce.  Very well done but not my preference.  Would go again though if I want pizza on the Vegas strip.

B1Dn535bEwivyFwo9s88ug.text: Pizza was good, but we order spaghetti with meat ball for my kids and was disgusting, we cannot cut it, was black, really bad, manager don't even come to apologize, not sure is this people care about the customer. More funny part os they charge for the meatballs lol

hXD_Uzsv-cVAtysjmS9khQ.text: Out standing The deep dish pizza is delicious takes about 45 minutes to get it  Long wait but it's worth  It Definitely going to be coming back on our next trip to Vegas.

92SC_lue_MWTXVI2KtClrg.text: We were starving after going to see the Jabbawockeez show at MGM Grand casino we went to this restaurant near Ballys which was another awesome recommendation from my bestie and it was soooo good! I'm not a big fan of Chicago style pizza so I decided to go with their Chicken Parmesan (which I cut into before I took the picture). It was truly a good dish the chicken was nice and crunchy and the pasta was cooked perfectly! I really enjoyed the tomato sauce which wasn't too bitter as a matter of fact it was just right! This meal was the perfect end to an epic vacation! The only issue was with a server we had who started out amazing but ended up being full of attitude which caused her to get a sucky tip so her bad! I definitely recommend this place because the food is amazing and the prices are reasonable for Las Vegas! I would just like to say that not all of the servers were sucky so don't count them out because of our bad experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KPpbjbQ3S3HEGEtatlYe4Q.text: Second time here with our server Darvi, Wow! what an amazing experience, the Greek Salad Darvi suggested was very good and so was the Fettuccine Alfredo served family style, very good. We enjoyed a large Deep Dish Pizza which is what Giordano's is known for, and it was truly delicious. I suggest you order some appetizers and enjoy conversation and drinks and have a great time. This restaurant takes comments and suggestions to heart and will do their best to make your dining experience the best. Ask for Erika or Melissa if you have any questions.

fZVvb4n1QHCUMpg_c0fCaQ.text: If your looking for a tasty hot REAL Deep Dish experience, Giordanos is the spot. I have visited Chicago multiple times and fell in luv with their Pizza. Soooooooo, know that Chicago has showed up in Vegas its a Win. I ordered a individual pie this time instead of a Medium and it was just as flavorful. With that said. Please be prepared to wait 45min for this wonderful tasting Pizza and you will not regret it. The customer service is prompt and our server (Jennifer) was on Point!

c1jPZj0pzMQ9syiBwjk73g.text: The pie was delicious. I love Chicago style pizza.  Be warned it takes 45 minutes for them to cook the pizza. Well worth the wait though, so plan accordingly.   Cons The pre-selected pizza menu choices cannot be modified. This sucked for me since most of them had mushrooms. I hate mushrooms. You also cannot add to these choices either.   This is not a pizza you would take home for later. The crust started to get soggy on the last slice while I sat there eating it.   Delicious pizza with a great amount of cheese and toppings.

6tqIwV-mIjkcSzL8qNrP4g.text: Man, my second time having deep dish and it won my love again! My boyfriend and I came here super hungry and buzzed...lol we ordered buffalo wings, cheesy garlic bread and a small meaty meat deep dish pizza. Our waiter was super cool and quick. Our appetizers came out first and we devoured them in minutes. And then the wait begins....we came right before the rush and maybe had about 3 tables before us. Our pizza took forreeeeeeveerrr to come out. The appetizers pretty much settled into our stomach and we were feelin the alcohol - pretty much just done and ready to go. When the pizza came, it was more than enough for the two of us! We probably could've done without the appetizers for the size of a small. We each could barely finish a slice and packed the rest. We had the remaining the next day in the car on our way to Arizona and let me just tell you....it was SOOOOOO good!!!!! Omggggg. It was so, so good.   Alright...so to cap... -great service. The table was always cleared as items were finished and waters were always topped before they even got halfway.  -bomb diggity cheesy pizza and even better leftover and still bomb diggity cold.  -appetizers were mediocre. Nothing to rave about.   MUST COME FOR THE PIZZZZZZZZZUHHHH.

UHIyr3-fCM-82zRMvcvfkw.text: So this is one of my favorite pizza chains in the country and that says a lot since I live in Brooklyn and I'm surrounded by the best pizza around. BUT the stuffed pizza at Giordano's is like nothing you have ever had before. Unfortunately this visit was awful. First off the air conditioning wasn't working so as you can imagine in Vegas it was HOT up in there. Next, I tell the bartender that I know the stuffed pizza takes about 40-45 minutes so I wanted to order right away. He puts in my order and about 20 minutes later I am presented with a thin crust pizza by someone on the kitchen staff?!? I ask what this was because it wasn't my order. He speaks to the bartender and the bartender tells me he screwed up and they would need to remake my order. I ask if that means I had to wait 45 minutes from now and he says it should be ready in 35-40minutes. This is while I'm sitting in a place with no AC and my arms are sticking to the bar because it's so hot. People are walking out during this because it was too uncomfortable. Now my wait is even longer because of their mistake. 40-45 minutes later I get my pie. When I finish I ask for my bill and there is no discount of any kind after all of this. Additionally, I was never visited by any manager to apologize for what had happened. They walked passed me numerous times but no one asked how I was doing or if everything was ok. Isn't that the floor managers responsibility?!? Extremely disappointed and expect more when I am paying $22.for a small pizza!  So I came back after 1/2 a year. I waited God know how long for a medium pizza and it was forever. My bartender kept telling me more time even after I saw 35-40 min and he kept saying 20 more minutes?!? What happened to 45 minutes. Then he wanted to argue with me rather than apologize. Obviously he put my pizza order in after my appetizer so I had to wait 45 minutes after the 20 I had already waited but refused to acknowledge that. I'm never coming back. F this place! They will offer you the world and offer nothing cause this place sucks!!!

FBgL_kP0Nx9SBWjUQ4PyFA.text: A little slice of home.  We celebrated a friend's birthday and he, being a new transplant from New Jersey and pizza-phile like me, went to surprise him with deep dish.  Good times.  When you walk in, you can see the pizza makers right behind the hostess making the dough.  You can't help but wonder at the deep pans these giant cheese and tomato pies go into.  We got a great seat overlooking the Grand Bazaar with the Bellagio serving as a backdrop from floor to ceiling windows.  Our server, Kelly, greeted us in a slow, Texan drawl that oddly reminded me of American Idol and warmth of greeting unique to Southern belles.  She had quite a few tables she was serving.  Helping out with the setup as well as the cleanup.  Hats off to someone who made it look easy.  I have so much respect for good servers in a town known for service.  It lent well to a great dining experience.    Good food, good ambiance, and great service - I highly recommend!

G9Wl8fdGQFvuejnODNFytQ.text: I've been a fan of Giordano's for years. I would always make it a point to go when I would visit Chicago so I was thrilled to find that there was a location in Vegas. I was also nervous at the same time. Occasionally some franchises are not the same when they tend to expand to different areas, however this was not the case. We ordered a small deep dish. Between my husband and I, we could not finish it. I hate that I couldn't because it sure was delicious! Totally worth the 45 minute wait.  Just beware of you go hungry you will need to order an appetizer. Other than that. Get a drink, relax, and catch a game on their tv screen.

ayWhtheY0saB4yUa4etrjg.text: Pizza was really good.  We stuck with NYC style pies, and it was a great choice.  Go with the "Don".!!! Server was very friendly, and helpful.  Great locAtion within the Venetian.  If wanting to go to Giordanos, stick with this location and. It the one along the strip!  Quieter and more laid back....

kdT2-f0dctk0m1yqgjz90A.text: This location comes very close to the Chicago location.  The deep dish unfortunately was delivered luke warm so not sure if it was sitting around a bit before brought to our table or what happened.  Wait staff wasn't really the best.  So if you want the "real Giordanos" experience head to Chicago!  Or maybe it was just an off day?

FgoB08GjtGDQ41g8GhczRw.text: This place is everything is has been mentioned as! Friends and I split a pie big enough to feed six people. The wait was long so if you wanna get your food quickly I would go when it isn't busy. We got the meat deep dish pizza, which was extremely tasty! Came with lots of toppings and so much mozzarella as it oozed out of every bite. Kind of pricey both worth it.

The deep dish pizza with pineapple, ham, and mushrooms on the side is my favorite. The customer service was good, the ambience is family friendly, and the wait time is about 45 minutes.

5Kv4Uz0SNA67W823NDsetg.text: The second greatest pizza in the world!  What's the first?  Giordano's in Chicago, of course!  If you have not had Chicago Deep dish pizza before, shame on you!   If I am about to die and I have a day to have final meals, Giordano's pizza is one of my final meals.   Yes, it's that good.    It takes a good 45 minutes to make, so be aware of that when you get there, but it is OH SO worth the wait.      Thank you Vegas for bringing the best pizza in the world to me on my visit.   It was a glorious surprise.

eOsgz9gT8MYL4MSGxI4jIg.text: Dominic our server was awesome. We had a party of 29 and he made ordering so easy.  Drinks came out separate tabs without even asking ! He was attentive that just added to our experience.    Pizza was really good and he Caesar was very good ~ not too much dressing.  We had 5 different pizzas all were delicious.   Definitely the place to come with big parties !

Y6BOIa2VENI0S-Ux5qNenw.text: Insanely delicious!!!!!!  Wanted it every night I was in Vegas!!!!  Screw the shows!!!! Screw the lights!!  I'll go back to Vegas just for Giordanos!!!  Chicago is much closer to me. But I would travel to the ends of the earth and back for more Giordanos pizza!!!  Fantastic!!!!

FA6ZvzrWSf15VkT3BIs15w.text: How this place has 4 stars I'm not really sure. The food was bland and the service was lacking. We ordered a personal size deep dish and were informed it would take about 40 mins as they are cooked when ordered. That's fine. We waited and when it finally came out not only was the crust tough, but it wasn't even hot!  The meatballs were seriously lacking any spices. And the marinara sauce was just ok. We also ordered a cup of coffee which tasted awful. As for the service it was very slow especially considering they weren't even full. A couple behind us ended up in an argument with their waiter due to the bad service and they were kicked out by security. With so many good options on the strip, I'll definitely be going elsewhere next time.

z2KqmvcEsNZmkrKwaa37nw.text: Having never tried Chicago style deep dish pizza, this place was a must! I ordered the medium Chicago classic deep dish pizza, a small extra thin crust chicken pesto pizza, and "the best" tomato bruschetta as a starter.  The medium deep dish pizza was the absolute highlight of the meal. Very generous toppings and portions that was perfect for a party of 4. Was piping hot and ingredients meshed perfectly together in every bite. Loved the texture in the crust resembling a pie. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  On the contrary, the small extra thin crust pizza was easily forgettable. It was super dry and lacked flavor. Ingredients were very sparsed and was quite a let down. Will never order again. Disappointed.   Joined their free loyalty program(G Club) and they offered a free starter with purchase. Picked the bruschetta and it was quite tasty. Only negative was portions were tiny. If it weren't for the offer, I wouldn't order it again.   Overall, I was pleased with my order. Service was A1. It did take around a 45 minute wait for everything to arrive to the table. Ordering online and picking up at the window is also an option. (They don't do delivery at this location). Ciao!

fzASmVs8USiOdy3q6FJLKA.text: Went with the family to Vegas and had to try this spot. The service was great! We wanted a deep dish pizza and they took our order ahead of time while we waited for our table.   Everything was delicious from the food, drinks and friendly service!

Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Special - Deep Dish Large Pizza
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Alfredo

1czcDy0DSUwwyre1X3GN2w.text: If you're expecting a solid pizza, look elsewhere. While we did not get the deep dish, we had the normal thin crust pizza. The pizza crust had the consistency of saltine crackers, basically everything you do not want in a pizza crust.  As a whole the quality of food was very sub par.  Someone we were with also ordered a Italian sandwich with Parmesan fries. The fries were clumped together with so much garlic and Parmesan they were not edible.   I did give two stars (if I was grading the food it would be zero starts) based on service. Our waiter was attentive and handled the bad experience we had very well, as did the manager who took 20% off the bill.    As a whole we ordered 3 pizzas, calamari & 3 sandwiches. They only thing that was finished and was solid was the buffalo chicken sandwich.  I would recommend not eating here solely on the product of food.   With tons of cheaper grab and go options I would encourage you to not rely on this place for a solid meal.

baLYM5u3VwZ3VNq9Dgra7w.text: Great food.  Big portion.  Our group had the 12" meat pizza, the special, individual thin crust pepperoni, and kids spaghetti.  All food was great.  Kids loved the spaghetti that we had to order another one.  little Kids ate up thin crust.  Big kids gobbled up deep meat pizza.  I liked the special better than meat though both were good.  I had 3 slices and was done.  Host took an order for deep dish when we arrived but it still took bit of time for it to come out.    Where we were sitting on 2nd floor, we were able to see the Bellagio fountain show but show wasn't the same without the music.  And everyone was hungry to even notice.    Definitely will come back when we return to Las Vegas.  Next time, Italian beef sandwich along with deep dish.

E-IEKAseYc2t6f5BaR0Acw.text: This review is only for takeout. I was in Vegas for work this week and I LOVE Giordano's, but dairy does not love me, so I wanted to eat my pizza somewhere where I could run to the bathroom after if needed. They have a takeout stand in the Grand Bazaar shops, which was perfect because then I brought my pizza back to my hotel.  $10-11.90 will get you an individual pizza of your choice - I opted for pepperoni. I asked if they could do a mushroom pizza instead and they said yes, but it was 30-45 minutes and I didn't want to wait. They have cheese, spinach, pepperoni, and sausage options, all ready to go. They also have bottled water for $1.65 which is probably the cheapest you will find on the Strip.  My pizza was still mostly warm-ish when I got back to the hotel which was also nice. The pepperoni was a bit spicy but overall it was very tasty.  Hoping to do dine-in here at some point - they have both an outdoor area and indoor - but since I was by myself this time, I just wanted takeout.

PXg3JLTbvR0EC3ho7Qzvug.text: We tried the deep dish pepperoni pizza. The pizza was ok. Nothing really exciting. There were very few pieces of pepperoni. I might have expected a lot from this place and this was my first time trying here. The price was ok and the service was good.

i4Lnfstszy07z55b9ZEIUQ.text: We ordered the Chicago classic thin crust pizza. We were told it was going to be 45 minutes. I'm expecting great pizza at this point. Service wasn't bad for a busy time.  Luckily the pizzas came out in maybe 15 minutes because we were hungry. The toppings were good. The crust and dough used was just not good.  It was the kind of dough that tasted like pizza you would get from the frozen sale pizza section and wonder why it's on sale.  Because it bakes quick in the oven. It didn't feel like I got the real deal.  Sadly, it did not meet my expectations of a real classic pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicago classic thin crust at the outdoor bar - fake crust

jEN-9KsriuACYb4DkxG4fg.text: We walked by this place several times on the strip.  Each time the pizza looked good and smelled delicious  as people were eating on the outside patio.   What we ordered: The meat pizza deep dish style for 2-3 people, 6 slices.  The serving size was just right.  We were able to eat only no more than 2 slices each with 2 slices left over.    Price: Less than $33.  Taste: I love a good doughy pizza and this was it!  It was cooked just right where it didn't taste raw.  The amount of cheese on the pizza was great too. If you're a cheese lover you'll love eating this when its fresh out the oven.  There was a lot of meat toppings.  I was skeptical paying so much for a 6 slice pizza but we will be back when in Vegas again.   *** TIP: Please be aware it takes 45min-1hr for your pizza to be ready.  My suggestion is to call in your order or place your order while there as a to go order.  By the time you arrive it will be hot and ready and you can eat it there or else where.  But remember it's hot sitting outside. Or you can walk around for a bit and come back.    Environment: This location is outside with a roof covering but no windows or fans.  Just outside air.  Great place to eat at once the sun has set.  When we were there it was 97 at 11pm and it was hot.  It was clean. Lots of seating. Great for groups of 2-6 people.   Service:  The staff was friendly.  We found out they have a second location that's an actual restaurant and it's indoor.  The staff has to rotate being in the outdoor location.  Please be friendly to them, it's so hot outside and they still have a good attitude.   Our server was awesome.   We recommend this place to anyone who loves pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super cheesy. Straight out of the oven.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep dish meat pizza. $28 for 6 slices.  Feeds 2-3 people nicely.

2J90R-msEH-U-OrOEaevBA.text: Truly enjoyed my experience at Giordanos!  Since the pizza is deep dish it does take about 45 minutes to cook. However, there is a thin crust pizza that takes just about 25 minutes. I ordered the deep dish pizza with a sampler. The sampler was delicious and a great choice if you're really hungry and want to have a little something to eat while you're waiting for your food.  I ordered a small deep dish pizza and shared it with one more person. This was more than enough pizza and we still had extra to take home. The pizza had so much cheese and it tasted so delicious! Definitely one of my new favorite spots for pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1un4FgxHC2VfKelQrZ2eDA.text: I brought my group of 10 along with me on a Yelp adventure for lunch. Luckily the group agreed to tag along. We were seated quickly for an afternoon hour lunch. There are several options to dine here. You can place an order to go at the window downstairs, or there is an open-air patio in the bazaar with lots of misters to keep you cool. When it's 105 out, I recommend sitting inside. The view of the strip is nice. You will not be directly on the strip. It is on the upper level of the Bally's entrance.   If you are familiar with Chicago style deep dish, then you will be accustomed to the 45 minutes to 1 hour wait time for your pizza. We were hungry, so I had to order some wings to hold me over. Ordered them plain with sauce on the side. Not bad. Several of my friends ordered sandwiches.   I placed an order for the large Specialty pizza that can feed about 4-6 people. I would say more like 4-6 very hungry people. There were about 10 slices and they were thick and full of goodness. The difference between the Chicago Classic Pie and The Specialty is Sausage. If you order the Classis it will be full of pepperoni. Since I was paying for the pizza, I made sure to grab the biggest slice of the pie. I was very impressed with the texture and the slice's ability to stick together when I used the pie server for my slice. I have seen Chicago style pies fall apart as soon as they are picked up. I like to wait about 5-10 minutes after they bring it out, in order to give the cheese a little time to thicken up.   I felt like I was in the sharing mood, so I offered up some slices and there were only a few in my group that took me up on the offer. I think they were full of their sandwiches or they are more like fools for skipping out on some this Chicago style goodness. I had one slice left and decided to take it with me. There was a gentleman walking on the street (I presume he was a transient) who asked me for a slice of pizza, and I thought to myself, what would a Yelper do? That's right, we do the right thing and share the goodness of food, so I gave him the slice.   Of course, this place is pricey for some. Don't come here expecting $1.99 pizza slices on the strip. The large specialty was about $38. Pitcher of beer, go ahead and add on another $20. Overall, it's a cool place and the service is great. The bartender shortchanged me on my pitcher and before I could open my mouth, she told me the keg ran out and she will bring me a pint of beer to make up for it. That's some great service. Our server was nice and did a good job managing my group.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Chicago Classic. YUM!
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Chicago Classic, $25.
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid&#39;s buttered spaghetti noodles. Pasta was cooked perfectly.

UOiL3X9O_5NQtCVu5FZZ8Q.text: My favorite deep dish Chicago pizza I've had in my life. Granted this location is not as good as the original Chicago location its the closest thing to it that I've had anywhere else. The famous cheese pull is my favorite part leading up to the amazing devour that follows. Everything about Giordanos pizza is great, the sauce, the cheese and the toppings.   I highly suggest when coming here if you've never been before, order a drink and or appetizer right when you sit down because the pizza takes about 45 minutes to be ready and on your table from the time you order. Also the portions can be deceiving if your use to a regular pizza place. A small is plenty for 2 people and a medium is plenty for 3 people. It's extremely thick and packed to the max so you'll be pretty fully off of two slice and very full off of 3. You've been warned lol.  Enjoy

DgsTPtQtrux_rwRP_OrE0g.text: Probably my favorite pizza spot on the strip! I have several items on the menu and it does not disappoint! I like that they offer family style plates which is definitely enough to feed a crowd.   Why the 3 stars?? Well, the service, I wanted to find excuses for the girl, but it just wasn't justified.   Our drinks took a while to come to the table, she took our food order and got then got our item wrong. My brother in law ordered the lasagna and it never came out, he also ordered a salad and brought out the wrong one. They never even asked which salad he ordered so they can correct it.   When it was time to pay our check, it was all incorrect, she attempted to fix it, but when it came out the 2nd time, it was still incorrect. At this point we were over it and and just wanted to pay and leave.  Being that my family was in from out of town and they love this place, I'm disappointed on the lack of customer service. I feel like if we are going to pay that much for food (it is a bit pricey, but it's on the strip and the food is great, you get what you pay for) they should have left happy.

One slice was enough for one person. The pepperoni seemed a little under cooked but with the melted cheese and sauce you almost didn't mind it. Overall a great experience.

ezQHqqL9mxTzjIcNcsOZ3g.text: Holllyyyyy shit i hate deep dish pizza but I WILL BE BACK FOR THIS!! Insanely good!! Best I've ever had!!!!  Saw reviews for this place and decided to stop by! We ordered a small deep dish with beef and green peppers and ordered a lasagna....  The pizza was DELICIOUS. I am absolutely SHOCKED at how good it was. It was unique and i couldn't stop eating it.  However my one star is deducted because of how bad the lasagna was. Probably one of the worst I've ever had. It had NO taste and was very bland! Honestly forced it down my throat so i didn't waste it and i threw away the left overs. I don't know how it's possible to taste so bland!  I'm pretty bummed that i didn't order a bigger pizza and skip out on the lasagna. DO NOT ORDER THE LASAGNA PLEASE. I'd come back just for the pizza! Amen.

oZqJy1csmk1SZFa31Zbdig.text: We ordered the Chicago Classic which consists of pepperoni, mushroom, bell peppers, and onions. We waited for over 45 minutes, which we were aware of, but it came out warm. It was good and hit the spot, but it was not the best.   It was a decent deep dish pizza with great service but I like piping hot pizza and this wasn't it.

nwQPWkq7I25mjsTfQj63Og.text: Reasonably priced, great location, and great food. The main dining room is located on the 2nd level just up the escalator towards Bally's. They also have a large patio area in the middle of the main walkway at the Grand Bazaar shops at Bally's. If you are in the mood for some Chicago style pizza and Italian food on the strip, this is the place to go. We didn't opt for the deep dish because it takes 35-40 min to come out of the oven and we were in a rush. We ordered a large "The Special" thin crust pizza and  family style salad, spaghetti with meat sauce, and lasagna. This was more than enough to feed seven people. The food tasted great - super gooey cheesy goodness. Pricing was reasonable by strip standards, and the main dining room even has a view of the fountain show over at the Bellagio. Overall, a nice option if you are center strip and looking for some reasonable priced and good food.

wDbznKaF1k6HuryQjV8Kww.text: Our last night at Vegas we decided to go to Giordanos. We were greeted immediately and seated right away. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We had drinks, salad, appetizers, pizza and deserts. We had a great time. When the pizza came out, we were floored. I'll just say that this is the best pizza I have ever had hands down! No one else that I have tried compares. The sauce is perfect, the pizza is cheesy/gooey, and the crust, my goodness! They have several different toppings to choose from. Oh, the rest of the food was excellent as well. If you find yourself in Las Vegas, this is a must stop place!

5JBcERsMo5O8IDsa0ipGdg.text: I absolutely love this place. I just wished that it wasn't on the strip. I would order here often, but I don't like dealing with traffic on the strip. I had their house salad and of course their deep dish pizza. Reminds me of Blue Line Pizza in Campbell, CA.  I highly recommend this place to those who love pizza like I do! Located in Bally's. If you do decide to come here have a few slices for me :-D

j0zqdXMUf72GwcoGXlSUDg.text: Great pizza, I have eaten there in Chicago and no one else makes a better pizza. The Las Vegas location is just as good as eating it in Chicago itself. Very good deep dish pizza it does take a while to cook so make sure you have enough time but it's worth the wait. They have a upstairs dining area, a takeout area, and an area with the bar in the shopping center which makes it convenient.  3 options for a great Chicago deep dish.   Wings are good and help with the wait.
