b-E7viPcT3pkXfxLmwUpTg.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!  We got married in Vegas and planned ahead to have dinner at Giordano's after the ceremony. We had a semi-private area with plenty of space for our 20 guests. The bar manager and our server were incredibly attentive, the food was amazing, and the whole night was flawless. We are so appreciative of everything and so happy that we chose Giordano's for our event!

1gVT2v69JNw5zcvFWiE14A.text: Had a very good experience at Giordano's Pizza. It only took us about 20 minutes to get seated at the table, and we also pre-order the pizza before we went to our table in order to expedite the process of obtaining our food.  The pizza we went with was the meat and more meat, AKA meat lovers Pizza. I also tried their soup of the day which was okay, I forgot the name of the soup.  Unfortunately even though we ordered the pizza in advance, we still didn't get it until about an hour after we sat down. So it took our Pie about an hour and a half to finally make it to us total.  Of course it was worth the wait in the end, even if it was a little longer than we had hoped. The pizza came out fantastic and two slices definitely filled me up haha.  Afterwards I ordered the Apple Pan pie, but unfortunately they were out for the night just my luck. I then opted instead to try their salted caramel cookie, and it was good. Reminded me a lot of BJ's Brewhouse Pizookie, but I would say that it was better than BJ's Brewhouse is pizookies.  Our server was incredibly kind and attentive, she made sure to consistently check up on us and ensure that all our needs were attended to.  The bathrooms were also well-managed, clean and smell nice.  The Acoustics inside the building itself or rather garbage, however as it's a sports bar style restaurant it's not too surprising.  4/5  The only cons being the wait and the requested dessert not being available.

kqgxVRNnvbqX2Sx9QR8Nrg.text: We ate outside on a Thursday night. Everything was ok except for the pizza crust which was inedible. It reminded me of old freeze burnt store bought pillsbury dough crust. Couldn't eat the left overs. It was late and if we can do it over we would go some where else.

AlzSghLbkxSQ64-LuIC44A.text: Super delicious pizza! The atmosphere of the outdoor bar area is very nice and I will consider returning to eat there in the future.   The small is good enough for 2 people to share for 1 meal. My girlfriend and I ordered a large and basically ate it for 3 straight meals. Dinner, late night munchies, and lunch the day after.   These pizzas take time to make so I recommend ordering in advance through Yelp and picking up. Give it about an hour to be ready. Easy walk from Bally's and neighboring casinos.

wOWCmzzOD7lCpgKj4eunxQ.text: Sever was friendly, they said the pizza was going to take 45 min but they brought use the wrong pizza and when they fixed it they just add the topping on top of the pizza and it look like they just threw it on there I had water and it was empty most of the time didn't really keep it full. Would not recommend it to anybody

EbLN9hrqGsER4w8esl6J6w.text: Drunk at 1am found myself at Paris and saw a big ass neon sign saying "Worlds Best Deep Dish Pizza" absolutely yes!! The atmosphere was fun and casual it is sort of an open/patio style restaurant. Why I loved it cause I wasn't in the mood to sit down and eat so I was able to order online, take the 45min wait time to enjoy beer or cocktail at the bars next door they are cheap and pretty good! uAgzlJCW8EFOVjCMkX9DAw.text: Ordered pick up online to watch playoffs 10 percent off!!  Large pizza and wings with excellent dips   Extra Meat sauce was delicious   Plates and extras at no extra cost   Easy, worth the price and very tasty

eLvuIEBjVU9qXMCjKCe1kQ.text: Delicious personalized pizzas and really really fast service.   I came here on a Friday during lunch time and decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was really friendly and took my order right away. I was parched so I ordered a soda first before ordering my pizza. The bartender was so nice that he must have refilled my drink at least 5 times during my whole meal.   I ordered my personalized deep dish pizza and the bartender warned me it was a long wait around 45 min. I told him I was okay with the wait. Not even 15 minutes later he came out with my personalized pizza. I was so shocked at how fast and efficient their service was. The bartender made great conversation the whole time I was there.   Altogether great service and yummy pizza. Great place for a bite for lunch.

slwqba3iQGFXyCWQHkD2bw.text: Be prepared to wait 45-60 minutes for a deep dish.  We were OK waiting but others may be surprised. The service was a little slow and you need to be aware that this is an open air dining experience on the Vegas Strip and all that comes with that. I've had Giordanos in Chicago and I love True Chicago deep dish so this was a nice treat but doesn't transport one to the Windy City. The pizza was exactly right, could've come from a Chicago oven, the dining and service was more Vegas and after several days wears down on me. I'd go back if I wanted a good pizza in Vegas but I'd prefer Giordanos open an actual restaurant with a room service option.

VaQu-BIztzthtp0Dqg6K2g.text: Amazing.  I hate a lot of cheese on pizza. But this place is  the only exception. I got a deep dish, spaghetti, and ceased salad. All we're exceeding expectations, and I was thinking it would be 4/5. I am stuffed and can't stop eating until we had to leave.

3BFIFi8e78DJ88T85MfisA.text: This place is amazing! Whether you're coming here for a deep dish, thin crust or any other items on the menu! This is a must! Now that i know it is here i will be coming back every time i visit Vegas! It's only in Vegas and Chicago. What i found was pretty neat is that you can order online and have the pizzas delivered right to your home and you cook it. The staff is friendly and on top of the service. What i thought was neat about the pizza is they put your toppings under the cheese. I can't wait to go back and have it again!

I first tried this joint on my first trip to Chicago. I was about 15 maybe, I don't even know who took us there but it was love at first bite   I couldn't believe how amazing it was. UUPlfITz5xaRPhqkYyMVJA.text: Deep dish pizza is my favorite kind of 'za so I knew I had to check this place out while visiting Vegas. The bf and I arrived early Thursday evening. We chose to eat outside so we could people watch and enjoy the nice weather. We ordered an entree Caesar salad to split and medium original cheese deep dish pizza as our entree. Salad was good, the dressing was really creamy. Our waiter was right when he said the medium may be too big for two people. So. Much. Pizza. The pizza came out hot and was oozing with cheese. The crust was a little too flaky for my liking, but still enjoyable. The deep dish pizza takes 45 minutes to prepare so plan to spend an hour or two here.

8F3HGVb1lbjt50hUlOYhoA.text: I am a huge fan for Chicago deep dish pizza so I had to come here while staying in Vegas. It's located just a few feet down Flamingo Road from the Las Vegas Blvd strip. Close to Bally's. Anyway there's an outside location which is very hot with no AC. And then there is the restaurant upstairs.  From the first floor it looks closed. They should really have signs to tell people to take the escalator upstairs. Ordered the sampler plate, house salad, classic deep dish and sangria. Sampler plate was just okay, tasted like a bunch of microwaved things you would buy at the grocery store. House salad was fresh and tasty. Sangria tasted good too. The pizza was the usual deep dish, but the sauce lacked flavor usually found in places liked Gino's in Chicago, Zachary's in the Bay Area, or Masa in LA.

8OvvK2mLAIIP1W0HJt4ZMQ.text: This is the 2nd Giordano's I have ever been to - the first being in Chicago. I was so smitten with my first experience that I couldn't wait to come back to Vegas and get me some!  Well...that wasn't quite the case.  I was staying at the Bellagio so I decided to try the one across the street. Kind of a weird setup - outdoor seating/bar with the kitchen somewhere offsite. The servers were less than friendly, not welcoming at all. I mean come on, you're in a huge tourist attraction, it would better serve you to at least be fake nice   I was so excited for my pizza, I knew exactly what I wanted. So I ordered my create-your-own. I thought afterwards: I wonder if the waiter knew I wanted the stuffed pie instead of regular.  When I stopped him moments later to confirm, he gave me a bit of an attitude and said, "We don't serve that after 10pm." Well that would have been nice to know, perhaps at least printed somewhere on the menu.  Regardless, I got a "regular" pizza with my usual toppings. It was still good (not the great pie I was expecting) but I was highly disappointed in the service and lack of food options.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going to bypass this establishment and find a Giordano's elsewhere.

l6736sQ4h6xwkxRzYBo_4w.text: Great pizza ! The Mgr and the server with tattoos and the dread locks are amazing ! Great attitudes and super friendly too. The place has lots of history there , pizza was out of this world too.  They even gave my 5 year old some dough to keep him busy. The desert was bomb too. The only thing we you can not charge it to the room but other than that is was amazing. I will definitely be back !

LGjm8A-e_LXiSyb632OJ_g.text: Las Vegas is a melting pot of worldwide cuisine. The City of Entertainment rewards its residents and guests with outposts of  restaurants that serve cuisine from a different part of the world. This includes sushi restaurants, Emeralds from New Orleans, eateries serving lobster rolls, Grimaldi's from New York, and Giordanos from Chicago. Living in Las Vegas it is spectacularly awesome to find out that a cool restaurant that I visited in another city has come to my adopted city. Giordanos is a perfect example. It is hard to believe that it was in July of 2014, when I dined in the 130. East Randolph, Chicago Giordanos. At the time that I dined in the Chicago location, this one was a flowerbed besides the Bally's walkway. In a couple of years Giordanos would follow me to Vegas.    The Las Vegas Strip Giordanos (there is a second Las Vegas location in Summerlin) is truly two different restaurants sharing the Grand Bazaar. At street level there is a 1,178 square foot partially enclosed patio location in the middle of the Grand Bazaar promenade that joins the Strip to Bally's. Nearby there is the upper level 4,000 square foot location above Starbuck's where the top of the escalor transitions into the people mover into Bally's. I have always dined in the 4,000 square foot restaurant.   Upon walking into Giordanos there is the usual friendly hostess. A few times she has nicely informed us of a short wait. In back of the hostess is a plate glass window overlooking the kitchen. There are zero tables overlooking the place where people bring the pizza to life. However there are seats overlooking TVs where athletes bring professional sports to life. This is the bar just past the hostess. Further into the large upper level space that feels like an oversized loft with its warehouse ceilings are tables that overlook a grand view across the Grand Bazaar into the Fountains of the Bellagio. Quite a few times we had been fortunate enough to have this view. Especially taking into consideration that the average wait time for a deep dish pizza is 45 minutes and thin crust is 30. We had yet to sit by the farthest wall overlooking the "Eat Pizza" sign.    Giordanos is a melting pot of delectable dough, sauce, mouth watering cheese that is drooling delicious that you can stretch and hold it. The pizza is the heart of the menu. Giordanos is known for their deep dish pizza. However, I have taken a liking to their thin crust pizza. The thin crust reminds me of the New York pizza that I grew up with. It is a melting pot that is easy on the wallet. One of the many nice things about this place is that the prices are comparable to off the Strip. The small thin crust pie costs $14.25. I will let you in on something. The small pie is genuinely large. There are 12 slices. An added on vegetable costs $1.90 where an added on protein costs $2.85. I always order mushrooms. What surprises me is that I am more fond of the pizza here than I was in their home town Chicago outpost that I rated three stars. Branching away from the pizza, I had tried their Meatball subs with fries. No complaints about it.  With the Chicago born pizza, I order a bottomless Pepsi.    As I said before, the wait averages 30 minutes for a thin crust and 45 for a thick crust. If you are with good company or your device is fully charged the wait will go fast. From my experience the window overlooking the Grand Bazaar to the Fountains of Bellagio or the TVs accelerates the delayed moments. Also speaking from my experience at their competitor Grimaldi's, Giordanos would improve the wait time by serving house bread.   Based on my personal experiences dining in Giordanos, it has been a tasty addition to the Las Vegas melting pot. Never had I encountered a miserable server or poor service. When I have been the mood for Pizza on the Strip, Giordanos is a restaurant that I trust.   Giordanos FTW (For the World).

TDXVZU9x0b0RRI-TzuTXNw.text: We love Giordanos. We have even ordered the pizza from Chicago and shipped to our home. So having this option in Vegas was nice. Also a great change of pace from buffets, steak dinners and fancy places to dine. We sat in the patio area with  great view of people watching and good food. Remember, the deep dish takes extra time so if you don't want to wait around for pizza for for the regular crust. Though I do recommend the deep dish!

bxZoIgK5ZYTWM1xQu-TI4A.text: I love taking my friends here whenever they make a trip out to Vegas. If you like really cheesy, Chicago style pizza, you'd love this! Because this location is on the strip, it can get pretty busy but fortunately my friend & I got really lucky. If you request a deep dish pizza, be aware it can take 45 minutes to an hour to cook.   This is not a regular place I'd go to but whenever friends are in town i usually think of this place :)   Rating: 4.5/5

MgYQWpaVREdfBSlM82qirg.text: I visited Giordanos August 15th and had the best server I have ever had in all my visits here. Jhon was extremely attentive, courteous & fantastic. He was very prompt & accurate with my order. I have visited when they first opened and then 4-5 times a year but each and every time the order was incorrect and/or the server was barely present. I actually never wanted to come back after my last visit last October when my order was entered as a deep dish instead of thin crust & we had to wait 90 mins for a all meat thin crust. After having Jhon as a server I will definitely return & this establishment needs to have other servers mirror Jhon as he is an absolute asset to the business.

a7tfpGsDp763LNwDKP_vuQ.text: This review could've started really bad. We put in an online order and it didn't go through, so we showed up and nothing was waiting for us. Keep in mind that deep dish take 30-45 minutes to make.  We ended up opting for dining-in and this was probably the best decision for our family of 5. We were seated promptly and had an incredible waiter named Dominick. Initially, we ordered a large deep dish with pepperoni, 1/2 BBQ and 1/2 Buffalo wings, and fries, but we wanted a salad instead of the fries. The salad was actually really good, I could've done without the blue cheese, but we had ranch from the wings to balance it our. The Buffalo wings were kinda spicy and the BBQ wings were really good.  Now onto the pizza, we went for half sausage and half pepperoni. I've had deep dish in San Francisco at some popular spots like Little Star and Patxi, but I would rank Giordanos in third place. This isn't saying that the pizza isn't good, but it just isn't as comparable. However, it definitely will meet your cravings and the service here is pretty remarkable.  Overall, we spent $96 including tip, which isn't too pricy, considering we went for wings and a salad as well as all got a drink. A large pizza fed our family of 5 and we had 4 pieces to take home! We will definitely be returning and hopefully we get the same waiter because it was such a phenomenal experience.

0PsF5gTV9prFKD_FwcLM9w.text: We never had deep dish pizza before, so this place was a must-try on our list for Vegas.  The appetizer sampler is big enough to satisfy two grown-ups, so be prepared! I loved the chicken-bites (so well seasoned!) and their bruschetta, so delicious (everything else on the sampler was awesome as well, but those 2 were especially memorable).  Our small deep dish pizza fed us for 2 days (we took it to death valley)!  I love the option of a "build your own pizza", this way everything in there is just the way you like it. Through a glass wall, you can watch the busy workers throwing pizza dough and baking non-stop.  I like that you can ship frozen pizza pies home, but I think it's pretty pricey.   Everyone there was friendly, explained things to us and the food was really good! I'm not a big sports fan and the big TVs are pretty annoying, but for that I brought lovely company to keep myself entertained!

4cttFGSH-79mdvAZbRU_Vw.text: Second time of terrible experience.  Extremely rude staff, with inability to provide basic customer courtesy.    Requested to order the pizza prior to arrival due to 45-60 min prep time.  Their response was "we don't do that".  I asked to confirm prep time, "yes, it'll be approximately one hour".  I asked "I can't order early to avoid the wait?  I'll be there shortly.". Their response "you can wait like everyone else".  Being originally from Chicago, I was extremely disappointed with this as Giordano's is my favorite in the whole world.  This is the only reason I gave this place a second chance.

-vsz6P4coLwcoEBxIMoIzw.text: Amazing service and food! We chose to sit at the bar, and our bartender was super helpful and sweet!! Thank you!! Absolutely recommend! We got "The Special" it was great. A special shout out and thank you to amazing bartender, she advised us that the small pizza was more than enough and she was right! We still have half of the pizza left!

IiIQXZeXVyb2bqbpyMj47g.text: Decided to give this place a try after trying it out in Chicago. And boy let me tell you it's no where near the quality and taste as the food in the original restaurant in Chicago.   It was after 11p so we were seated outside in the smoldering heat. I'd advise they put some fans out there or something. It's kind of uncomfortable to be eating out in the heat.   Our waitress was very polite and professional. I didn't get her name but she was a young blonde from Jersey.   I ordered the sampler, a thin crust pizza, fettuccine pasta and a side or Cesar salad. The sampler was okay. The only thing I liked was the crispy chicken. My least favorite was the cheesy bread. The thin crust pizza reminded me of my elementary school pizza. Tasted like a cardboard box, just like I remembered. I would stay far away from that and judging by the reviews on here I'd probably stay away from the deep dish pizza if you don't want to wait an hour and a half for it. The fettuccine pasta was okay. The flavor of the Alfredo was very bland.   Overall, it wasn't worth what I spent. I'm actually praying I don't get sick from the food and for sudden memory loss so I forget I even came here.  3 stars for my waitress tho, give her a raise!

H6CB9uDMWSWjOAs6mNmMuw.text: Horrible service  it's a shame for your name to wait for pizza 1 and half !!!!   And the manager say sorry when we want to cancel  Horible charge us 40 dollars for drinks !!!!

Keep in mind during an afternoon lunch rush you're going to have a wait time for a deep dish. BUT it is soooo worth it. Be kind to your servers y'all.

Since the deep dish pizza takes an hour to cook we decided to order an appetizer which was mozzarella triangles if I remember it correctly. Then came the supper veggie deep dish pizza after a long wait loaded with cheese and veggies and their flavorful, delicious marinara sauce. We were a party of 4 and had ordered a medium one which serves 8 slices. The pizza is really heavy and 2 slices per person are more than enough to eat. I should say I loved the deep dish pizza and as I meantioned their marinara sauce is so yum yum. It was crispy and cheesy.I enjoyed every bite of it and would recommend you to give it a try too!

Nh7SzT4uQ5Oj4vy9MvQ-9Q.text: It was time for my bi-monthly pizza fix, and I thought it high time to check out this deep dish pizza emporium's fabled "cheese pull" for myself.  So, I came for dinner, with wife, nephew, and future niece in tow.  How long a strand of Mozzarella Cheese stayed intact upon extension was indeed impressive.  But before savoring a pizza, I elected to begin with really cheesy Fried Mozzarella Triangles and Calamari & More: fried calamari, onions and Green Peppers.  The Green Peppers and onion dominated the dish, but it was nevertheless very good served with a mild Marinara Sauce.  Then a fairly large bowl of Chopped Salad was very satisfying, with lettuce, tomatoes, scallions, bacon, red cabbage, pieces of chicken breast, Bleu Cheese crumbles, bits of pasta, peas, and a mild Honey Mustard Dressing.  For my entree I selected a Medium Stuffed Chicago Classic Deep Dish Pizza.  It smoked and bubbled nicely from high heat, and featured a mild Tomato Sauce, tasty pepperoni, real mushrooms, and of course great pulling cheese.  I packed away three slices, gave away two more, and took three slices home for a memorable lunch the next day.    Service was quick and efficient, and the indoor/outdoor setting casual and  comfortable.  Authentic Deep Dish Chicago Pizza can truly be found here in the center of The Strip.

361RclhSgYKjqaNtoRSCvQ.text: I was so excited this was opening up in Las Vegas as the Giordanos in Chicago was an amazing experience. The server took a long time, the pizza was very doughy and in my opinion made different from the original.  The atmosphere wasn't clean and smelled bass. However, we did have a great view of the fountains at the Bellagio. Would not return as I didn't enjoy the service or the food. Good spot for a family lunch or dinner but not as a date.

c2J6jyW8PJd2jj8Aj4-RiA.text: Wow. Giordano's is a food coma inducing dream. I have never had a pizza hit me this hard. A little goes a long way here!  I went with a group, we were seated quickly. The server was a little slow to take out drink order. While she was taking it, we told her we were ready to make our food order. She blew us off with a "no, not yet" and went to service another table.  After we got our food order in it took a while to get food. We did get our drinks refilled in a timely manner.  We had appetizers first. The calamari was good, but nothing amazing. The Buffalo Wings had a good flavor, and they weren't too hot. A great balance.  The pizzas were dynamic (Note: I'm normally a thin crust fan). The deep dish pizzas were delicious. The cheese blend was right on. The sauce was fresh tasting, but not overpowering. The crust was good, but that is very subjective. I like mine a little doughier than Giordano's. A couple slices and you will be filled. Even our most aggressive eaters only got down four slices off a medium pizza.  If you are close, stop in or grab a pie to go. I think you'll be happy that you did!

qvWHP78nnG5JOWhiUm7DNQ.text: I've been to Chicago twice and both times I got deep dish pizza but had not yet had a chance to get to Giordano's pizza there, despite my Chicago friends telling me it was one of the better places to go.  I was quite excited to hear they were opening up one of these here in my hometown of Columbus, OH but when I was on the Vegas strip and saw the advertisement for Giordano's plastered on the side of the building I knew I would not want to wait until they came to Columbus and would be trying them in Vegas for the first time.  Arriving at the restaurant on a weekday somewhere between lunch and dinner meant there was no line or no waiting and we were seated right away.  My first thoughts was how really clean and modern the restaurant looked.   Despite being at an odd time on a weekday the restaurant was still mostly filled.  We were waited on promptly and started out by ordering an order of their Buffalo wings.  A short time later some very delicious looking wings came out and wow, they tasted even better than they looked.  In fact, I'm going to go out on a limb and say these are probably the best Buffalo wings I've had anywhere.  Very surprising as I was not really expecting it.  We went ahead and placed our order for one Chicago deep dish pizza (small) with sausage and pepperoni.  Our waitress informed us the wait would be, at minimum 45 minutes, which i was aware of having ordered deep dish pizza before.  So the long wait for the delicious pizza began.  Normally this is the part where one would drink beer and watch some sports but being in Vegas for a few days I had had my fill of beer so we just chit chatted and waited for the pizza.  While we were waiting the waitress did a great job of giving us refills on our tea and water and the manager, Eric Hamilton, was even nice enough to come and ask us how we had liked our wings.  I chatted with Eric a bit and he had noticed I was wearing a Buckeye shirt so he started to tell me about the Polaris opening, which I thought was nice.  He told us he'd come back and check on us when the pizza came out.    Eventually, right on schedule, about 45 minutes in, the pizza arrive and wow, did it look spectacular!  Eric, the manager, actually came over and got our slices out and that allowed me to take some fantastic shots of all the cheesy goodness.  The first bite of the pizza proved that it tasted even better than it looked and all I could think of was wow, it's a good thing Giordano's is coming a ways away from where I live in Columbus or I'd be eating this a lot more often than I should!  It really was just that great.  The cheese was plentiful, it was very saucy and the sausage and pepperoni were just amazing.  It was everything I had expected it to be and more and we were very happy with it.  The Chicago deep dish is so much more filling and we couldn't actually finish the entire small pizza, so we took the last slice with us to give to a lucky homeless guy.    The entire experience was awesome and I loved all of their food.  We will definitely be going to check out Giordano's once it comes to Columbus, this spring, and I'd highly recommend it to anyone who has the opportunity to try it. Just a tip too, there is a Giordano's bar on the street that we were not sure if they served pizza or if it was just a bar.  You can get pizza there, we just didn't see anyone getting pizza while we were down there so we went up into the restaurant to eat.  If the weather is nice, give it a try!

6Q1InQd_BWWmPKgDgHzpRA.text: Out walking on the strip in Vegas and came across this outdoor dining spot which looked busy, so we decided to give it a try.  Great deep dish pizza!  We each had a nice Caesar salad which was fresh and a decent size, and shared the small deep dish special.  Very filling and delicious!  We couldn't even finish the pizza. Service was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Special - small

UMXVGskGraze0dtS7HzlUA.text: It was a glorious Easter Sunday. Jesus had resurrected from the dead, and heck, I was even willing to give Giordano's another shot despite the last subpar experience. That's right. Even after I said that I would rather have BJ's deep dish pizza than eat this again.   My wife and I started off with a couple appetizers including the Caesar salad, Bruschetta, and Calamari. The Bruschetta was the steal of the night, quite possibly the best Bruschetta I've ever had! It was toasted flawlessly and topped off abundantly with mozzarella cheese and diced tomatoes drizzled with a balsamic reduction. The tomatoes were so robust and flavorful, and my mouth is watering as I'm writing this review. The Caesar salad was also a great starter, light and refreshing, and the ingredients were all very fresh. The calamari was battered to perfection, and the marinara sauce was rich and tasty. What puzzled me however was that there were fried green beans and lemon peels in the calamari dish as well. The lemon peel was very unique, unlike anything I've ever had; it tasted like a lemon chip with a zesty kick at the end!   On to the pizza. For those of you who haven't had Chicago-style deep dish pizza, don't come to Giordano's expecting a traditional pizza where the dough is soft and fluffy. An accurate description of their deep dish pizza would be somethin more along the lines of a pie, a savory one that is. Last occasion, my wife and I tried "The Special" stuffed deep dish pizza, but this time, we decided to go with a classic deep dish pepperoni sprinkled with some garlic. And oh boy, the pizza was freakin delicious! The marinara sauce was so much more delectable this time, and the crust wasn't as hard nor fragile. The cheese was super cheesy and gooey, and the garlic also really enhanced the overall flavor of the pizza.   Lastly, we concluded the night with an order of the cannoli, and to put it simply, it was interesting. The fried shell had the texture of an egg roll or fried wonton, and the cream inside the shell was like a whipped cheese. It's not sweet so they drizzle some dark chocolate syrup to give it some sweetness. I enjoyed it, but a great addition with the cannoli, in my opinion, would be a scoop of vanilla ice cream (even though it is not traditional in any sense lol).   Giordano's, I just wanna take my hat off to you guys, because I was thoroughly impressed with the food this time! The service was also impeccable despite how busy the restaurant was. You guy have proved me wrong, and I can't wait for my next visit! (And for that Bruschetta)

WZPWDYLGSFYHh-7BunXJnQ.text: Despite the awful quasi-hour wait in the hot sun, the pie was delicious. Less salty than Patxi's, fresher tasting than Zachary's, and less cheese-laden than Lou Malnati's.  Prices are all parity among aforementioned.  Chicken sausage small deep dish. Currently, one cannot order from either phone or online, this location only.  Fan of the accoutrements handed out with takeaway order, including the design on the plastic bag, the pie spatula, quality of paper plates, Parmesan packets, etc.  Can mail order for del to one's home addy as well!

KiaqSUAZb3zvOmLpi1u_FA.text: The service here was incredible! Evan the manager went way out of his way to help us get to our show on time! On top of the service, we had the best pizza, ever! Thanks so much for all that you did for us!

dC8jrhssCKJM93LjfKqmyA.text: The pizza was awesome! The wait not so much, we were told it would be an hour and a half which is fine. We people watched as we waited for our order then when people around us started getting their order when they came in after us we started getting irritated. Our server ended his shift and didn't pass us on to another server. So after waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes we finally got our order. The deep dish pizza was delicious and it was worth the wait.

1fko-0MBHZtDSy1Je9gR-w.text: The stuffed spinach pizza had been my favorite for over 30 years.  So happy they are finally in Las Vegas.   Taste just like Chicago.   Plus a great view and Craig is an awesome server!  This place is had great pizza

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QPu7TnrJElX-i7kvqbQnGw.text: First thing that comes to mind when I think about this place is SALT! We got the sampler to start and every single thing was extremely salty. Even the ranch tasted like a salt lick. When it comes to the pizza, I was extremely disappointed. The crust was dry and crispy but not in a good way. It's reminiscent of the crackly dry crust you get off frozen pizza. Toppings are extremely thin and lacking. Prepare to go mining through the mozzarella to assure yourself toppings were added.  Service wise, the server was attentive and went through the motions. We had better experience from the host and the busser. The bussers did an amazing job and provided a more memorable experience. Would I ever come here again or recommend it to someone else? No; no I wouldn't. This place is a pass. Find something else if you want a good meal.

h4-9t6On1hqibv0hw4iAvg.text: all I can say is yummy! So happy my fave Chicago place is here!  Yummy deep dish! Cheese on cheese on cheese!  First time coming and great service:) manager walking around checking on everyone! It does take 45 min for the pizza to come(the serve let's you know that when you order it) so worth it! Some things are a little different form the ones in Chicago-but still amazing! It's hard to have the same pizza out here when it's not Chicago! Cool fact they did tons of tests to get the water as close as possible to Chicago water-so that it tastes as amazing as Chicago!  Great place!

n6UZumsYryZlTx8jXGRMPQ.text: soooo yummy. first time trying deep dish pizza ever and glad this was where we went. there open late night on weekend and have to go! however i wish we couldve been able to order a large instead of several individuals after 10. also if they offered delivery that would be amaze balls but then again the strip is horrible to drive on so i cant blame them.

yOID0olpN0kHtLgKaajOiQ.text: The best deep dish pizza I've tasted! The resto is in good location. But the staff at the entrance getting your name for tables are so clueless and kind of unprofessional. They need more training on how to deal/ greet customers. Also, the wait for the deep dish pizza is about 30 to 45 min ! So don't come here hungry or you'll lose your patience. But 1 thing for sure, the DEEP DISH PIZZA is worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qknci61-xwGq-lkbbY95UA.text: Ok tried the famous deep dish of course, inflated strip prices. They're open late and went to the take out window and picked up a personal size pepperoni. It was good but no wow factor. The pizza wasn't greasy at all, had a flakey crust good balance but wouldn't pay the inflated prices for a full pizza. Many off strip pizza joints that are cheaper and better tasting. It's convenient but $11 for a dinky 6 inch Personal pizza. That  price will get your a medium at most pizza joints. Very skimpy on the pepperoni also.

igwjTn9VZ7WMN5XCHhVA0A.text: Stopped by for lunch and it was great! Service was excellent. The thin crust pizza was wonderful, hot, tasted great.   Everyone seemed to be having a good experience!  Will go back for another pizza!  Thanks

o6qHA4BoHCjlPwxusry38w.text: I'm from Chicago and I'm happy to say that this Giordano's Pizza tastes just like home.

cU6cm-fOoJjb3BlfmszeTw.text: Good pizza. GREAT service. I've been to Las Vegas more than a few times now. I just have to mention that Dominick L was the BEST server I have ever experienced the. This Chicago area staple has found a jam in the desert. My son, and I visiting from the midwest were looking for a good pie for our 1st night in town. I was surprised, as he also was to find Giordano's. Honesty I could just stop about the food. Yes we all that have ate there know the pie is good. Dominick is truly the review here. In s city full of want to be stars, he truly shines like the 5 Star employee/person he is. I would definitely return. I recommend that you do. Make sure you ask to have Dominick as your server. He makes you feel like you are his only priority

97a7cFKPBqHtlUWsyXMTog.text: Ok, this review is more of a complaint and more of a review on staff (one paticular staff member that is). Wife, son and I were on our way back from the strip and were going to meet our friends at this place for a drink and pizza at i guess would be considered the bar area (we saw people with food and drinks on their tables). Well, the waitress (short hair red-head gal behind the bar) just had the nastiest personality. When we arrived our friends were sitting at the bar and approached to give them a hug. At that time, our friends called my son over to give him a hug as he was getting ready to be stationed to a military base on the following day. My son (19 yrs old) went in and our friends were about to give him a hug when that aforementioned gal began to scream, "are you 21?!". I attempted to explain to her that he is merely here to allow our friends an opportunity to give him good wishes on his journey. Well this gal did not want to hear the explenation as she stated in an angry tone, "well he can wait and say goodbye on the outside of the bar". We all looked at her like are you serious right now? I tried telling this lady that wife and i are planning on staying, but our son is gonna say goodbye and head back to the room. She still did not want to hear it as she said, "he can do it from behind thw line" as she pointed outside of the bar area. We tried to ignore her and my son said his goodbye's and began to leave the area. Well, our friends were like, "so you guy's going to sit and have some cocktails with us"? We said , "hell no", sorry but we are going with our son back to the room. As we left the area i looked back at that nasty attitude of a lady and fake smiled at her while waving and telling her, "you see, that wasn't so bad was it"? He just wanted to say hi and bye. But her nastyness of a person tried to ruin it for him. I just think if it was that big of deal that a 19 yr old was entering an outdoor bar/restauraunt area that the hostess that we passed on our way in would of stopped us and informed us that he could not enter. But whatever lady behind the bar, your ugly attitude can't ruin our trip here but good try. Nonetheless, will not return to this place because would not want to be treated like this again.  This occurred on 10-21-2017 past 9 or 10 pm.

AKXtUyiYC3xozK3n4diZpw.text: Food was excellent. Our server, Cris R, was on his game!!! We had a coupon for a free app so we got the cheese sticks and a small pizza for four of us to split. The Manger, Erica, came over after we waited for about 45 min and informed us that our pizza would be another 10min. We were not in a hurry so we didn't mind. When our bill arrived, we still got our app free and our pizza was 50% off. We did not ask or complain about the wait and we didn't actually mind. It is good to see a restaurant that took the initiative to take care of their customer. We will be back and recommend this restaurant to everyone.

SHmUNQ9fO25nzNfDRZ-quQ.text: If you are missing Chicago... even a little bit... you have to go to Giordano's on the Strip.  The Deep Dish Spinach Pie is to die for.  Carolina was amazing as our Server... they even put the Blackhawks game on for me!  We be back for more!

PklMlrpUVtKduWdWPzgZZg.text: We had a really disappointing experience at Giordano's. We had a larger group and were seated at a bar table with the bartender as our server who got our drinks and took our orders right away, but after forty-five minutes when our appetizers hadn't come out he didn't seem to notice until another fifteen minutes had gone by after that.  It wasn't until we'd been sitting there an hour and a half when he came back and noticed none of us had gotten our food. He seemed like he was busy at the bar, so we didn't blame him, but it wasn't until this point that he warned us about the pizzas taking a while and admitted that it looked like the kitchen lost the ticket.  After an hour and forty five minutes, we finally got a visit from the manager who seemed totally unphased. She barely apologized and reminded us that the pizzas take 45-60 minutes each but didn't seem to care when we said it had actually been an hour and forty-five minutes. She then went and sat down at a table and chit-chatted with another employee rather than go run the restaurant. Another half hour after that, we finally got our food. When she brought our checks, she comped the meals for those of us that ordered entrees but still insisted that it was normal for the pizzas to take an hour even after we explained it had taken two. Eventually she  took the pizzas off the check but still made us pay for our drinks.   So, all in all, it took two hours to get our food (which was actually good) and the manager didn't seem to care enough to even follow through with the kitchen, let alone stand up and go do her job rather than hang out with another employee right in front of us as we all sat there waiting for our food. Truly terrible service that night.

9zCKNhnBAJVOJzP8Fqsytw.text: We first tried Giordano's when we were vacationing in Chicago June of 2015 and it was the greatest pizza on earth. We literally wanted to plan another trip back just so we can eat pizza at Giordano's again haha. Last year while my wife and I were searching for a location near by we saw that they were going to open the Vegas location and we were pumped! This pizza taste exactly the way we remember. The place is beautiful. There are some tv's above the bar and the decor is beautiful. Aside from the pizza, our server Patrick Y was awesome! I was a server for many years so I'm picky about servers but Patrick was right on, we never had to ask for anything because he was already on it lol kinda like a mind reader. Thanks Giordano's and thanks Patrick for making our Vegas experience that much memorable!

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb dot com

tTK_IUyBURgstmvGbTJWzg.text: I first had Giordano's in Chicago and was so in love, I ordered it overnight shipped to Kansas for my birthday. I eagerly awaited the day i could travel back and eat this pizza again.   The first thing I saw on a vehicle as I was leaving the Vegas airport to head to my hotel was an ad for Giordano's! My heart leapt! Not only was the pizza delicious, the guy working the to go window was SO nice and courteous. This was truly the icing on my cake for my trip to Vegas!

tzmSTfWNpCkJCu9IXl-k3w.text: I love pizza, had to come try it! Located in the ballys shopping center, the closest parking to it is located in the Paris hotel or Cromwell. This place advertises its traditional Chicago deep dish pizza, but they also have thin crust, pastas, and various  appetizers available. While I enjoyed the actual pizza itself, I was not a big fan of the crust. The crust came out really flaky (almost like a dry pie crust, in my opinion ) so I didn't care too much about that, otherwise definitely try it! There is inside and and outside seating available

cpMFyPYVqjeDO4f8zP5KaA.text: Fantastic pizza!  Def worth the wait!  It will take 40 minutes for pie.  However when it comes you can taste how fresh it is and made to order.  The service was great as well.  I highly recommend it....

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the mozz sticks. Made with real mozz
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at how fresh!!!&#39;

VaaVsgbrNXGsm1g-kxgNeA.text: Good happy hour food and prices. We ordered the deep dish pizza was good and very cheesy. So happy we have that instead of an Applebee's.

ReKERoWaTZG8fea7In6KBQ.text: Their late hours are amazing to hungry tourists after a late show! Delicious Italian food and the most affordable meal we had out entire stay. We left satisfied and impressed! The waitstaff is very kind!

tlN6aI6_LV8vMTC6tMJ2AQ.text: Food was excellent. We had the chopped salad and the chicken parmesan with a side of meatballs. I have no complaints.

Aqb51S-oxz45UrRmuL85vw.text: Second time at this place. I love deep dish pizza. This place did not disappointment. He service is on par with the Vegas strip. But the deep dish pizza was AWESOME! Takes about 45-60 min to get it, but worth it. I will be coming back.

SdB7QY3wfBaK-YUP8hgzvw.text: Great food and the service was even better. Carolina was super attentive and friendly.  This was a great experience, I would come again.  Thank you!

gjqCwmjLTvwF7YBhvLH22w.text: The pizza is great. We were told 45 min wait and ended up being 1 1/2 hours for a small pizza. I would recommend take out.  The service is awful.  Tried to go 2 times. The first time they only had one server and couldn't take any orders. The next time we placed our order and had drinks delivered by our server. Then didn't see her again. So I had to ask for another drink and our server moved to an inside section.  And she forgot to put the order in. The pizza is legit good but the service/management really don't care because it's on the strip.

2_9vzi5c0vrX_2Ng9OXP6A.text: Brruuuuuh *insert dramatic pause* Dude. Seriously, dat deep dish tho. Brochette was, as it said, best damn brochette I have ever had. We just asked if it's the best and our waiter's accent sold me on it. Just dude sold it.

rEKfDzk8A3sQtsui6G7DiQ.text: Literally waited 1.5 hours for pizza with a crust that tasted like hard bread sticks and pasta that was around as good as chef boyardee. We didn't bother having the bruschetta as they wanted to bring it all out at the same time. If it was worth the wait, fine, but the food was terrible and on top of it the waiter didn't even seem phased by the fact it took so long. Worst thing is my pizza was thin crust and vegan ( so no cheese) and my hubby just ordered spaghetti with tomatoes sauce. No deep dish or anything that warranted a 1.5 hour wait. Go if you have nothing else to do. Will kill your day.

aXjcTxoDIUGJ9OlWqH8S3A.text: Excellent service. We are from Chicago and now local to Las Vegas. Craig was excellent!!!

GZxSXFIDxJhr8gV2Q-uNYg.text: Amazing pizza. This was some of the best pizza. Drinks were very pricey. Service was great. It does take about 45 min to bake a deep dish pizza so dont be in a hurry. Atmosphere is nice.

T9SoX4yXVKQVW358lC7j0A.text: When I heard that my FAVORITE pizza place was coming to Las Vegas I was counting down the days until I can go and enjoy a slice that would take me back to my days in Chicago!  I told everyone I know that they must add Giordano's to their list of restaurants to try this year. The highly anticipated day finally arrived and I made sure that I was there on opening day. Although I did not experience the best service on my first visit, I gave them another chance and everything was great! We had a great time meeting and laughing with the manager Michael and the food was great just like my hometown! Everyone that I have sent to experience Chicago style pizza love it! Now, we just need a location in Henderson!

-Opgv_UKhHHm_g6xjYdhIg.text: Best pizza chicago style in las Vegas   is call stuff deep dish pizza . Love it. Will  come back again and again

Lv9XNEUB01UZRv0-16tGQA.text: Very friendly service.  Visited on a Thursday night..not too long of a wait considering.  We ate outside below the restaurant.  Just remember you will wait about 30 to 45 minutes if you order a stuffed pizza because they take a bit longer to make.

ft7ZkfjVVj8z88HbM4bcRA.text: The restaurant itself was really cute and not crowded at all for a weekday around lunchtime; which was great! We were informed about the wait, if ordering pizza, before we were seated and that was perfect fine with us (approximately 45 minutes).  The waiter was pleasant, we ordered quickly and enjoyed the view of the strip.  We were a little disappointed after waiting for such a long time, that our pizza was cold when it came out.  Its as if it had been sitting back in the kitchen under a warmer for a solid 15 minutes..thats how cold it was.  Needless to say, I think we will skip it the next time we are in town.

0g_cr-nCWvL11XIIjpuODw.text: Great experience! Carolina provided such a comfortable and enjoyable experience. She took care to keep our drinks full and needs met. We all LOVED the food too! The prices were reasonable and the ambiance was perfect.

Mkrh1JKxL65OFQU3HXmuAg.text: You can't go wrong everything is to notch from food to customer service I going to be regular here not saying that just because I'm from Chicago they are really great

sEdgjeSJucJYxMv02qasqg.text: Enjoyed eating here. As soon as we found out Vegas had one we New we had to stop by.  Ordered the deep dish and it's a cheese gusher. Wow! My husband and I love this place.

g6LzZ6lSMZwikLQoKNb4zg.text: I don't know why more people don't acknowledge this place. The pizza is is good. I can't say anything bad about it. It's way better than a lot of other vegas spots. I wish I would have eaten there over other more populate places

94wU56g_m-Rh3m-ewgZGhw.text: Carolina really made our dinner experience above and beyond. Very knowledgeable and attentive. Can't wait to visit again

BfqkCoh3fUji_hfWaahTfQ.text: Carolina was our server. Excellent service and a great atmosphere with nice views of the strip through the window. Overall a good experience.

eCm6gFQtJPi3LxLUWRSn1w.text: I Ordered the Chicago Classic (Small/6 Slices) and Calamari as a appetizer. I thought the food was pretty bomb! My GF on the other hand got food poisoning from something there, don't know if it was the Calamari or her slice of Pizza that had the dough a little raw still. I loved it, she hated it, so therefor I have to give 3 stars.

QEPGlA0iMUl2SHZ4lRE2Ow.text: Their deep dish pizza is to die for! If you get the deep dish make sure you order an appetizer because it takes an hour for them to make it. So worth it! We lived off this pizza for like 3 days because there was so much leftover.

9WmF9MsU9FAQnq2b1mTYOQ.text: Giordanos in Las Vegas was fine. Takeout was easy, but took slightly longer than estimated. The food was good, just like their restaurants in Chicago and Orlando. Will go back again.

GdDj9zJdgGAK6E5KvqYPNg.text: The wait was about 20 minutes with us putting an order in at the bar and then having it served at our table. I didn't like how you were not able to make a pizza half and half without them charging you for extra for each additional item, it was the same if you substituted items as well.

oSzqJ7wGM_Dj-QNgoJZ65w.text: Went to the location by Bally's.  Service was good and it's a great spot for people watching if you like that. Deep dish pizza takes a good 30 minutes.  Pizza was good but not my style of deep dish.  I would go back for sure though.

LrpEj3_KqfZiubOw_Z1uow.text: OMG...YUMMY, YUMMY, YUMMY!  The pizza is so DELICIOUS, I don't even know what else I could say.  Be prepared to wait about 45 minutes for your pizza, but it's totally worth it.  It takes time for a pizza that thick to cook all the way through.  I would also recommend eating in the upstairs section as the downstairs is a bar area and they bring the pizzas down the elevator where they might have a chance to cool off or be exposed to yucky stuff.   Giordanos is an AWESOME addition to Vegas!  I will be back for sure!

GVGDlzzTUS515TUtOctbxA.text: Fantastic Deep Dish stuffed pizza.  Great sauce, lots of cheeze and my favorite - fennel sausage in the middle.  SO good!

3nJEO15haX0nKT7LZGQ-tQ.text: I just flew to Chicago & Back.   Who's ready for a food coma.  This is just absolutely the best deep dish in Vegas Hands Down Now!!!!!

rgRiaAwnrDoyW50jQJNwbQ.text: Pizza was my least favorite part of the meal. Excellent Greek salad and superb IPA on tap, with reasonable prices. Perhaps get something other than the deep dish pizza, which had a strange cracker-like bottom of the crust, though I didn't care for their pizza sauce either. Fun atmosphere and good service, with a great view of the strip no matter what you're drinking or eating.

YdetT5dtPxflGFK1pHFmoA.text: Pizza is great but service is terrible.  Add to that today, I walked four blocks up the strip, went to the walk up window for lunch.  Waited almost ten minutes before anyone even showed up at the window and then told they had none of the personal size pizzas ready.  None. It would be 45 minutes similar to going into the dining room so they didn't even have any started. Obviously that didn't work for my lunch break.   Update: emailed as instructed below six weeks ago.  No response.

GlzRQXtPpXnocFHIj56z4Q.text: You would think that being on the strip they will have food especially given the name of the restaurant and reputation but I am here to tell you that that is not the case. My wings were mediocre the Parmesan garlic fries were dry with no fresh garlic a light dusting of garlic salt and some dried parsley flakes is all you get. Not to mention my wings were cold and just overall lacked luster. At least the waitress was very nice and attentive but that was probably the best part

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jj--Qwv0ecuZQy6RxHVIXQ.text: We had the Meat and More Meat deep dish pizza. The menu says the small serves 1-2 people...it would easily serve 3 it is so filling, but absolutely delicious! Some of the best pizza we've ever had. There's a 45-60 minute wait for a deep dish, depending on how busy they are. So maybe call ahead if you're in a hurry. Next time were in LV we're definitely going back!

VOS0E6uVsLDPSdOaLEH_Cg.text: Staff is very friendly, if you are going to order the original deep dish wich I 100% recommend order as soon as you get there because it take a while to cook. We had the calamari as an appetizer definitely worth a try it's very good. The real star is definitely the pizza even though it's huge a deep the crust is not soggy and you can eat like a normal pizza, so flavorful and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rmKLg2xB7o8ohsieSyZ4uQ.text: Ate here last night with a friend.   Keri was my server. We ordered a pizza. I was very pleased with the food quality. But I have to say I was even more pleased with Keri. She took great care of us.  She was very friendly and had good knowledge of the menu.   Thanks Keri for making our experience a memorable one, and keep up the great work!

8gFYAQejPCtMSC4NhZilQg.text: Amazing,  service,  great food and overall cool atmosphere. I really appreciate the hospitality and all you do! If you come to Vegas you need a Giordano fix!

wgcb_VP3zB5Oqzm1NeeUAQ.text: Oh. My. God. The best part of staying at Bally's. Go a size or two smaller than you would order at a normal pizzeria - slices are huge! I would recommend putting your name in and then walking around the stores while you wait for the pizza to start cooking. It's sooo good. I'm already craving it again.

0zCdyu_Num7L7owURKQZtQ.text: If you've followed my Vegas posts, you know our restaurant choices were all over the place. Guy Fieri's and Hash House at the Linq, Mexican breakfast at Chayo, In-n-out burger. So what type of food were we missing!? CHICAGO DEEP DISH OF COURSE!  To explain, my boyfriend has only had mail delivery Lou Malnati's as far as deep dish goes and he had a hankering for it in Vegas. With seemingly no other sit down pizza places within walking distance of our hotel on the Strip, I decided to stop being a snot who only eats deep dish in Chicago and went for Giordanos. To my delight, it tasted much like it does in Chicago.   The restaurant itself was pretty cool. It was on this mini strip off the strip, with a bar area in a glass enclosure. We took a seat at the bar, ordered a cold local beer and waited the 45 minutes (it just takes that long to cook) for our deep dish pizza. For an appetizer we decided to get the fried calamari and peppers and it was salty, crispy, and very tasty. For our pizza we went for their version of meat lovers with of course, a side of Giardinera pickled vegetables, and ate until we couldn't eat anymore.   Is anything more satisfying than being pizza drunk?  As if the night couldn't get any better, we were able to walk across the street right as the Fountains at the Bellagio were dancing with some sweet jams to complete our evening.   Gotta love Vegas.

WgbzxYjgVRCr8XBSy4qpkg.text: We sat in the outdoor area of Giordano's and it was an awesome experience. We were given the disclaimer at the very beginning that if we were ordering food, we were going to be waiting a little bit longer due to the separate location of Giordanos that we were sitting at that was away from the kitchen. However, that was totally fine because the drinks were great and the bar tender was incredibly friendly and funny and talking with us as my guest and I were hanging out at the bar. When our amazing stuffed pizza came out, it was well worth the wait. The pizza was so good and we demolished it so quickly as a late night snack. I love the fact that they have the slight outdoor atmosphere of seating choices for the restaurant that located away from the hussle and bussle of the busy restaurant.

IP7IVZK5AJ-gDmTl3MwEkg.text: Our favorite pizza from Chicago now in Vegas. Always so delicious. We only get the pizza and cheese sticks, but always so good. Only complaint is it was cold inside and there is pretty much nothing I hate more than eating in a cold restaurant. We were all wearing our jackets and still cold. We asked them if they could turn off the A/C but they said the temp is controlled by Bally's. Other than that, it was great as always.

JaLT5gIhN2Sqa9xx0UlM1w.text: Let me begin by saying, we have eaten at Giordano's in Chicago so this is not our first encounter with the chain. We were not impressed by the pizza there, so we figured to give Giordano's another try here in Vegas but with the non pizza items.   We ordered the lasagna, chicken parmigiana, a cup of minestrone, and a side Cesar salad. We were again, not impressed.  Perhaps the tastiest thing was the minestrone, but every thing else was mediocre. Nothing to sing about or even talk about once we return home. The lasagna was no different than a Stouffer's frozen lasagna I can heat at home. The spaghetti that came with the chicken parmigiana was stuck together (obviously over cooked). 2 stars given because of the atmosphere. The restaurant is a nice setting.  Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice.... you can't fool me again Giordano's!!

D4xBv_vZDMtgJCgghXCI2w.text: The cheese triangles tasted like they were frozen- not fresh. The marinara sauce was delicious. Pizza ordered was the margherita thin crust. The crust was like cardboard. The sauce was good, the cheese was good, it was like basil overload. My husband only ate the parts w the cheese, otherwise it wouldn't have been very good. Not worth the money. I've had better frozen pizza.

qeGFBFHa6RswR5x7d3eSOA.text: Great stuff if your away from Chicago. Prepared just the way they do in Chicago. Seating is actually outside in court not restaurant where they cook pizza but cool bar type atmosphere 45 min wait for pizza but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WMhN62kMa1eApWaUDzgLmA.text: Don't do it!  Horrible experience.  Drinks were so weak we had to ask for replacements twice.  Cheese garlic bread was forgettable.  But the nail in the coffin was the pizza.  After we were not allowed to make alterations on one of the options, and we struggled to eat the pie they gave us we realized why this tasted so bad.  It was served on cardboard - yes - just like you buy frozen at gas station down the street.  It was obviously pre-made, frozen, and cooked after we ordered.  So many options for food in the area I am still sad we wasted our time at Giordanos.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YnhSNG_QkrwXZpmGMPVnbQ.text: I first went to Giordano's in Chicago years ago, and I swear my eyes rolled back in my head. It was the best pizza I've ever eaten. I'm so glad they opened one in Vegas. If you're looking for deep dish pizza, you cannot go wrong with this place.

6-PPbxEPM9ESPXGuXpuv2A.text: We were excited to try Giordanos, until we started waiting for extreme periods of time. Our server also served us tap water! We an clearly taste it because we know how filtered tastes compared to tap. Tap contains a lot of different chemicals that were familiar with. The pizza and the cooks seemed mediocre. The server was also not enthusiastic, seemed she didn't like her job much. Overall a 99 cent experience. Secret pizza at cosmo might be a better choice.

BNBOedguHQPiZoHzVbvNKg.text: We don't indulge in carbs crazy food that often but tonight we decided we would get wild. I have had this pizza in Chicago and maybe 2-3 times here in Vegas. This time when I bit into the pizza the crust tasted like cardboard. Almost like microwave pizza. It almost makes sense since they advertised that they ship frozen pizzas right on the menu. Before I remember the bottom being crispy, but the crust a bit doughy. Now it's just hard cracker bottom and the cheese seems super separated from the crust. It was weird. Whatever. We still ate it. But what's up with that? I ate one piece vs my usual 2.5!

ujTZBxYabO-WDb18V3Yc7A.text: First time here! I don't know how long this place has been here. I don't know if it was here last year when we came for the marathon. Anyway, we found it today! Really enjoyed the cheese bread and deep dish pizza. Our waiter was the best! Danie, hope I spelled your name correctly, was so nice and answered all our questions. He let us know that if we wanted the deep dish it would be a 45 min wait. We were just fine with that. He took it well when we teased him about it taking so long later on when we ordered another drink. When the pizza came he asked if we would like him to serve the first slice. He said some people like to do it themselves. We let him do it. We will be back and hopefully we will have Danie again. Best waiter we've ever had!!

BmZVSGuUfsX8J148SHmUSA.text: They don't take reservations so we waited over an hour and a half for a table and since they encouraged us to pre-order the pizza, we did (while we waited)  but then it took forever to come even after we sat down.  The pizza is outstanding though and was in the end, worth the wait.    ** I am going to update this review later because the manager was kind enough to reach out to me and offer to make right on this.

7tKp8iYFUxOkqq2DFPPCrg.text: Found this place based on the reviews of fellow Yelpers (woohoo for the Yelp community)! Like many Vegas restaurants, we expected a wait for dinner and couldn't complain for just 20 minutes. If you plan on ordering a deep-dish, I recommend ordering during your wait time so it's ready when you're seated! We went with a make your own chicken & mushroom deep dish and some cheesy bread to start. The food was great! My only complaint was the slow service because the restaurant was swamped, but the servers did the best they could under the conditions.

photos.caption: Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Mushroom Deep Dish (make your own)
Photo of Giordanos - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Bread

nZYdG3AXcCfuNpdPwxg8XQ.text: Let me start by saying that my food was good, my waitress was good, but the manager of the location made a horrible decision last night. We will be writing an official letter to headquarters!   I visited with my son, cousin, and family friend. When my cousins pizza came out it was accidentally dropped on him by another waiter. My cousin was burned by the pizza, his new clothes stained by the pizza, and the waiter used his hands to unfold the pizza as if my cousin could still eat it. Our original waitress came out and took the pizza away and put in another order. The manager and our asking if my cousin was ok and apologized but never offered to compensate his meal.   My cousin had to wait an additional 20 minutes for a replacement pizza, while we were all finished with our food. When the bill comes the waitress says we are going to give you 50% off the pizza. Really? For burning me, ruining my clothes, and waisting my time I get 50% off. Oh no no no no! Our family friend spoke up and said he needs to not pay anything considering this inconvenience. We weren't looking for free meals, but my cousin definitely shouldn't have paid anything.  The waitress had to check with the manager to get approval for a free pizza. His final decision was to only remove the pizza charge, but they still charged for my cousins lemonade and calamari appetizer. I will not be returning to this location based off of this experience. I've visited Giordanos in Chicago and wanted my family to have the experience of good food that I had there. It's a shame that a bad call was made to influence our decision to not return.

F8iAsYGhaXKmmsWbUEEDdQ.text: First time trying the pizza here. Awesome. Meat and More Meat was excellent. Meat Lovers meets veggie-haters. 45min wait for their specialty pizzas, but absolutely worth it. Great bar area and seating upstairs, and outdoor and bar seating in the promenade downstairs. Server Will was great. Management is visible and attentive. Definitely worth a return visit.
